The lampad queen can use a single action, which has the concentrate trait, to focus the emotions of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} creature toward a particular emotion, causing it to spend its next turn sobbing uncontrollably, fawning over the lampad queen, or otherwise performing no actions beyond experiencing its emotions. Regardless of the save, the target is temporarily immune to Focus Beauty until the start of the lampad queen's next turn.

Evangelist.name: 颂教魔 Evangelist
Evangelist.allSaves: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Painsight.name: 痛苦视觉 Painsight
Painsight.description: 链魔能自动知晓它们能看到的一个生物是否具有@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]、@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]状态，以及具体的状态值。

Regeneration 10 (Deactivated by Holy or.name: 再生10（圣洁或银使其无效） Regeneration 10 (Deactivated by Holy or Silver)

Unnerving Gaze.name: 不安凝视 Unnerving Gaze
Unnerving Gaze.description: 30尺。当一个生物在灵光范围内结束它的回合，他会把颂教魔的面孔幻视成一个逝去的所爱之人的面孔。该生物必须通过@Check[will|dc:21|options:inflicts:frightened]豁免，否则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}（大失败@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 3}）。

Focus Gaze.name: 聚焦凝视 Focus Gaze
Focus Gaze.description: 颂教魔盯着一个30尺内它可以看见的生物。该生物必须立即尝试1次对抗不安凝视能力的意志豁免。此外，如果生物已经陷入惊惧，并且豁免失败，只要生物处于惊惧状态，颂教魔就对他@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]。在尝试此豁免之后，该生物直到颂教魔的下一轮开始之前都对此能力临时免疫。

Grievous Wound.name: 重伤创伤 Grievous Wound
Grievous Wound.description: 当颂教魔以流星锤打击造成重击时，目标的伤口会格外惨烈且令人晕头转向。该生物会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1}状态，且其从持续性流血伤害中恢复的检定DC为17（若得到特别有效的协助，DC为12）。笨拙状态会一直持续，直到该生物从持续性流血中恢复为止。

Unleash Weapon.name: 释放武器 Unleash Weapon
Unleash Weapon.description: 颂教魔放开手中的流星锤，并命令封印其中的邪窥魔发起攻击。武器脱手飞出，颂教魔可进行至多两次流星锤打击，每次针对20尺内的不同目标。这些攻击计入颂教魔的多重攻击减值，但该减值会在所有攻击完成后才提升。攻击结束后，流星锤会返回颂教魔手中。

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Evangelist.publicNotes:
颂教魔，链魔的非官方特使，漫游在位面最远端，传播他们那种通过痛苦来实现完美的可怕信仰。因此，物质位面上最常见的链魔就是颂教魔，他们领导着一群以享乐和肉体重塑为目的的凡人集会，或担任地下城的狱卒。在那些被地狱势力统治的地区，颂教魔可能会充当副手或顾问，低声吟诵着通向权力的秘密途径，以换取凡人的灵魂或肉体。颂教魔和人类体型差不多大，但他们的血肉已被改造得宛如对贵族华服的嘲弄；因此他们的体重通常在350磅以上。

这些栖身于暗影的魔族——链魔——全都有着一种骇人的执念：通过自残来追寻终极感官体验。链魔只有在向受害者施加痛苦与恐惧、尝试新的酷刑手法，或是将折磨反施于己身时，才会暂时摆脱一贯的冷酷淡漠。它们自诩为觉悟者，超越了道德与凡俗禁忌的束缚；但在受害者眼中，它们只是毫无感情、专施虐待狂式痛苦的折磨者。这些魔族声称在思想、形式和行为上追求绝对的完美，并且它们不承认那些不需要切除肉体或折磨精神的锻炼方式。链魔从极度喜欢施虐或受虐的凡人灵魂中诞生，它们被审判并被送往影界。它们被塑造成各种适合于它们邪恶嗜好的形态，从低级的邪窥魔到制造痛苦和残废的大师邪隐魔。转化过程会进一步扭曲它们的灵魂，其他的链魔会将它们的新成员送到影界数不清的痛苦之室中。

Skull Peeler.name: Skull Peeler

Perfect Camouflage.name: Perfect Camouflage
Perfect Camouflage.description:
Requirements The skull peeler is in a treetop or standing on a tree limb

Effect Until the next time it acts, the skull peeler hangs perfectly still, blending into the treetop surroundings. It has an automatic result of 36 on Stealth checks and DCs to Hide from any creature more than 10 feet away from it.

Snatch Skull.name: Snatch Skull
Snatch Skull.description:
Trigger The skull peeler is using Perfect Camouflage, and a creature moves into a space within 15 feet of it

Effect The skull peeler Leaps toward the triggering creature and Strikes with its tongue. If this Strike is successful, the skull peeler automatically Grabs the target with its tongue.

Anticoagulant.name: Anticoagulant
Anticoagulant.description:
The skull peeler's razor-sharp tongue is coated in an anticoagulant substance that makes wounds it inflicts particularly hard to close.

The DC of the flat check to end the persistent bleed damage from a skull peeler's tongue Strike is 16, or 11 with appropriate assistance.

Skull Peeler.publicNotes:
Skull peelers, despite their ferocious and well-deserved moniker, are considered by many to be downright adorable, especially when viewed from a safe distance. Their soft, dappled brown fur helps them hide in forest canopies, and they have shimmering insectile wings and big eyes that draw in the faintest beams of light. At first glance, a skull peeler looks like a cuddly pet or a wizard's familiar. Any illusions of domesticating such a beast are quickly dismissed upon seeing how a skull peeler eats, however.

Skull peelers have evolved to hang motionlessly in treetop canopies as they wait until appropriate prey appears, usually long-necked dinosaurs but also brachiating primates and large birds. The skull peeler then lashes out with its long tongue, severing the creature's head from its body and pulling the detached cranium back into its hungry paws. It then uses its claws to crack open the cranial cavity—hence its name—before lapping up the tasty insides.

Despite skull peelers' gruesome eating habits, some enterprises and individuals can't resist the urge to add these beasts to their menageries. Fey and other creatures with ties to the First World, such as gnomes, can occasionally coax a skull peeler into a form of domestication. While the adorable beasts can never be fully tamed due to their hyper-evolved hunting instincts, they can be bribed with food and, if kept satiated, displayed on a perch or indoor terrarium as an example of their master's cunning and deadliness. As often as not, these pseudo-domesticated skull peelers end up devouring a guest, pet, or their would-be owner, but this possibility doesn't stop up-and-coming crime lords from attempting to tame the little predators. Skull peelers kept in well-managed zoos fare somewhat better, but these clever creatures don't always stay in their cages, which has led to wild skull peelers in places travelers might not expect.

Phase Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: 青年相位龙施法者 Phase Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: 对抗奥术的全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Shoo!.name: 走开！ Shoo!
Shoo!.description:
触发 一个15尺内的敌人对相位龙造成伤害

效果 相位龙将该生物传送至最多15尺远的地方。目标位置必须为地面且位于无危害的空间。

Unerring Location.name: 精准定位 Unerring Location
Unerring Location.description: 相位龙自动尝试反制任何以其为目标的传送效果（反制环级5环级，反制调整值[[/r 1d20+20 #Counteract]]{+20}）。相位龙也可以选择正常受到影响。其他被同一效果选为目标的生物会照常受到影响。

Dislocating Breath.name: 错位吐息 Dislocating Breath
Dislocating Breath.description: 相位龙吐出一股将生物撕裂的能量旋涡，在@Template[type:cone|distance:30]范围内造成@Damage[8d6[force]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。相位龙可以传送任何豁免失败的生物，将其向任意方向传送最多30尺（若大失败则传送距离加倍）。目标位置必须为地面且位于无危害的空间。相位龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Dislocating Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用错位吐息。

Phase Jump.name: 相位跳跃 Phase Jump
Phase Jump.description:
频率 每轮一次

效果 相位龙传送最多60尺。如果它们正在空中飞行，它们将保持动量，这使它即使没有使用飞行动作，在回合结束时也不会坠落。

Phase Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes: 没有任何地方能限制相位龙，甚至没有任何地方能够长时间吸引它们的兴趣；它们与生俱来的奥术联系使它们与传送和移位魔法紧密相连。作为探索者和学者，相位龙随心所欲地四处游荡，探索新的地点和传送的奥秘。它们常在反复造访的遥远之地建立多处巢穴。除了巢穴中常见的财富外，相位龙更倾向于珍藏旅途中具有情感价值的物品——比如当地特有的珍稀花卉，或当地艺术家的创作。

Icicle Snake.name: Icicle Snake

Icicle.name: Icicle
Icicle.description: Until the next time it acts, the icicle snake appears to be an unassuming icicle. It has an automatic result of 27 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as an icicle.

Icicle Snake.publicNotes:
Translucent and capable of hanging suspended and near motionless, icicle snakes sense the heat of living creatures as a threat and attempt to use their camouflage and chilling bite against foes.

Water elementals that become infused with cold or mist have increased mobility in regions outside of bodies of water.

Brainchild.name: Brainchild

Universal Language.name: Universal Language
Universal Language.description: Anything spoken by the brainchild is perceived by the listener in its native language.

Urban Legend.name: Urban Legend
Urban Legend.description:
A brainchild is sustained only by the reputation that precedes them. Mindless creatures are immune to a brainchild and can't perceive them.

The brainchild's size, features, and items, as well as the appearance of their attacks, match what the foes perceiving them expect. If foes expect to see different things, the brainchild chooses which to manifest. If any creature that can perceive the brainchild believes the brainchild has one of the abilities below, the brainchild has that ability.

A creature can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1xRFPTFtWtGJ9ELw]{Sense Motive} (against the brainchild's Deception DC) to attempt to disbelieve an individual ability. If at any point no creature perceiving the brainchild believes in the ability, the brainchild loses that ability immediately. If foes expect different particulars, such as one believing the brainchild is immune to fire and another believing they're immune to divinations, the brainchild chooses one to have.

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.j2wsK6IsW5yMW1jW]{Tremorsense} (imprecise) 100 feet
  • Immunity to one damage type, magic school, or condition
  • Weakness 10 to one damage type other than mental
  • Resistance 10 to physical damage, with an exception for either cold iron or silver
  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.etMnv73EIdEZrYYu]{Frightful Presence} (aura, emotion, fear, mental) 100 feet, DC 28
  • [[/r 1d6]]{1d6} Extra Damage on Strikes, of a type one foe believes in
  • Additional Spells @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.R8bqnYiThB6MYTxD]{Phantom Pain} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IqJ9URobmJ9L9UBG]{Shadow Blast} at 6th rank

Persistence of Memory.name: Persistence of Memory
Persistence of Memory.description: When a brainchild is destroyed, it returns if anyone still fully believes it exists, re-forming within 100 feet of any believer after [[/br 2d4 #Persistance of Memory]]{2d4 days}.

Brainchild.publicNotes: A rumor can become so vivid and persistent that it comes to life, creating a brainchild—a living illusion that hatches from an intense belief in a remorseless and implacable killer. Often, these rumors are borne from victims of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Jmxru8zMdYMRuO5n]{Vision of Death} spell. A brainchild's capabilities grow when they pursue a believer but deflate against skeptics, making them only as dangerous as one believes them to be. A simple drive to stalk, terrify, and kill propels a brainchild, but the creature might also exhibit other behaviors ascribed to them through gossip.

Change Shape.description:
岚鬼婆变为任意中型类人女性的外貌。这不会改变其速度或其打击的攻击伤害加值，但是可能会改变其打击造成的伤害类型（通常变为钝击）。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]
Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape

Wind Mastery.name: 控风 Wind Mastery
Wind Mastery.description: 岚鬼婆不受无论自然还是魔法的强风影响。

Coven.name: 巫团 Coven
Coven.description:
岚鬼婆将@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Y3G6Y6EDgCY0s3fq]，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.JyT346VmGtRLsDnV]和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.z2mfh3oPnfYqXflY]添加到巫团法术中。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Coven]

Stormsight.name: 风暴视域 Stormsight
Stormsight.description: 风，降水，和云不会减弱岚鬼婆的视力；她能忽视由风暴，雾，降水以及类似情形带来的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]状态。

Storm Passage.name: 风暴穿行 Storm Passage
Storm Passage.description: 岚鬼婆忽视由风，雨，或其他风暴天气造成的困难地形。

Stormcalling.name: 风暴召来 Stormcalling
Stormcalling.description:
岚鬼婆可以举行一种特殊的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.XkDCzMIyc0YOjw05]仪式，无需次要施法者，来改变她所处地点5英里内的天气[[/r 4d12 #Duration Stormcalling]]{4d12小时}。主要检定是@Check[occultism|dc:23]检定，她不会取得比失败更差的结果。

岚鬼婆只能创造飓风，雷暴雨，和龙卷风，但她可以无视当前季节。她也可以平息自然天气事件，但从来不会主动这么做。

Voice of the Storm.name: 风暴之声 Voice of the Storm
Voice of the Storm.description: 岚鬼婆能够用风朝她能看见，且风能够抵达的50英里半径的任意地点传递语言信息。她能够传递安静的低语或大声尖啸，然后决定它在风中是清晰可闻还是难以捉摸。无论是否有人在场听到，消息都会传达到。鬼婆可以使用该能力，来对听到她带有可怕威胁或毁灭低语信息的生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]。

Storm Hag.name: 岚鬼婆 Storm Hag
Storm Hag.publicNotes:
岚鬼婆心狠手辣，是风暴怒火的化身。因自身行径遭人唾弃，岚鬼婆常栖身于自建的孤岛避难所，以威胁手段控制当地居民。与多数鬼婆不同，岚鬼婆对自身后代会流露出真挚的关怀，无论是收养的还是亲生的。然而，任何具备道德观念的子女都不会过上安稳生活，他们终日疲于应对母亲对他人不可调和的暴戾脾性，然后失败。

岚鬼婆的真身形似年迈的类人女性，有着风暴缠绕的白发，闪电般明亮的的眼睛，以及深蓝色的皮肤。她们通常仅在暴怒时显露真身，这使得其本相显得比实际更为骇人。

鬼婆是来历不明的诡异掠食者，最臭名昭著的便是以孩童和年轻人为猎物。她们无一例外呈现女性外貌，在日常生活中通常伪装成凡人女性。她们强大的魔法与操纵手段让让她们能引诱天真脆弱的猎物，在绑架或吞噬之前，先将受害者折磨得体无完肤以满足其虐待狂的欲望。典型的鬼婆皆以虚荣心和控制欲为特征。虽可能存在恶意较弱的鬼婆，但此类存在往往深藏不露，既为躲避冒险者的追捕，亦为逃避其喜爱虐待的亲族。

Phase Dragon (Young).name: 青年相位龙 Phase Dragon (Young)

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: 对抗奥术的全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Shoo!.name: 走开！ Shoo!
Shoo!.description:
触发 一个15尺内的敌人对相位龙造成伤害

效果 相位龙将该生物传送至最多15尺远的地方。目标位置必须为地面且位于无危害的空间。

Unerring Location.name: 精准定位 Unerring Location
Unerring Location.description: 相位龙自动尝试反制任何以其为目标的传送效果（反制环级5环级，反制调整值[[/r 1d20+20 #Counteract]]{+20}）。相位龙也可以选择正常受到影响。其他被同一效果选为目标的生物会照常受到影响。

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 相位龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击和一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 相位龙的打击重击时，恢复错位吐息的使用次数，或恢复一个已消耗的传送法术。

Phase Jump.description:
频率 每轮一次

效果 相位龙传送最多60尺。如果它们正在空中飞行，它们将保持动量，这使它即使没有使用飞行动作，在回合结束时也不会坠落。
Phase Jump.name: 相位跳跃 Phase Jump

Dislocating Breath.name: 错位吐息 Dislocating Breath
Dislocating Breath.description: 相位龙吐出一股将生物撕裂的能量旋涡，在@Template[type:cone|distance:30]范围内造成@Damage[8d6[force]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。相位龙可以传送任何豁免失败的生物，将其向任意方向传送最多30尺（若大失败则传送距离加倍）。目标位置必须为地面且位于无危害的空间。相位龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Dislocating Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用错位吐息。

Phase Dragon (Young).publicNotes: 没有任何地方能限制相位龙，甚至没有任何地方能够长时间吸引它们的兴趣；它们与生俱来的奥术联系使它们与传送和移位魔法紧密相连。作为探索者和学者，相位龙随心所欲地四处游荡，探索新的地点和传送的奥秘。它们常在反复造访的遥远之地建立多处巢穴。除了巢穴中常见的财富外，相位龙更倾向于珍藏旅途中具有情感价值的物品——比如当地特有的珍稀花卉，或当地艺术家的创作。

Poppet Attendant.publicNotes:
Poppet attendants are among the most common form of poppets. Most attendants can be found in creative trades, especially among tailors and cobblers.

Poppets are simple constructs made to assist their creators with basic tasks.

Sling Bullets.name: Sling Bullets
Sling Bullets.description: These are small metal balls, typically either iron or lead, designed to be used as ammunition in slings.

Simple Doll.name: Simple Doll
Simple Doll.description: The poppet attendant looks like an ordinary doll, fooling others into leaving them alone. When they're in their place of business, the poppet attendant can [[/act hide]] without cover or concealment. Once a creature realizes that the poppet attendant is alive, the attendant can't Hide from them in this way again.

Pincushion.name: Pincushion
Pincushion.description:
Trigger The poppet attendant would take piercing damage

Effect The poppet directs the implement to a soft part of its body, gaining resistance 5 against the triggering piercing damage.

Poppet Attendant.name: Poppet Attendant

Dragon’s Wisdom.name: Dragon’s Wisdom
Dragon’s Wisdom.description: Draconals embody the core value of wisdom, and all wisdom is obtained through understanding. If a draconal successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recalls Knowledge} about a creature, they learn their highest weakness in addition to any other obtained knowledge, and any spirit damage they do to that creature becomes damage of their highest known weakness instead.

Breath of Wisdom.name: Breath of Wisdom
Breath of Wisdom.description: The draconal breathes a blast of energy that deals @Damage[21d6[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage to creatures they choose to damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[Refex|dc:44|basic|options:area-effect] save). They can make this efect nonlethal for selected creatures in the area or choose not to damage certain creatures at all. They can't use Breath of Wisdom again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath of Wisdom]]{1d4 rounds}.

Dragon's Wisdom.name: Dragon's Wisdom
Dragon's Wisdom.description: Draconals embody the core value of wisdom, and all wisdom is obtained through understanding. If a draconal successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recalls Knowledge} about a creature, they learn their highest weakness in addition to any other obtained knowledge, and any spirit damage they do to that creature becomes damage of their highest known weakness instead.

Draconal.name: Draconal
Draconal.publicNotes:
Dragon agathions, known as draconals, number among the most powerful of their kin and also the wisest, embodying the wisdom of a benevolent philosopher-king. With their wisdom comes an elevation above material matters, making them the most removed from the troubles and lives of mortals. Draconals serve as the guardians of powerful magic, and they dispense their wisdom in service of the greater good of Nirvana and the celestial planes.

As celestial beings, draconals are opposed to unholy and wicked forces. They're patient and ageless creatures, and their machinations against the forces of evil sometimes move at a glacial pace. Draconals tend to have more immediate and direct impact working as mentors to mortals. They can provide counsel and knowledge to individuals or groups of heroes working against wickedness, guiding the mortals to excise evil with scalpel-like precision. This mentorship also allows a draconal to maintain their focus on planar matters or a larger, long-term plan against evil. Some draconals see the presence of evil as something useful, a motivation to stir benevolent creatures into action. To mortals, this outlook can sometimes appear as indifference, but draconals rarely knowingly allow an evil to grow out of hand.

Draconals appear more draconic than humanoid. They walk on their hind legs and balance on their long, serpent-like tails. Sharp claws tip their scaled humanoid hands. Each draconal often embodies a core wisdom of some kind. This wisdom often affects their physical appearance in distinct ways. For example, a draconal who believes the greatest wisdom is in understanding yourself will likely have refective scales, allowing those who look upon them to see themselves fully. Because of this, draconals come in all different shapes, sizes, and colors.

Stygira.allSaves: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Gem Gaze.name: 宝石凝视 Gem Gaze
Gem Gaze.description: 斯提吉拉将宝石高高举起并窥视30尺内1个生物的心智，将该生物自己的尸体慢慢石化的景象注入到对方的思维中。该生物必须成功通过@Check[will|dc:25]豁免，失败则会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}，大失败时为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}。

Stone Curse.name: 石化诅咒 Stone Curse
Stone Curse.description: 斯提吉拉的爪抓造成的伤口会使肉体褪色，流出的血液也会变成深灰色。每当有生物被斯提吉拉的爪抓打击造成伤害时，该生物必须成功通过@Check[fortitude|dc:25]豁免，失败则会由于肌肉如同石头一般僵硬而陷入永久@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}，大失败时为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 2}。若有生物的生命值被斯提吉拉的爪抓打击降低到0点，并且在对抗石化诅咒的豁免中失败的话，则会被石化。生物花费8小时来经过阳光直接的照射后，能够尝试一次新的豁免来移除石化诅咒的效果，即便该生物已经被石化也可以尝试

Gemsight.name: 宝石视域 Gemsight
Gemsight.description: 只要斯提吉拉手持宝石，他们就能够通过宝石来视物并具有@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.qCCLZhnp2HhP3Ex6]和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.uqlxMQQeSGWEVjki]的效果。斯提吉拉手中没有持握宝石时处于目盲。

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Light Sickness.name: 强光不适 Light Sickness
Light Sickness.description: 斯提吉拉在明亮光照区域中会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}。

Stygira.name: 斯提吉拉 Stygira
Stygira.publicNotes:
这些满身伤疤、没有眼睛的生物形似枯槁的隐士，裹着破烂的布片。它们能掌控大地诡秘的奥秘，解读地下深处的命运之力。在某些地区，斯提吉拉会被当作先知乃至神明一般得到崇拜，然而他们无法赋予牧师施法的能力，也通常不会注意到自己有崇拜者。在其他地区，他们与古代的独眼巨人帝国有着某种奇怪的联系，通常会居住在那些生物在许久之前留下的庞大废墟中。对许多斯提吉拉来说，从古代独眼巨人的马赛克壁画中获取的宝石往往比其他水晶蕴含着更加强大的魔力。

尽管严格意义来说已经瞎了，但是斯提吉拉那坚硬、且伤痕累累的脸上确实隐藏着退化了的眼睛。即便透过脸上的疤痕，斯提吉拉也能够感知到光亮，他们会被这些闪烁着的光芒弄得恶心和分神，因此他们会在日间待在洞穴中，直到夜幕降临后才会游荡到地表世界上。斯提吉拉绝非善类，它们常在途中伏击毫无防备的旅人，将受害者分解为基础化学物质与超自然体液，只为给自身的宝石注入赋予视觉与魔法力量的能力。

Clockwork Soldier.name: 发条士兵 Clockwork Soldier

Wind-Up.name: 上发条 Wind-Up
Wind-Up.description:
24小时，[[/act disable-device dc=22]]，待机

要让发条机械运转，必须由另一个生物用一把独特的钥匙给它上发条。这需要1分钟时间。一旦上紧发条，它们能在列出的时间内活动，通常为24小时，时间耗尽之后它们就无法察觉周围的环境且无法行动，直到再次被上紧发条。一些发条机械的能力在使用时需要以减少活动时间为代价。它们消耗的活动时间不能超过当前剩余的活动时间，一旦活动时间为0，它们就会立即关机。如果不清楚发条机械上一次上发条是什么时候，大多数发条机械的管理员都会在早上8点上发条。

如果发条机械的"上发条"条目中列出了"待机"，则它可以用一个三动作的行动来进入待机模式。在待机状态下，它的运转时间不会减少，但它能感知周围环境（察觉检定有-2减值）。它无法行动，但有一个例外情况：当它感知到有生物时，可以作为反应退出待机模式（并且如果状况合适，则进行先攻检定）。

一个生物可以尝试对上了发条的发条机械进行@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]，解除DC在上发条能力中列出。每次成功的尝试都能减少发条机械1小时活动时间。这对于处于待机模式中的发条机械也能正常生效。

Activate Defenses.name: 激活防御 Activate Defenses
Activate Defenses.description:
发条士兵通过展开一块附加装甲，保护发条士兵自身或由它选择的一个相邻生物。

该生物在AC上获得+2环境加值，直到发条士兵的下一回合开始，或直到它不再与发条士兵相邻（以先发生的情况为准）。一个发条士兵一次同时只能展开一块装甲板。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.ya8r3IdzQ7QGNH8N]

Clockwork Soldier.publicNotes:
这些勤奋的机器不知疲倦地守在指定的岗位上。一般而言发条士兵身高6英尺，由500磅的金属和魔法构成。

发条机械是错综复杂的机器，由技艺高超的工程师精心制造。虽然它们的创造过程包含了一些魔法，但它们本质上是机械，里面塞满了精密调整的齿轮和弹簧，严丝合缝，协同工作。

发条机械内坚固的主发条必须上紧，才能提供装置所需的能量。一些较大的发条机械包含一系列弹簧，用于不同的肢体，每个肢体都需要分别上紧发条。发条工匠在制作发条机械时会创造一个独特的金属钥匙；上发条时通常需要把钥匙插入机器的背面，然后顺时针旋转。更大的发条机构需要更大的力量来转动钥匙，而且通常有更大的钥匙来提供更大的扭矩——有些甚至需要一整队人上发条，而不是单人操作。给发条程序编程需要用到钥匙和能正确设置程序的相关知识，这些信息通由发条机械的创造者或所有者持有。

Soulrider (Monitor).name: Soulrider (Monitor)

Planar Adaptation (Monitor).name: Planar Adaptation (Monitor)
Planar Adaptation (Monitor).description: A spawning soulrider has traits appropriate to the planar energy it's absorbed: celestial and holy, fiend and unholy, or monitor.

Monitor Escape.name: Monitor Escape
Monitor Escape.description: The soulrider's form blurs as it exploits loopholes in the multiverse. It teleports to an empty space within 60 feet.

Tail Thrash.name: Tail Thrash
Tail Thrash.description:
Requirements The soulrider is attached to a creature's soul

Effect The soulrider makes a tail Strike against the creature whose soul it's attached to, then one against another creature adjacent to the original target. These Strikes count towards the soulrider's multiple attack penalty, but it doesn't increase until after the second attack.

Propulsive Launch.name: Propulsive Launch
Propulsive Launch.description: The soulrider Leaps up to 40 feet, then makes a sucker Strike. If it's in the air and not attached to a creature after the Strike, it falls.

Soul Attach.name: Soul Attach
Soul Attach.description: When a soulrider succeeds at a sucker Strike against a target with a soul capable of facing judgment, its sucker attaches it to that soul. While attached, both the soulrider and the host creature are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}, and the soulrider moves with its host until the soulrider dies or the host pulls it loose (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC 15). If the host dies while the soulrider is attached, the soulrider disappears immediately to follow the soul leaving the body. A creature returned to life before reaching its final destination generally returns with any attached soulrider.

Soulrider (Monitor).publicNotes:
Although soulriders can grow quite large, most of them are narrow creatures only a few feet long. Even once they've attached to a soul and passed between planes, they must complete their adaptation to the new environment before beginning their growth.

These smallest soulriders might be found anywhere in the mortal Universe with a portal to the Outer Sphere or a history of summoning magic. Large batches of spawn in the wilderness are often culled by natural predators, but individual spawn can survive for years and travel many miles as they search for a host.

Resembling a lamprey or hagfish with a long whiplike tail, a soulrider uses its harmless sucker to hitch rides on a creature's soul. This seemingly simple connection transcends the physical, attaching directly to the host's soul and even riding along with the soul to its final destination. Once there, a soulrider leaves its host to absorb the surrounding planar energies, adapting to the new environment and growing large enough to produce spawn. However, it can only do so in the mortal Universe, so it must find a portal or other way to return. With this cycle, they've spread to every plane in the Outer Sphere, as well as many mortal worlds.

Although increasingly widespread, soulriders only appeared a little over a century ago. Thought to be a fleshwarper's attempt to cheat Pharasma's judgment by attaching several innocent souls to their own, soulriders' numbers have grown explosively since then.

Soulriders require little more than air to survive, but they're instinctually aware of their need for a mortal soul. Although their suckers are harmless, soulriders who feel threatened or become impatient will finish off their hosts or nearby threats with their tail.

Giant Dragonfly.name: Giant Dragonfly
Giant Dragonfly.publicNotes:
These buzzing insects are the size of a small horse. They're ambush predators that hunt beasts and humanoids alike, capable of using impressive aerial acrobatics to swoop down from above and snatch away their prey.

Dragonflies hunt with a combination of agile power and deadly speed. In early life stages, these insects are entirely aquatic predators, but they take to the air once they've molted. Most live around bodies of water suitable for spawning, but giant dragonflies have been known to fly many miles while on the hunt. Though their gossamer wings and colorful bodies are beautiful at first glance, an unwary adventurer lured in by the display runs a very real risk of becoming lunch.

Clutch.name: Clutch
Clutch.description:
Requirements The giant dragonfly has a Medium or smaller creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in its mandibles

Effect The dragonfly tries to transfer the grabbed creature to be clutched by its legs. The giant dragonfly attempts an Athletics check against the creature's Reflex DC. On a success, it transfers the creature (which remains grabbed) to its legs, freeing its mandibles to attack. The dragonfly can have only one creature clutched at a time.

Snatch.name: Snatch
Snatch.description: The giant dragonfly can Fly at half Speed while it has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by Clutch, carrying that creature along with it.

Swoop.name: Swoop
Swoop.description: The giant dragonfly Flies up to its Speed and makes one mandible Strike at any point during that movement.

Tiger Topiary.publicNotes:
Tiger topiaries are most often found within the Impossible Lands and Tian Xia, adding a dangerous appearance to an enchanting garden. Souls of very proud and volatile individuals can become tiger topiaries, turning into silent stalkers and hunters. Following intruders throughout their territory until they're at their most vulnerable, they're known to pick off unsuspecting adventuring parties one member at a time. Seamlessly blending into nature, only experienced travelers can spot a tiger topiary in time to plot a different course.

Topiaries are an extremely common sight across Golarion, especially within the gleaming and well-manicured lawns of nobility. Living topiaries develop from the death of a lone soul in an overgrown area of deep primal magic, with the soul exploding into the plants around it and causing them to grow together into the form of an animal, often influenced by the personality of the dying person. Once fully formed, the living topiary lacks their original memories; however, they're filled with the desire to protect the area they were formed in, driving off invaders and those who would do harm to the flora and fauna.

Stalker.name: Stalker
Stalker.description: When in dense foliage or tall grass, the tiger topiary gains a +1 status bonus to checks to Hide.

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: The tiger topiary Strides or Leaps and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If it began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.

Pruning.name: Pruning
Pruning.description: The tiger topiary twists and contorts its shape, shedding branches and leaves as needed to change into a topiary of a Medium or smaller animal. Until the next time it acts, the topiary has an automatic result of 32 for Deception checks and DCs to appear as a mundane topiary.

Walk Through Plants.name: Walk Through Plants
Walk Through Plants.description: The tiger topiary ignores difficult terrain caused by dense vegetation.

Tiger Topiary.name: Tiger Topiary

Nucol.publicNotes:
Representing the fear of parasites and affliction, nucols appear as violent, pestilence-ridden boars. They pollute their victim's body and mind, spreading not only fear but a mind-altering affliction that exacerbates feelings of self-doubt.

Though very aggressive, the fiends are capable of cunning manipulation. After they infect a victim with potent insecurity, they'll offer to remove the affliction for a price. Many of these deals are esoteric in nature, driving the victim into despair and forcing them to give up things they cherish. The sinister nucol may even reinfect its victim after completing the bargain, but a canny negotiator may be able to turn the tables on the fiend and free themselves from its grasp.

Ages ago, when this cycle of the multiverse was still adolescent, a cabal of psychopomps who already felt bored and restrained in their role of ushering souls to their ultimate resting place rebelled against their station. It was this corruption of the cycle of souls that spawned the first sahkils.

Ambivalent to the prescribed order of the multiverse and spiteful of mortals, sahkils delight in spreading fear and unease to all beings, clogging up the metaphysical cycle with anxiety-ridden mortals too scared to achieve their potential. These fiends have drastically changed from their dedicated psychopomp predecessors. They are creatures of spite and torment, fear and disgust. They exploit the most common and rare fears for their own perverse satisfaction, and they want nothing more than to frighten mortals and make them quetion their reason for existence.

Most sahkils lurk on the Ethereal Plane, but they frequently invade the Material Plane to torment mortals and spread terror. They use their innate ability to slip between the veils of the Ethereal and Material effortlessly, often stalking their targets for days or weeks before enacting their devious plots.

Easy to Call.name: Easy to Call
Easy to Call.description: A nucol's level is considered 2 lower for the purpose of being conjured by the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2ykmAVKrsAWcazcC]{Binding Circle} ritual (and potentially other rituals, at the GM's discretion), but it is always free to attack or leave instead of negotiate unless the primary caster's check is a critical success.

Nervous Consumption.name: Nervous Consumption
Nervous Consumption.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:21]

Onset 1 minute

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} (1 day)

Spray Pus.name: Spray Pus
Spray Pus.description: The nucol flexes one of its infected wounds, releasing a spray of pus in a @Template[cone|distance:15] or targeting an individual creature within 30 feet. A creature targeted or in the area is exposed to nervous consumption.

Skip Between.name: Skip Between
Skip Between.description: The sahkil moves from the Universe to the Ethereal Plane or vice-versa. While in the Ethereal Plane, they're unable to affect anything in the Universe, and they cannot be seen by beings or abilities in the Universe, unless these have an ability that can gaze into the Ethereal Plane. While on the Material Plane the inverse is true for anything on the Ethereal Plane. A summoned sahkil can't use Skip Between.

Nucol.name: Nucol

Arcane Slam.description:
Requirements The champion has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The champion channels supernatural energy through its pincers, then slams its foe against the ground. The grabbed creature takes 3d6 bludgeoning and @Damage[3d6[fire]] damage, is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:29] save. On a failure the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} on a critical failure) from the force of the slam. At the end of the Arcane Slam, the grapple ends.
Arcane Slam.name: Arcane Slam

Spinning Toss.name: Spinning Toss
Spinning Toss.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements The champion has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The champion spins on its axis, using the creature it's holding as an impromptu bludgeon before tossing it aside. The champion attempts an Athletics check against the grabbed creature's Fortitude DC.

Critical Success The champion fings its victim. The grapple ends. The grabbed creature is thrown into a space within 10 feet, takes @Damage[8d6[bludgeoning]] damage, and falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. All creatures adjacent to the champion take the same amount of bludgeoning damage (@Check[Refex|dc:29|basic] save).

Success As critical success, except the grabbed creatures is thrown into a space within 5 feet, and creatures take @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]] damage.

Failure The champion tosses its victim aside. The grapple ends. The grabbed creature falls prone.

Critical Failure The champion fumbles its grasp on its victim and the grapple ends.

Champion Automaton.name: Champion Automaton
Champion Automaton.publicNotes: The artifcers of Jistka crafted warrior automatons to fght on the front lines of their armies, and in this goal they succeeded admirably. Brutal, effective combatants, champion automatons contain the souls of the best of the Imperium's armies, its most dedicated soldiers and respected offcers, all rendered deadlier than ever before in their bodies of metal and magic.

Iguanodon.name: 禽龙 Iguanodon

Gouging Lunge.name: 拇指撕扯 Gouging Lunge
Gouging Lunge.description: 禽龙对相邻的敌人进行一次拇指尖刺打击，然后行走最多15尺，以蛮力让拇指在敌人身上扯开一道伤口。如果此打击命中，它造成额外1d8点挥砍伤害，并且接下来的行走动作不触发来自被打击生物的反应动作。这次拇指尖刺打击在计算禽龙的多重攻击减值时算作2次攻击。

Iguanodon.publicNotes:
禽龙是一种大型的草食性恐龙，栖息在沼泽和森林中，以丰富的植被为食。禽龙可以用两只脚或四只脚移动，可以快速地从一种姿态切换到另一种姿态，这取决于它们需要在浓密的树叶间移动还是伸头去够到挂在树冠上的美味食物。

虽然禽龙是食草动物，但它们是出了名的暴躁。它们尖锐的拇指使它们的爪子成为毁灭性的武器。被这样的爪子顶一下可以让饥饿的捕食者瞬间变成畏缩的胆小鬼。禽龙有30尺长，重6000磅。

Shade (Creation's Forge).name: 残影（创世熔炉） Shade (Creation's Forge)

Planar Incarnation - Creation's Forge (T.name: 创生熔炉位面塑形（启迪者） Planar Incarnation - Creation's Forge (The Enlightened)
Planar Incarnation - Creation's Forge (T.description:
所有残影都会被所在的位面塑造形体，并表现出位面的本质。他们的数据有如下调整。他们也可能获得和位面相关的生物特征。

创生熔炉 Creation's Forge（"启迪者"the Enlightened） 启迪者的外观看起来像是透明的、散发着七彩辐光的生前版本

  • 语言 焰刃语
  • 额外能力 快速治疗5
  • 近战 光之触+7，伤害 1d8+2命能

Shade (Creation's Forge).publicNotes:
启迪者的外观看起来像是透明的、散发着七彩辐光的生前版本

当凡人死亡时，他们的灵魂将前往外环位面中的骨园（Boneyard），在那里接受死亡女神法莱斯玛的审判。一旦他们受到审判，他们的灵魂就会前往来世接受最终奖赏或惩罚，在这个过程中，他们会变成一种叫做"残影"的生物。这个过程会赋予这些灵魂一个新的身体，其身体的外形由它前往的位面的主要意识形态所塑造。残影的生前记忆几乎被抹去，只留下一些如同梦境般模糊的记忆碎片。无论残影生前的体型、力量或天性如何，他们在来世都是中型生物。

阴魂的存在可能会持续无数纪元，但这种状态并非一成不变的。神祇、浩瀚众界（Great Beyond）的居民、甚至位面本身都可能进一步转变残影的本质，通过将其转变为原始的精粹（quintessence），心魂要素（spiritual essence）被用于扩张位面的物理表征，或被转变为天族、魔族、观察者之类的新形态。如果残影死亡，他们的身体会在类似腐烂的过程中分解，他们的本质会回归至组成位面本身的精粹或元素中。这代表着灵魂之旅的真正终结——它们的生命精华与浩瀚众界的核心融为一体，被回收到创生熔炉中，为新灵魂的诞生提供能量。

Swim the Dead Roads.description: In a process that takes 1 week, a spawning soulrider can travel through channels in the multiverse only it can sense, moving from the Outer Sphere plane whose energy it has absorbed to the Dead Roads that connect the Boneyard to the mortal Universe. From there, it travels to a random place in the Universe that can support life.
Swim the Dead Roads.name: Swim the Dead Roads

Fiendish Lunge.name: Fiendish Lunge
Fiendish Lunge.description: The spawning soulrider Strides or Swims twice, making a tail Strike at any point during its movement. The Strike deals an additional @Damage[1d4[spirit]] damage.

Grind Soul.name: Grind Soul
Grind Soul.description:
Requirements The spawning soulrider is attached to a creature's soul

Effect The soulrider grinds the creature's soul with its jagged inner mouth, dealing @Damage[2d8[spirit]] damage (@Check[will|dc:16|basic] save). On a critical failure, the creature also takes @Damage[1d4[persistent,spirit]] damage. Regardless of the result, the spawning soulrider is no longer attached to the creature.

Propulsive Launch.name: Propulsive Launch
Propulsive Launch.description: The soulrider Leaps up to 40 feet, then makes a sucker Strike. If it's in the air and not attached to a creature after the Strike, it falls.

Planar Adaptation (Fiend).name: Planar Adaptation (Fiend)
Planar Adaptation (Fiend).description: A spawning soulrider has traits appropriate to the planar energy it's absorbed: celestial and holy, fiend and unholy, or monitor.

Soul Attach.name: Soul Attach
Soul Attach.description: When a soulrider succeeds at a sucker Strike against a target with a soul capable of facing judgment, its sucker attaches it to that soul. While attached, both the soulrider and the host creature are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}, and the soulrider moves with its host until the soulrider dies or the host pulls it loose (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC 16). If the host dies while the soulrider is attached, the soulrider disappears immediately to follow the soul leaving the body. A creature returned to life before reaching its final destination generally returns with any attached soulrider.

Tail Thrash.name: Tail Thrash
Tail Thrash.description:
Requirements The soulrider is attached to a creature's soul

Effect The soulrider makes a tail Strike against the creature whose soul it's attached to, then one against another creature adjacent to the original target. These Strikes count towards the soulrider's multiple attack penalty, but it doesn't increase until after the second attack.

Spawning Soulrider (Fiend).name: Spawning Soulrider (Fiend)
Spawning Soulrider (Fiend).publicNotes:
When soulriders absorb sufficient planar energy, they become gravid with countless tiny eggs. Such soulriders instinctively return to the Universe via the Dead Roads to lay their spawn, although the exact metaphysical process has yet to be fully understood. Fiends and others keen to enter the mortal world have begun capturing and studying spawning soulriders, though such experiments carry their own risks, for soulriders prevented from returning to the Universe will continue to grow larger as they absorb more energy.

Once back in the Universe, spawning soulriders become fiercely protective of their near-translucent eggs and tiny spawn, using their remora-like maws to fend off potential threats. Anyone disturbing a soulrider in the process of spawning might find out what it feels like to have pieces of their soul torn away.

Resembling a lamprey or hagfish with a long whiplike tail, a soulrider uses its harmless sucker to hitch rides on a creature's soul. This seemingly simple connection transcends the physical, attaching directly to the host's soul and even riding along with the soul to its final destination. Once there, a soulrider leaves its host to absorb the surrounding planar energies, adapting to the new environment and growing large enough to produce spawn. However, it can only do so in the mortal Universe, so it must find a portal or other way to return. With this cycle, they've spread to every plane in the Outer Sphere, as well as many mortal worlds.

Although increasingly widespread, soulriders only appeared a little over a century ago. Thought to be a fleshwarper's attempt to cheat Pharasma's judgment by attaching several innocent souls to their own, soulriders' numbers have grown explosively since then.

Soulriders require little more than air to survive, but they're instinctually aware of their need for a mortal soul. Although their suckers are harmless, soulriders who feel threatened or become impatient will finish off their hosts or nearby threats with their tail.

Shade (Ethereal Plane).name: 残影（灵界） Shade (Ethereal Plane)

Planar Incarnation - Ethereal Plane (The.name: 灵界位面塑形（恐吓者） Planar Incarnation - Ethereal Plane (The Terrorized)
Planar Incarnation - Ethereal Plane (The.description:
所有残影都会被所在的位面塑造形体，并表现出位面的本质。他们的数据有如下调整。他们也可能获得和位面相关的生物特征。

灵界 Ethereal Plane（"恐吓者" the Terrorized） 恐吓者的外观看上去是虚弱、幽灵一般的生前版本

  • 语言 某种生前使用的语言（例如通用语）
  • 额外能力 免疫流血和死亡效果
  • 近战 拳击+7，伤害 1d8+2钝击

Shade (Ethereal Plane).publicNotes:
恐吓者的外观看上去是虚弱、幽灵一般的生前版本

当凡人死亡时，他们的灵魂将前往外环位面中的骨园（Boneyard），在那里接受死亡女神法莱斯玛的审判。一旦他们受到审判，他们的灵魂就会前往来世接受最终奖赏或惩罚，在这个过程中，他们会变成一种叫做"残影"的生物。这个过程会赋予这些灵魂一个新的身体，其身体的外形由它前往的位面的主要意识形态所塑造。残影的生前记忆几乎被抹去，只留下一些如同梦境般模糊的记忆碎片。无论残影生前的体型、力量或天性如何，他们在来世都是中型生物。

阴魂的存在可能会持续无数纪元，但这种状态并非一成不变的。神祇、浩瀚众界（Great Beyond）的居民、甚至位面本身都可能进一步转变残影的本质，通过将其转变为原始的精粹（quintessence），心魂要素（spiritual essence）被用于扩张位面的物理表征，或被转变为天族、魔族、观察者之类的新形态。如果残影死亡，他们的身体会在类似腐烂的过程中分解，他们的本质会回归至组成位面本身的精粹或元素中。这代表着灵魂之旅的真正终结——它们的生命精华与浩瀚众界的核心融为一体，被回收到创生熔炉中，为新灵魂的诞生提供能量。

Ghostly Mob.hp: 复生，虚能治疗，阈值70（3部分），35（2部分）

Clutching Hands.name: 紧攥之手 Clutching Hands
Clutching Hands.description:
1至3

频率 每轮一次

效果 部队攻击@Template[type:emanation|distance:5]内的敌人（@Check[reflex|dc:23|basic]豁免），造成伤害基于动作数量。

1 @Damage[(1d6+3)[void]|options:area-damage]伤害

2 @Damage[(3d6+6)[void]|options:area-damage]伤害

3 @Damage[(4d6+9)[void]|options:area-damage]伤害

Frightful Chorus.name: 惊骇悲歌 Frightful Chorus
Frightful Chorus.description: 幽灵聚众发出痛苦的嚎叫，将他们的痛苦分享给范围内所有能听到的活体生物。这个痛苦的嚎叫令@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]范围内的每个活体生物必须进行@Check[will|dc:26]检定，否则就会获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}（大失败则获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 3}）。无论豁免结果如何，该生物都会在1分钟内对惊骇悲歌临时免疫。

Site Bound.name: 束缚之地 Site Bound
Site Bound.description: 幽灵聚众的移动范围不得超出距离其成员被杀之地240尺的范围。

Rejuvenation.name: 复生 Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: 当一个幽灵聚众被摧毁时，它在[[/gmr 2d4 #days]]{2d4天}后会重新形成，生命值全满。只有在有人确定了它存在的原因，并纠正了任何阻碍部队安息的因素后，幽灵聚众才能被永久摧毁。

Ghostly Mob.name: 幽灵聚众 Ghostly Mob
Ghostly Mob.publicNotes:
当一场可怕的悲剧导致大规模死亡时，众多死者们不得安息的灵魂可能会以幽灵聚众的形态复活。像其他幽灵一样，聚众往往不知道自己已经死亡。被困在聚众里的幽灵可能会尝试继续它们生前的生活方式，哪怕它们的记忆零碎，身躯模糊。这些破碎的记忆皆与他们最后时刻的所在地有关，迫使幽灵们本能地重演他们的最后时刻——这有时仅有数分钟，有时可达数日之久。当幽灵聚众中的一位或多位成员被迫面对自己的真实状态时，这些幽灵便会因痛苦而宣泄暴力。

死后通过悬而未决的强大情感系于世间，如生前自我的悲伤回响一般，幽灵困扰着活人。

Thousand Thieves.name: Thousand Thieves

Discorporate.name: Discorporate
Discorporate.description: When the swarm strider is reduced to 0 HP, their constituent creatures collapse, scattering on the ground under their space and each adjacent square. If even one of the creatures gets away, the swarm strider can eventually re-form over 1d10 days (potentially longer in areas where there are few invertebrates). The scattered invertebrates must be destroyed within 1 round to destroy the swarm strider permanently. The invertebrates have a collective pool of 55 HP, and the same AC, saves, immunities, resistances, and weaknesses as the swarm strider. The invertebrates can't take actions but they escape automatically once the round elapses. At the GM's discretion, clever means of trapping or eliminating the creatures might be sufficient to destroy the swarm strider.

Clinging Remnants.name: Clinging Remnants
Clinging Remnants.description: A swarm strider's melee Strikes and ranged Strikes made against targets within their weapon's first range increment deposit biting vermin on the target, dealing @Damage[4d4[persistent,piercing]] damage.

Draw Bugs.name: Draw Bugs
Draw Bugs.description: The swarm strider draws more arthropods from the environment around them to reconstitute some of their damaged body. They regain @Damage[20] HP. At the GM's discretion, the swarm strider doesn't recover HP in areas where there aren't enough arthropods to call to themselves.

Scuttling Shift.name: Scuttling Shift
Scuttling Shift.description: The thousand thieves reverts to a swarm using Swarm Getaway, Sneaks up to their Speed, coalesces into their normal form, and Hides. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The thousand thieves Strikes deal an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Squirming Injection.name: Squirming Injection
Squirming Injection.description: The swarm strider Strides. If they end their movement sharing a space with a creature, they deal @Damage[6d6[piercing]] damage to the creature, with a @Check[reflex|dc:37|basic] and exposing the target to liquid delirium. The swarm strider can Burrow, Climb, Fly, or Swim instead of Striding if they have the corresponding movement type.

Swarm Getaway.name: Swarm Getaway
Swarm Getaway.description:
The thousand thieves collapses into a shapeless swarm of their constituent creatures. They drop all but up to 3 Bulk of held, worn, or carried objects in their possession.

In this form, the thousand thieves can't use attack actions and can't cast spells, but they can move through areas small enough for their constituent creatures to fit without having to Squeeze. They can use the same action to coalesce from their swarm shape back into their normal form.

As the swarm moves, the thousand thieves carries these objects if they can fit through the spaces the swarm moves through. The thousand thieves automatically dons any of the objects they desire when they reform. If the thousand thieves is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, Swarm Getaway doesn't reveal their location.

Liquid Delirium.name: Liquid Delirium
Liquid Delirium.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:37]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 4d6 poison and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 4d6 poison and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 4d6 poison, stupefied 2, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by a random object (1 round)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} with no Perception check to wake up (1 round)

Thousand Thieves.publicNotes:
Good help is hard to find. For a master thief unable to find competent accomplices, sometimes the only way to execute the perfect heist involves becoming an entire guild of tiny creatures. Those who purposefully transform in this way favor scuttling creatures such as centipedes or spiders. On occasion, a thousand thieves instead forms when a community of pack rats discovers a dead scoundrel's body and fights over his ill-gotten gains. These swarm striders make use of their swarm form to enter homes, vaults, and other targets with ease.

All living creatures eventually become worm food. Yet if a creature perishes while gripped by overwhelming emotion or unfinished business, its flesh can become infused with those obsessions or a simple refusal to perish, infecting whatever detritivores feast on the body. As they feast, the invertebrates awaken to a type of collective intelligence, including some of the dead creature's memories and motivations. Once the body is stripped bare, the vermin swarm together and intertwine to recreate the dead creature's form out of thousands of wriggling bodies. These reborn are known as swarm striders.

Though many swarm striders are accidental creations, a few rare mortals purposefully transform themselves into swarm striders through powerful rituals. Most often, this process involves specially preparing a grave with ample scavengers and enchanting the site with occult magic to anchor their soul until it can live within the swarm. Through transformation, these intentional swarm striders seek out the power to slip past any defense or claim the virtual immortality of an ever-regenerating horde, as a swarm strider can reconstitute their form from even a single worm. However, the transformation inevitably scars the creature—often causing emotional detachment, the disintegration of old taboos, and a dissociated sense of self now that one mind has become a thousand. In their transformed state, even the best-intentioned swarm strider might embrace villainy and lose any semblance of their former selves over the span of many years.

Hermit Crab Swarm.name: Hermit Crab Swarm

Swarming Snips.name: Swarming Snips
Swarming Snips.description:
Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[2d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save).

Creatures that fail this save also take @Damage[1d4[bleed]].

Hermit Crab Swarm.publicNotes:
When hermit crabs find a shell that is too large, they lie in wait for others to arrive and move into the shell, abandoning a possible replacement. This can form a large chain of queuing crabs waiting to upgrade their shells. Interruptions can aggravate the crabs, resulting in attacks against the unfortunate source of disruption.

Hermit crabs have hard exoskeletons like other crabs, but with much weaker abdomens. They find and "wear" shells as homes and protection, getting around with their front legs and claws. Surprisingly fierce, hermit crabs fight for new shells as they grow bigger, using an assortment of hollow alternatives as substitutes when shells of the right size can't be found.

Earthbound.name: Earthbound
Earthbound.description: When not touching solid ground, the terra carver is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

Crashing Fall.name: Crashing Fall
Crashing Fall.description: Due to their size, a terra carver falls a lot harder than most creatures. When a terra carver is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} or takes falling damage, they take an additional @Damage[15[bludgeoning]] damage in addition to any other effect.

Carve Projectile.description: The terra carver carves a deadly projectile from nearby materials and makes a rock ranged Strike that gains the deadly d10 trait. On a successful hit, the target also falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
Carve Projectile.name: Carve Projectile

Hew Stone.name: Hew Stone
Hew Stone.description: Melee attacks the terra carver makes with their stone tool ignore physical resistance and Hardness.

Territorial Retaliation.name: Territorial Retaliation
Territorial Retaliation.description:
Trigger A creature within 15 feet uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action (move actions using only a fly Speed don't trigger this reaction)

Effect The terra carver attempts an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} the triggering creature. Regardless of the result, the space of the triggering creature and all spaces on the ground adjacent to that creature become difficult terrain for 1 round.

Stone Tunnels.name: Stone Tunnels
Stone Tunnels.description: A terra carver can burrow through solid stone. When they do, they leave a tunnel.

Wedge.name: Wedge
Wedge.description: The terra carver attempts a stone tool Strike while wedging the blow further with another tool. If it hits, the target takes an additional 3d10 damage of the same type as the Strike and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 hour or until the creature is fully healed. This counts as two attacks for the terra carver's multiple attack penalty.

Terra Carver.name: Terra Carver
Terra Carver.publicNotes:
Even other earth elementals and creatures of stone fear the formidable terra carver. Their four arms end with sharpened stone tools that can cleave through the toughest rocks—and anything that wanders into their territory. Despite having powerful forms, their bulky upper bodies appear comically large compared to their stout legs. They lumber slowly through their territory and spend most of their time cutting stone deep in the bedrock to create elaborate networks of tunnels.

They prefer isolation, and when two terra carvers meet, it typically ends with one hewing the other. Instead of taking their enemy's territory, a terra carver collapses the tunnels, continuing elsewhere with their own designs.

Voiceless Miners

Terra carvers are talented miners, and their tunnels are some of the longest lasting on any plane. However, the reason for these tunnels is unknown. Scholars have theorized that their tunnels function as a form of written language for the otherwise voiceless elementals. Unfortunately, attempts to map abandoned tunnels often end where another terra carver collapsed an encroaching tunnel, and mapping active tunnels often results in the cartographer never making it back.

Fearsense.name: 恐惧感知 Fearsense
Fearsense.description: 绝望龙能够感知所有处于惊惧状态的生物，范围如上所述。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult.name: 对抗异能的全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

Consume Fear.name: 吞噬恐惧 Consume Fear
Consume Fear.description:
触发 绝望龙60尺内的一个生物失去惊惧状态

效果 绝望龙从失去惊惧状态的生物体内汲取恐惧，获得5d8临时生命值，持续1分钟。

Draconic Momentum.description: 绝望龙的打击重击时，恢复尖叫吐息的使用次数。
Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum

Shrieking Breath.name: 尖叫吐息 Shrieking Breath
Shrieking Breath.description: 绝望龙发出由它从恐惧敌人那里汲取的尖叫所组成的刺耳音波，在@Template[type:cone|distance:40]范围内造成@Damage[12d6[sonic]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[will|dc:33|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。 豁免失败的生物必须在下一回合开始时将第一个动作用于尖叫。绝望龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Shrieking Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用尖叫吐息。

Tongue Decoy.name: 舌头诱饵 Tongue Decoy
Tongue Decoy.description:
绝望龙将其舌尖的数个囊泡充气，以制造出一个生物的基本形态。这个过程需要1分钟才能完成，在此期间绝望龙处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]状态。如果绝望龙在此过程中停止或被打断，囊泡会泄气，绝望龙必须重新开始。一旦过程完成，绝望龙可以无限期保持充气状态，并且可以使用解消动作使囊泡泄气并收回舌头。

充气后的舌头呈现出动物或类人生物的基本形态，体型可以是小型或中型。该形态与生物的轮廓相似，但仔细检查并成功通过@Check[perception|dc:30]检定可以识别舌头的真面目。在充气时，绝望龙可以通过舌头发出声音，但保持舌头充气会让说话变得困难，导致绝望龙在任何与说话相关的检定上（如欺骗检定）受到-4环境减值。

绝望龙的舌头最多可以延伸90尺，并可以作为充气过程的一部分将舌头完全伸展。充气后的舌头部分可用一个动作（具有专注、操作和移动特征）将充气部分移动最多15尺。在延伸状态下，舌头的膨胀末端会占据一个相应体型生物的空间，但舌头的其余部分不会以任何方式阻碍或阻挡移动。绝望龙的灵敏嗅觉感觉可以通过舌尖的纤毛发挥作用，但除此之外，绝望龙没有其他途径感知舌头附近的事物。

攻击舌头视同攻击绝望龙本体，唯一不同的是舌头始终处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]状态。如果舌头受到任何伤害，它会立即泄气并保持延伸状态。绝望龙会在舌头延伸时持续处于措手不及状态，但可以通过连续两个交互动作来收回舌头。如果舌头受到伤害，绝望龙在1天内无法使用舌头诱饵。

Unbidden Thoughts.name: 无声思绪 Unbidden Thoughts
Unbidden Thoughts.description:
触发 绝望龙被武器或无武装攻击重击

效果 攻击者的心智被关于他们最深层恐惧的幻象所占据，导致感官超负荷。攻击者必须选择以下结果之一：该次攻击变为普通成功，或者该次攻击保持重击但攻击者陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}。

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 绝望龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击和一次尾扫打击。

Despair Dragon (Adult).name: 成年绝望龙 Despair Dragon (Adult)
Despair Dragon (Adult).publicNotes: 恐惧是最强烈的情感之一，而绝望龙是将恐惧和绝望之情引导为自己利益的高手。像其他异能龙一样，绝望龙也有一种与生俱来的冲动，那就是激起他人的恐惧。绝望龙通常会定居在城镇附近，以便从周围的恐惧中汲取力量。绝望龙的财宝中最常见的物品是卷轴、典籍和遗物，这些物品是它们研究的材料。通过这些，绝望龙能了解到当地的民间传说、都市传说等，从而更好地困扰它们的目标。

Dig-Widget.name: Dig-Widget

Infiltration Tools.name: Infiltration Tools
Infiltration Tools.description: A dig-widget's face consists of a set of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.6nrCxNQFycUVFOV2]{Infiltrator Thieves' Tools}. They can be salvaged from a destroyed dig-widget with a successful @Check[crafting|dc:20|name:Salvage Infiltration Tools] check. On a failed check, the tools are destroyed.

Mechanical Vulnerability.name: Mechanical Vulnerability
Mechanical Vulnerability.description: A creature with expert proficiency in Thievery can attempt a check to [[/act disable-device dc=22]] to damage a dig-widget. The DC is 22, and each success deals @Damage[20[untyped]] damage.

Fastening Leap.name: Fastening Leap
Fastening Leap.description: The dig-widget Leaps up 20 feet onto a creature or object and attempts a corkscrew Strike against it. If the Strike damages the target, the dig-widget attaches to the target (typically to the back of a creature). This is similar to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]{Grabbing} the creature, but the dig-widget moves with that creature rather than holding it in place. While attached, the dig-widget can't use its corkscrew. The dig-widget can be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shoved} off, or it can detach itself with an Interact action.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: A dig-widget's Strikes deal an additional 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Dig-Widget.publicNotes:
Thieves covet dig-widgets, specialized constructs built for infiltration. Each dig-widget contains numerous simple tools, including a set of mechanical devices that function as thieves' tools, two arms with drills, and two arms with corkscrews for attaching to and climbing surfaces. Once activated, these devices propel themselves forward. Though they have the faculties typical of a construct, they usually follow a simple routine: avoid notice, pick any lock barring the path, dig past obstacles, and attack if caught. They're rarely left unattended, as a thief needs to be nearby to follow after—both to steal goods and to stop the dig-widget from engaging in further larceny once it's achieved its goal.

The source of a dig-widget's power is as much mechanical as it is magical. The gears and springs that provide a dig-widget mobility are an improvement over more primitive true clockwork creations (whose functions require constant winding to remain mobile), but at the cost of security, for a dig-widget's moving parts can be dismantled quickly by thieves and others with the proper training.

While many authorities ban dig-widgets, they have a harder time confiscating the machines than might be expected. A sizable number of people who encounter dig-widgets, from hired adventurers to tunneling kobolds, are far more inclined to keep the constructs for themselves than turn them over to be dismantled. Often, this is simply due to the novelty of the dig-widget rather than any desire to use it.

Domovoi.name: Domovoi

Tremorsense (Imprecise) Within Their Ent.name: Tremorsense (Imprecise) Within Their Entire Bound Home

Master of the Home.name: Master of the Home
Master of the Home.description: A home with a friendly domovoi is blessed, as the domovoi cooks, cleans, fetches water, and does a hundred other small tasks. A home so blessed never encounters random accidents such as fires, and any checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.rmwa3OyhTZ2i2AHl]{Craft}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QyzlsLrqM0EEwd7j]{Earn Income}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.bT3skovyLUtP22ME]{Repair}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.49y9Ec4bDii8pcD3]{Subsist} in the home receive a +2 circumstance bonus. If the domovoi is unfriendly, such checks take a –2 circumstance penalty instead, as the domovoi hides things, makes noise when people try to sleep, tangles weaving, and otherwise makes life a misery. A domovoi must spend a week in a place before these benefits occur.

Shy.description: A domovoi is naturally @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} while within sight of their bound home. The domovoi can become visible, or even selectively visible—allowing some people to see them.
Shy.name: Shy

Home Guardian.name: Home Guardian
Home Guardian.description: By commanding their home to attack, the domovoi can [[/act disarm skill=household-lore]], [[/act grapple skill=household-lore]], [[/act reposition skill=household-lore]], [[/act shove skill=household-lore]], or [[/act trip skill=household-lore]] with their enraged home Strike. The domovoi uses their Household Lore instead of Athletics skill for these checks.

Domovoi.publicNotes:
The elderly domovoi are patrons of the home and the dearest of all house spirits to the people they live with. Families with a domovoi leave a bowl of milk in the corner of the home in thanks, and peasants often take great pains to coax a domovoi to follow them to a new house.

An enraged domovoi rallies the home itself in their defense. Anything in the house could betray its residents. Crockery falls onto the heads of attackers, doors slam in their faces, carpets tangle their feet, and woe betide the attacker if someone has hung a sword on the wall.

House spirits are shy, often helpful, sometimes wrathful fey who dwell alongside peasants and farmers. They reside in the house, the yard, the granary, the bathhouse—wherever people build and live. Due to this proximity, house spirits often take on the mannerisms or appearance of nearby mortals. Their reclusive nature and tendency to go unseen earned them the moniker of "spirits," though in truth they're fully embodied fey.

House spirits take an almost parental interest in "their" mortals. Given proper respect, these fey work tirelessly for their charges—they chop wood, care for livestock, mend clothes, sweep the floor, and tend to the stove. If offended, though, the house spirit becomes a menace, frightening animals or children and ruining belongings.

Gnash.name: Gnash
Gnash.description:
Requirements The beheaded's previous action was a jaws Strike that dealt damage to its target.

Effect The severed head makes a second jaws Strike as it violently shakes itself, trying to rip away a mouthful of flesh. On a success, the target takes an additional 1d4 slashing damage and 1 persistent bleed damage.

Severed Head.name: Severed Head
Severed Head.publicNotes:
The most common beheaded appears simply as a rotting head, barely preserved by the magic that created it.

Beheaded are the reanimated heads of decapitation victims. These mindless undead fly through the air or roll around to attack their prey.

Star Child.name: Star Child
Star Child.description: The mix couatl is difficult to discern against starry skies. The mix couatl can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} in the air at night without @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.other-effects.Item.I9lfZUiCwMiGogVi]{Cover} or being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}.

Gift of Knowledge.name: Gift of Knowledge
Gift of Knowledge.description: When a mix coatl casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.FhOaQDTSnsY7tiam]{Rewrite Memory} on a willing creature, the mix coatl can Sustain the spell to rewrite these memories for up to 60 continuous minutes. A mix coatl can grant knowledge of a particular skill to the target as part of the spell. The mix coatl chooses Engineering Lore, Farming Lore, Fishing Lore, Hunting Lore, or Mercantile Lore. The target becomes permanently trained in the chosen skill. A creature can benefit from Gift of Knowledge only once.

Mix Coatl Venom.name: Mix Coatl Venom
Mix Coatl Venom.description:
To unholy creatures, this is a curse instead of a poison and deals spirit damage instead of poison damage

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:26]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}, and stupefied 1 (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d8[poison]] damage, stunned 1, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (1 round)

Against unholy

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:26|traits:curse,holy|overrideTraits:true]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[spirit]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[spirit]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}, and stupefied 1 (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d8[spirit]] damage, stunned 1, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (1 round)

Wrap in Coils.name: Wrap in Coils
Wrap in Coils.description:
Requirements The mix coatl has a Medium or smaller creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in their jaws

Effect The mix coatl moves the creature into their coils, freeing their jaws to make attacks, and then uses Constrict against the creature. The mix coatl can hold as many creatures in their coils as will fit in their space.

Mix Coatl.name: Mix Coatl
Mix Coatl.publicNotes:
Mix coatls (pronounced "meesh") are guides to fledgling societies, providing fundamental information such as farming techniques, medicinal expertise, or more esoteric knowledge like the arcane arts.

Coatls are serpentine celestials who tirelessly help mortals reach their greatest potential all across the planes. Some serve benevolent deities as intermediaries, while others serve the cause of good as they see fit.

Totenmaske.name: Totenmaske

Drink Flesh.name: Drink Flesh
Drink Flesh.description:
Requirements The totenmaske hit the same creature with two claw Strikes this turn and is still adjacent to it

Effect The totenmaske drains flesh from the creature's body. The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} unless it succeeds at a @Check[fortitude|dc:25] save (sickened 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} on a critical failure).

Living Form.name: Living Form
Living Form.description:
The totenmaske takes the appearance of a Medium or smaller humanoid creature. This is either their form from before they became undead or the form of the last creature they successfully drained with Drink Flesh.

This doesn't change the totenmaske's Speed or the attack and damage bonuses for their Strikes but might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

Shape Flesh.name: Shape Flesh
Shape Flesh.description: After spending 1 minute in contact with a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature, a totenmaske can reshape the target's face, causing flesh to cover vital features. The target can attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:25] save to resist; a critical success grants temporary immunity to Shape Flesh for 24 hours. Each time the totenmaske Shapes Flesh, they choose one feature: ears (target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}), eyes (target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded}), mouth (target can't speak or eat), or nose (target can't smell). A creature with both its nose and mouth sealed can't breathe and begins to suffocate. Changes are permanent until reversed by removing this curse, but the sealed flesh can be surgically opened with a successful @Check[medicine|dc:25] check that takes [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} and deals @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage per round.

Totenmaske.publicNotes:
Spawned by the same unnatural and self-destructive obsessions that drove them when they still lived, totenmaskes are the undead remnants of the most self-indulgent and sinful among mortals. Their need for indulgence proved stronger than even the grasp of death, raising them from their graves. Though unable to sate their depraved desires, these foul undead can drain the very flesh from their victims so as to wrap themselves in a perverse mockery of life that allows them to pursue their base wants. Totenmaskes' specific longings vary—one might be obsessed with food or drink, while another might be vain and desirous of an attractive form to marvel at in a mirror, while yet another could simply long for the scent of blood.

Whatever sensation the totenmaske seeks, it's always a vice taken to the extreme, for this sin helped condemn them to undeath in the first place. A totenmaske obsessed with food, for example, might find themself assaulting bakeries or breweries, while a vain totenmaske obsessed with glamor could quickly grow bored of each new look and switch their victims out daily, or even hourly.

Caligni Vanguard.name: Caligni Vanguard

Arrows.name: Arrows
Arrows.description: 这些箭头是弓的弹药。箭杆是木制的。一端是羽毛保持飞行中的平稳，另一端是金属头。

Echolocation 60 feet.name: Echolocation 60 feet
Echolocation 60 feet.description: A caligni vanguard can use their hearing as a precise sense at the listed range.

Death Blaze.name: Death Blaze
Death Blaze.description: When the vanguard dies, their body combusts in a blaze of fire and armor shrapnel. All creatures within a @Template[emanation|distance:10] take @Damage[3d6[fire],3d6[piercing]|options:area-damage]{3d6 fire damage and 3d6 piercing damage} (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic|options:area-effect] save). The vanguard's armor is destroyed in the blaze, but their other gear is unaffected and left in a pile where they died.

Call to Arms.name: Call to Arms
Call to Arms.description: Each caligni within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} of the vanguard gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.W7SbTykXrNwxDzJc]{Reactive Strike} reaction until the end of the vanguard's next turn. Once a caligni has used this Reactive Strike, that caligni is temporarily immune to the same vanguard's Call to Arms for 10 minutes.

Shadowed Blade.name: Shadowed Blade
Shadowed Blade.description: The vanguard makes a melee Strike, channeling shadowy essence into their weapon or unarmed attack to envelop the target. If the Strike hits, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:19] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} until the end of its next turn.

Caligni Vanguard.publicNotes:
Caligni children born without eyes-an extremely rare occurrence-are considered sacred to their communities. From a young age, they're set aside and groomed to become caligni vanguards, dedicated to rigorous martial training and mental strictures. Other calignis revere vanguards' discipline and combat skill, but wary caution always tinges such respect, as they often have inscrutable motives. Vanguards almost never rebel against their duties or their established role in the community; some claim that those who do are taken by the owbs.

A vanguard's armor is fused to their body in pieces, and they rarely remove those elements that aren't. This armor plating and vanguards' keen sense of hearing render them particularly sensitive to sonic vibrations, which serves as both an asset and a vulnerability.

Each individual in caligni society serves a specific role. At times, certain roles so rarely find suitable candidates that a community might only see a few individuals fill them in an entire generation.

Platecarpus.name: 板踝龙 Platecarpus

Aquatic Drag.name: 拽入水中 Aquatic Drag
Aquatic Drag.description:
需求 板踝龙使一个生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]或受缚

效果 板踝龙带着受擒或束缚于它的生物，游泳至多其速度一半距离。

Strafing Chomp.name: 掠袭啃咬 Strafing Chomp
Strafing Chomp.description: 板踝龙游泳至多其速度距离，在沿途任意一点进行一次颚咬打击。此次打击造成一半伤害。

Platecarpus.publicNotes:
中等体型的板踝龙是最为常见的一类沧龙。它们通常有15尺长，但较大的个体能长到20尺。较大的种类有时会吃人类和类似体型的类人生物，但大部分还是倾向于捕食更小的猎物。

这种被称作沧龙的巨大水栖爬行动物用其强而有力的尾巴推动它们追捕猎物。四条有关节的带蹼鳍让它们可以精准控制方向，而它们那铰链式的下颌——就像蛇一样——让它们可以吞下比自己体型更大的生物。它们咽喉中的一组小的次生咽颚可以拉动食物以供更高效地消化。作为需要呼吸空气的动物，沧龙必须停留在水面附近，和鲸类争食。这种靠近水面的习性意味着它们经常会掀翻小船，尽情享用落水的船员。

Amoeba Swarm.name: 变形虫群 Amoeba Swarm
Amoeba Swarm.publicNotes: 变形虫群由数千个独立的单细胞生物组成，它们被带有刺鼻气味的粘液粘合在一起。变形虫群既贪婪又无意识，没有任何可辨别的战术。

Swarming Slither.name: 集群蠕动 Swarming Slither
Swarming Slither.description: 变形虫群蠕动经过其所处空间内每个生物，造成@Damage[1d6[acid]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:14|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:sickened]豁免）。大失败的生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}。

Weak Acid.name: 弱酸 Weak Acid
Weak Acid.description: 变形虫群的酸蚀伤害只会影响有机物质——不会影响金属、石头或其他无机物。

Motion Sense.name: 运动感知 Motion Sense
Motion Sense.description: 变形虫群能通过震动以及空气或水的流动来感知附近的生物。

Dvorovoi.name: Dvorovoi

Tremorsense (Imprecise) within their ent.name: Tremorsense (Imprecise) within their entire bound yard

Master of the Yard.name: Master of the Yard
Master of the Yard.description: The dvorovoi helps or causes trouble in the yard, milking or scaring cows, protecting or scattering tools, and so forth. A yard so blessed never encounters random accidents such as fires, and any checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.rmwa3OyhTZ2i2AHl]{Craft}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QyzlsLrqM0EEwd7j]{Earn Income}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.bT3skovyLUtP22ME]{Repair}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.49y9Ec4bDii8pcD3]{Subsist} in the yard receive a +2 circumstance bonus. If the dvorovoi is unfriendly, such checks take a –2 circumstance penalty instead, as the dvorovoi hides things, makes noise when people try to sleep, tangles weaving, and otherwise makes life a misery. A domovoi must spend a week in a place before these benefits occur.

Shy.name: Shy
Shy.description: A dvorovoi is naturally @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} while within sight of their bound home. The dvorovoi can become visible, or even selectively visible-allowing some people to see them.

Dvorovoi.publicNotes:
Traditionally, the dvorovoi is seen as the domovoi's younger sibling and has charge of a peasant's yard and all the animals and tools within. Animals favored by the dvorovoi become healthy, strong, and obedient, while less-loved livestock are exhausted and miserable. Peasants with a resident dvorovoi make sure to formally introduce new livestock to the house spirit and placate the spirit by leaving meals in the shed. Dvorovoi loathe white-furred animals and will chase away any all-white cows or horses, though they have no similar grudge against chickens.

House spirits are shy, often helpful, sometimes wrathful fey who dwell alongside peasants and farmers. They reside in the house, the yard, the granary, the bathhouse—wherever people build and live. Due to this proximity, house spirits often take on the mannerisms or appearance of nearby mortals. Their reclusive nature and tendency to go unseen earned them the moniker of "spirits," though in truth they're fully embodied fey.

House spirits take an almost parental interest in "their" mortals. Given proper respect, these fey work tirelessly for their charges—they chop wood, care for livestock, mend clothes, sweep the floor, and tend to the stove. If offended, though, the house spirit becomes a menace, frightening animals or children and ruining belongings.

Shade (Elysium).name: 残影（极乐境） Shade (Elysium)
Shade (Elysium).publicNotes:
获选者的外观看上去像是生前的理想化版本，双眼发光

当凡人死亡时，他们的灵魂将前往外环位面中的骨园（Boneyard），在那里接受死亡女神法莱斯玛的审判。一旦他们受到审判，他们的灵魂就会前往来世接受最终奖赏或惩罚，在这个过程中，他们会变成一种叫做"残影"的生物。这个过程会赋予这些灵魂一个新的身体，其身体的外形由它前往的位面的主要意识形态所塑造。残影的生前记忆几乎被抹去，只留下一些如同梦境般模糊的记忆碎片。无论残影生前的体型、力量或天性如何，他们在来世都是中型生物。

阴魂的存在可能会持续无数纪元，但这种状态并非一成不变的。神祇、浩瀚众界（Great Beyond）的居民、甚至位面本身都可能进一步转变残影的本质，通过将其转变为原始的精粹（quintessence），心魂要素（spiritual essence）被用于扩张位面的物理表征，或被转变为天族、魔族、观察者之类的新形态。如果残影死亡，他们的身体会在类似腐烂的过程中分解，他们的本质会回归至组成位面本身的精粹或元素中。这代表着灵魂之旅的真正终结——它们的生命精华与浩瀚众界的核心融为一体，被回收到创生熔炉中，为新灵魂的诞生提供能量。

Planar Incarnation - Elysium (The Chosen.name: 极乐境位面塑形（获选者） Planar Incarnation - Elysium (The Chosen)
Planar Incarnation - Elysium (The Chosen.description:
所有残影都会被所在的位面塑造形体，并表现出位面的本质。他们的数据有如下调整。他们也可能获得和位面相关的生物特征。

极乐境 Elysium（"获选者" the Chosen） 获选者的外观看上去像是生前的理想化版本，双眼发光

  • 祝佑 圣洁
  • 语言 天界语
  • 额外能力 免疫@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]
  • 近战 拳击+7，伤害 1d8+2钝击

equipment-Common runes of 9th level or l.name: 刻在鳞片上的常见符文（9级或更低） Common runes of 9th level or lower etched upon their scales

Magic Sense.name: 魔法感知 Magic Sense
Magic Sense.description: 符文龙能感知到列出范围内所有激活的魔法能力与效果。当符文龙进行搜寻时，它在列出范围内获得4环级侦测魔法法术的效果（此外还获得搜寻的正常好处）。

Runic Scales.name: 符文鳞片 Runic Scales
Runic Scales.description: 符文龙的鳞片作为符文石存在。符文龙不能使用蚀刻在其鳞片上的符文的效果或能力，但它们可以将其转移到适当的物品上。以这种方式向物品转移或从物品上转移一个符文需要1分钟，在此期间符文龙处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]状态。该过程自动完成无需检定，但如果符文龙在此过程中停止或受到打扰，符文将被摧毁。符文龙可以在其鳞片上蚀刻任意数量的符文，但它们通常一次只在鳞片上蚀刻少数符文。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: 对抗奥术的全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Retributive Rune.name: 惩戒符文 Retributive Rune
Retributive Rune.description:
触发 一个15尺内的生物对符文龙造成伤害

效果 伴随着符文魔法的爆发，符文龙对触发生物使用爆裂符文能力，若符文未自动引爆则立即将其引爆。

Detonating Rune.name: 爆裂符文 Detonating Rune
Detonating Rune.description: 符文龙的打击与能力可以在目标身上留下一个爆裂符文。如果一个生物在已经拥有一个爆裂符文的情况下将要获得另一个爆裂符文，则不会新增一个符文，而是会激活其当前的爆裂符文，消耗该符文并对目标造成@Damage[5d6[untyped]]伤害。爆裂符文的伤害类型与符文龙当前变幻符文的类型一致。生物可以使用一个交互动作移除该符文。如果爆裂符文没有引爆，则在1分钟后消散。

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 符文龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Runic Breath.name: 符文吐息 Runic Breath
Runic Breath.description: 符文龙释放数百枚一触即爆的符文，在@Template[type:cone|distance:40]范围内造成@Damage[12d6[untyped]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:34|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。此能力的伤害类型由变幻符文决定。豁免失败的生物还会受到爆裂符文的影响。符文龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Runic Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用符文吐息。

Shifting Runes.name: 变幻符文 Shifting Runes
Shifting Runes.description: 符文龙选择酸蚀，寒冷，电击，火焰或音波伤害类型。蚀刻在其鳞片上的符文随之变幻，形成该能量类型的符文。符文龙获得对该伤害类型的免疫，且其爆裂符文与符文吐息均造成该类型伤害。任何在奥法上受训的生物无需检定即可立即识别蚀刻符文的能量类型。

Improved Push 10 feet.name: 精通推离10尺 Improved Push 10 feet

Canceling Rune.name: 抵消符文 Canceling Rune
Canceling Rune.description:
触发 符文龙成为一个需要豁免的法术的目标

效果 符文龙尝试瓦解法术的基础符文。它尝试反制该法术（反制环级7环级，反制调整值[[/r 1d20+26 #Counteract]]{+26}）。若成功，符文龙不受该法术影响；其他目标正常受到该法术影响。符文龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Canceling Rune]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用抵消符文。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 符文龙的打击重击时恢复其符文吐息的充能。

Entangling Rune.name: 束缚符文 Entangling Rune
Entangling Rune.description: 符文龙在60尺内创造一个@Template[type:burst|distance:10]范围的大型陷阱符文。除符文龙外的任何生物进入该区域或在其中结束回合时，会激活符文并受到束缚。该生物必须通过@Check[reflex|dc:34]豁免，否则将被@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]1分钟或直到其成功逃脱。该符文每次只能束缚一个生物。符文在生物豁免成功、逃脱成功或1分钟后消散。与符文相邻的生物可以使用一个交互动作来移除符文。

Rune Dragon (Adult).name: 成年符文龙 Rune Dragon (Adult)
Rune Dragon (Adult).publicNotes: 符文龙天生对符文的力量有着深刻的洞察。大多数符文龙的鳞片上刻有各种符文，它们的身体可以魔法般地增强这些符文的力量。符文龙通常不自己施法，而是依靠它们即兴创造符文的能力来产生所需的效果。符文龙常常把自己的财宝称为图书馆，因为它们的财宝中充满了由不同文化的人们使用多种语言写成的重要历史文献、戏剧、演讲、教科书和法术书。尽管它们通常可以借助魔法说某种语言，但它们更喜欢在讲者的语境中学习语言，以便理解其中隐藏的细微差别和符号中的魔力。

Penanggalan.name: Penanggalan

Spewing Bile.name: Spewing Bile
Spewing Bile.description:
When the penanggalan takes slashing damage, their wound spews bile on adjacent creatures, dealing @Damage[2d10[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:19|basic] save).

The penanggalan loses their spewing bile and penanggalan bile abilities until the end of their next turn.

Ride Corpse.name: Ride Corpse
Ride Corpse.description:
The penanggalan inserts their entrails into their humanoid body, allowing them to appear as and move about like a normal human. The body has 10 Hit Points and the same defenses as the penanggalan.

When the body is destroyed, the penanggalan is ejected unharmed. The body becomes a corpse, and if it is neither controlled by the penanggalan nor stored in an alchemical vat, it decays as normal.

Elongate Tongue.name: Elongate Tongue
Elongate Tongue.description: The penanggalan's tongue extends, the membrane stretching and becoming translucent. Until the end of the turn, the penanggalan's proboscis tongue Strikes have a 10-foot reach, and any target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the Strike unless it has a Perception DC of 22 or higher or the ability to precisely sense @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} things.

Penanggalan Bile.name: Penanggalan Bile
Penanggalan Bile.description:
Rest doesn't decrease the drained value from penanggalan bile

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:19]
