Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 week)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 week)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} (1 week)

Stage 4 dead

Penanggalan.publicNotes:
Penanggalans feed on the blood and entrails of the young. When their cannibalistic hunger strikes, penanggalans bathe their bodies in an alchemical substance that smells like vinegar. Once submerged in the concoction, their neck rips from side to side, allowing their head to float upward and pull out their lungs, stomach, and intestines. They leave their bodies in the vinegar bath much like a molting crab leaves its old shell, then fly off to find a victim filled with blood and guts.

As grotesque as these creatures are when hungry, the penanggalan appears young and healthy while wearing their body. Such is the nature of their existence: they consorted with otherworldy beings, gaining a lifetime of youth in exchange for an evil hunger for the young. But they are not immortal. They age and die normally like the people they once were-they just retain their youthfulness throughout this existence.

It can be difficult to spot a penanggalan among the populace. The faint scar ringing their neck at the point of separation can be explained away as a blemish, and it can be hidden under a flashy necklace. Meanwhile the faint, sour scent of a penanggalan's preserved body, while peculiar, is not uncommon in the sweaty tropics they frequent.

Skaveling.name: 食惧蝙蝠 Skaveling

Echolocation.name: 回声定位 Echolocation
Echolocation.description: 食惧蝙蝠在上述距离内的听觉为精确感官。

Bone-Chilling Screech.name: 刺骨尖啸 Bone-Chilling Screech
Bone-Chilling Screech.description:
食惧蝙蝠发出一阵骇人的嚎叫，深入距离内生物的骨髓。尖啸声可以在几英里内听到，但只有@Template[emanation|distance:20]范围内的每个生物必须在听到的同时进行@Check[will|dc:22]豁免。

食惧蝙蝠在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Bone-Chilling Screech]]{1d4轮}内无法再用此能力。

大成功 生物不受影响，并临时免疫刺骨尖啸24小时。

成功 生物获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}。

失败 生物获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}。

大失败 生物获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}并因恐惧而@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}。

Consume Flesh.description:
需求 食惧蝙蝠与刚死亡1小时内的生物尸体相邻

效果 食惧蝙蝠吞食一大块尸体并恢复1d6+食惧蝙蝠每2级额外1d6点生命值。它只能从每具尸体上获取1次生命值恢复。
Consume Flesh.name: 啃食尸体 Consume Flesh

Ghoul Fever.name: 食尸鬼热 Ghoul Fever
Ghoul Fever.description:
豁免检定 @Check[fortitude|dc:22]

阶段1 携带但不发病（1天）

阶段2 @Damage[2d6[void]]伤害且从任何治疗获得的生命值恢复均减半（1天）

阶段3 如阶段2（1天）

阶段4 @Damage[2d6[void]]伤害 且无法从治疗获得任何好处（1天）

阶段5 如阶段4（1天）

阶段6 死亡，并在下一日的午夜复生为食尸鬼。

Paralysis.name: Paralysis
Paralysis.description:
任何被食惧蝙蝠的打击命中的生物必须进行@Check[fortitude|dc:22]豁免。

大成功 该生物不受影响。

成功 生物获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}。

失败 生物被@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]。他可以在自己的每个回合结束时尝试一次新的豁免，每次此豁免的DC都会递减1点。

Swift Dart.name: 迅捷飞驰 Swift Dart
Swift Dart.description: 食惧蝙蝠飞行至多一半的速度。这次移动不会触发反应动作。

Feast on Fear.name: 饱餐恐惧 Feast on Fear
Feast on Fear.description:
触发 食惧蝙蝠用尖牙打击对一个处于惊惧状态的生物造成伤害

效果 食惧蝙蝠从渗满该生物血肉的恐惧中汲取力量。该惊惧生物进行@Check[fortitude|dc:22]豁免。

大成功 该生物不受影响。

成功 该生物的速度承受-5尺状态减值，食惧蝙蝠的速度获得+5尺状态加值，持续到其下回合结束。

失败 该生物的速度承受-10尺状态减值，食惧蝙蝠的速度获得+10尺状态加值，持续到其下回合结束。

大失败 该生物获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}，食惧蝙蝠可以立即以一个自由动作飞行、快步或行走；这次移动不会触发反应动作。

Skaveling.publicNotes:
想要制造食惧蝙蝠，就必须进行骇人的死灵仪式。尽管有时被称为食尸鬼蝙蝠，它们其实是特制的不死生物，而非真正的食尸鬼。幽暗地域（Darklands）的嗜血的透肌魔人（Urdefhans）以毒菌与食尸鬼的血肉——尤其是它们的脑子——培育巨蝙蝠。这些巨蝙蝠成熟之后，就会被仪式性地用毒素宰杀。虽然这种毒素只会腐蚀掉大多数动物的肉，但经过上述特殊处理的蝙蝠会在毒发身亡后立即以食惧蝙蝠的形态复活。

尽管它的翅膀破损、皮肤松弛，食惧蝙蝠仍有能力自如飞翔，哪怕背上载着一个生物。透肌魔人常常把食惧蝙蝠当做坐骑。它的智力比普通的巨蝙蝠更加出众，在战斗中它们能够独立做出战术决策，更像盟友而不仅是坐骑。

Change Shape.description:
The kithangian can take on the appearance of any Medium or Large animal. This doesn't change its Speed or their attack and damage modif ers with its Strikes, but it might change the damage type its Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]
Change Shape.name: Change Shape

Kithangian Venom.name: Kithangian Venom
Kithangian Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:25]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] (2 rounds)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (2 rounds)

Stage 3 @Damage[3d6[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (2 rounds)

Rasping Tongues.name: Rasping Tongues
Rasping Tongues.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements The kithangian has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in one or both pincers

Effect Barbed tongues slither out of the faces in the kithangian's pincers. The tongues burrow into grabbed creatures and inject their minds with haunting psychic screams. Each grabbed creature takes @Damage[2d8[piercing],2d8[mental]]{2d8 piercing and 2d8 mental}. A creature can try to resist the mental damage by attempting a @Check[will|dc:25|basic].

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Animal Kindness Vulnerability.name: Animal Kindness Vulnerability
Animal Kindness Vulnerability.description: Kithangians find kindness to animals revolting. The first time each round that a kithangian sees someone heal or otherwise provide aid to a creature that has the animal trait, the kithangian takes @Damage[3d6[mental]].

Animal Killer.name: Animal Killer
Animal Killer.description: A kithangian's melee Strikes deal an additional 2d6 damage to animals.

Kithangian.name: Kithangian
Kithangian.publicNotes: The kithangian—a horrifying amalgam of horse and scorpion also known as a "beast demon"—is a foul fend born of the souls of mortals who abused and tormented animals in life. Kithangians tend to roam wild areas rife with animals to torture, though humanoid settlements with plenty of pets or livestock also make for tantalizing hunting grounds. Uncontested for too long, a kithangian's presence has a corrupting influence on the local fauna, which birth fiendish monstrosities until the demon is vanquished. If it realizes it's being tracked by vengeful druids or demon slayers, a kithangian assumes the shape of an unassuming animal so it can get the jump on its pursuers.
Kithangian.allSaves: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Deep Breath.name: 深呼吸 Deep Breath
Deep Breath.description: The behemoth hippopotamus can hold its breath for 1 hour.

Capsize.name: Capsize
Capsize.description: The behemoth hippopotamus tries to capsize an adjacent aquatic vessel of its size or smaller. The behemoth hippopotamus must succeed at an @Check[athletics] check with a DC of 30 (reduced by 5 for each size smaller the vessel is than the hippo) or the pilot's Sailing Lore DC, whichever is higher.

Double Chomp.name: Double Chomp
Double Chomp.description: The behemoth hippo makes a jaws Strike targeting two creatures adjacent to each other. Roll the attack and damage once, and apply it to each creature separately. A Double Chomp counts as two attacks for the multiple attack penalty.

Behemoth Hippopotamus.name: Behemoth Hippopotamus
Behemoth Hippopotamus.publicNotes:
Behemoth hippos are omnivorous and many enjoy the taste of meat.

Hippopotamuses, or hippos for short, are semiaquatic animals that spend most of their time in rivers and lakes, but can thrive on land.

Spinosaurus.name: 棘龙 Spinosaurus

Rip and Tear.name: 横冲直撞 Rip and Tear
Rip and Tear.description:
需求 一个生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]于棘龙的口中

效果 棘龙抬起前爪撕扯被擒抱的生物，造成@Damage[4d8[slashing]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic]豁免）。豁免失败的生物还会受到@Damage[1d6[persistent,bleed]]伤害。

Staggering Sail.name: 巨浪翻腾 Staggering Sail
Staggering Sail.description:
需求 棘龙在水面上游泳

效果 棘龙侧过身，用强有力的背帆拍打水面，制造一道压倒性的水波，对@Template[cone|distance:30]范围内的生物造成@Damage[6d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage]伤害。区域中的每个生物必须尝试@Check[reflex|dc:30|options:area-effect,damaging-effect,inflicts:slowed,inflicts:stunned]豁免。

大成功 生物不受影响。

成功 生物承受一半伤害。

失败 生物承受完整伤害并陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]，直到其下回合结束。

大失败 生物承受双倍伤害且陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 3}。

Spinosaurus.publicNotes:
棘龙不仅是最大的肉食性恐龙之一，其外形也是最为独特的——它脊背上长着一条巨大的、帆状的鳍。这条鳍通常色彩艳丽，既能帮助棘龙吸引配偶，又有助于它在水中游动，还能让它看起来比实际体型更为庞大。游泳时，棘龙还能用这条鳍拍打水面，制造出具有冲击力的波浪，以此作为令猎物失去平衡的独特手段。棘龙的体长可达60尺，体重高达25,000磅。

棘龙在水里和陆地上都同样自在，它那长满利齿的大嘴非常适合捕捉水生猎物。巨人们试图捕捉棘龙来充当守卫的尝试通常都以失败告终，因为这些倔强的恐龙极难被驯化。它们乖戾的性情和引人注目的外表，使它们更适合成为血腥运动的主角，深受那些经营角斗场的人的青睐——这些角斗场专门举办角斗士与饥饿野兽之间的搏斗表演。这类表演堪称一场场血腥的视觉盛宴，能吸引数百英里外的观众前来观看。当然，一头被迫为他人娱乐而战斗的愤怒恐龙，可不会区分战场上的潜在猎物和看台上的观众，这意味着离竞技场边缘最近的座位很可能也会成为表演的一部分。

棘龙独特的外形和强大的力量，不仅吸引了巨人和血腥运动组织者，也对那些热衷于将动物变异改造为魔法守卫的施法者颇具吸引力。由于棘龙以凶暴著称，这些施法者在试图驯服并带它回家时面临着极大的危险。然而，对于那些对棘龙潜在能力感兴趣的人来说，这样的风险是值得的。与其他恐龙相比，棘龙更多地被隐居的施法者用于畸肉、与怪物杂交以及其他魔法实验，目的是增强它作为有效守卫的实用性。

Ovinnik.name: Ovinnik

Tremorsense (Imprecise) within their ent.name: Tremorsense (Imprecise) within their entire bound granary or storeroom

Master of the Granary.name: Master of the Granary
Master of the Granary.description:
A home with a friendly ovinnik is blessed, as the ovinnik preserves food from vermin and mold.

A home so blessed never suffers from random accidents such as fires, and any checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.rmwa3OyhTZ2i2AHl]{Craft}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QyzlsLrqM0EEwd7j]{Earn Income}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.bT3skovyLUtP22ME]{Repair}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.49y9Ec4bDii8pcD3]{Subsist} in the home receive a +2 circumstance bonus. If the ovinnik is unfriendly, such checks take a -2 circumstance penalty instead, as the ovinnik causes devastating fires and infestations

An ovinnik must spend a week in a place before these benefits occur.

Shy.name: Shy
Shy.description: An ovinnik is naturally @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} while within sight of their bound home. The ovinnik can become visible, or even selectively visible-allowing some people to see them.

Raise Grain Cloud.name: Raise Grain Cloud
Raise Grain Cloud.description:
While in their bound storeroom or granary, the ovinnik slams a paw against the ground, stirring up a cloud of grain dust in an @Template[emanation|distance:20].

Within this cloud, they gain a +4 status bonus to any fire damage they deal. The ovinnik doubles their fire resistance against this increased damage. The grain cloud dissipates after the first such effect or after 1 minute if no such effects occur.

Ovinnik.publicNotes:
The ovinnik is the most ferocious of house spirits, and the only one that will kill if sufficiently angered. They live in granaries, storage rooms, and sheds where food—particularly grain—is kept. Ovinniks resemble bipedal cats but bark like a dog to scare away thieves, and they often demand gifts of milk, pancakes, and dead roosters.

House spirits are shy, often helpful, sometimes wrathful fey who dwell alongside peasants and farmers. They reside in the house, the yard, the granary, the bathhouse—wherever people build and live. Due to this proximity, house spirits often take on the mannerisms or appearance of nearby mortals. Their reclusive nature and tendency to go unseen earned them the moniker of "spirits," though in truth they're fully embodied fey.

House spirits take an almost parental interest in "their" mortals. Given proper respect, these fey work tirelessly for their charges—they chop wood, care for livestock, mend clothes, sweep the floor, and tend to the stove. If offended, though, the house spirit becomes a menace, frightening animals or children and ruining belongings.

Vigilia.name: Vigilia

Spell Effect: See the Unseen.name: Spell Effect: See the Unseen
Spell Effect: See the Unseen.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.jwK43yKsHTkJQvQ9]{See the Unseen}

You can see invisible creatures as though they weren't invisible, although their features are blurred, making them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} and difficult to identify. You also gain a +2 status bonus to checks you make to disbelieve illusions.

Electrical Purge.name: Electrical Purge
Electrical Purge.description: The vigilia releases lightning from their body in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] dealing @Damage[4d10[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[Refex|dc:30|basic] save) to all creatures that aren't aeons or constructs. The vigilia is then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Lightning Chain.name: Lightning Chain
Lightning Chain.description: The vigilia wraps momentary chains of electrical energy around a creature within 60 feet, dealing @Damage[2d10[electricity]] damage (@Check[Refex|dc:30|basic] save). A creature that fails its save is also pulled 10 feet toward the vigilia (20 feet on a critical failure).

Take Prisoner.name: Take Prisoner
Take Prisoner.description: The vigilia Interacts to pick up a Medium or smaller @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} creature within its reach, then Strides.

Vigilia.publicNotes:
Axis's construct guardians are built in great numbers by axiomites and regularly patrol the streets of that rigidly structured metropolis. Beyond the city, a vigilia can be summoned by mortals to guard a specifc location or enforce a leader's edicts.

Although generally humanoid in form, their bodies are a loose mesh of brass strips around a crystalline core like the arbiters they're based on. Each vigilia's core is formed around a different fragment of legal text from Axis's vast libraries. This bylaw or subsection, although not necessarily important to others, forms the mystical and emotional driving force behind these sentinels.

Left to their own devices, vigilias typically enforce local laws to the best of their understanding, falling back on the labyrinthine ordinances of Axis to fll in any gaps. Although vigilias are uncomfortable making judgment calls, they're capable of doing so. That said, this discomfort frequently causes them to seek refuge in areas with the most complex and complete laws.

Sunset Dependent.name: Sunset Dependent
Sunset Dependent.description:
A hesperid is mystically bonded to a single remote location with a good view of the sunset-usually an island, coastal cliff, or valley. If they aren't at that location and able to see the sky at sunset on any given day, they become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}, increasing the value by 1 for each missed sunset and reducing by 1 only when they see the sunset.

A hesperid can perform a 24-hour ritual to bond to a new location.

Create Golden Apple.name: Create Golden Apple
Create Golden Apple.description:
While the hesperid is within their bonded location, they can spin golden light around an object they're holding of up to 20 cubic feet in volume and up to 80 Bulk. Doing so condenses the object into a magic apple made of golden light with light Bulk.

The golden apple reverts back to its original shape after a full day away from the hesperid's bonded location, or when the hesperid spends a single action (which has the concentrate trait) to end the effect.

Hesperid.name: Hesperid
Hesperid.publicNotes:
Hesperides are nymphs of sunset, guardians of the colorful golden hues of the setting sun. They live on remote islands, isolated coastal cliffsides, and hidden valleys, all places where the sunset's golden glow can have the strongest effect. Hesperides manipulate sunlight with dancelike motions, allowing them to create graceful ribbons of light at close range and searing rays at a distance. Due to their connection to the beauty of the daily cycle of the setting sun, hesperides take a deep satisfaction from methodical routine that can feel alien to wilder, more chaotic fey.

Nymphs are fey guardians of nature possessed of great beauty and forms that meld breathtaking humanoid features with the natural elements they guard. Nymph queens are powerful nymphs who rule over and protect a much greater territory of untouched wilderness. For instance, a lampad might guard a beautiful underground cavern, but a lampad queen might call an entire system of caves their domain.

Ferrugon.name: Ferrugon

Ferrugon Tetanus.name: Ferrugon Tetanus
Ferrugon Tetanus.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:32]

Onset [[/gmr 1d4 #Days]]{1d4 days}

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 week)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and can't speak (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} (1 day)

Stage 4 death

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Metallic.name: Metallic
Metallic.description: A ferrugon is a metallic creature and thus affected by effects such as the circumstance penalty inflicted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.zDJS8E66UI0himqV]{Thunderstrike}.

Vainglorious Whispers.name: Vainglorious Whispers
Vainglorious Whispers.description:
Trigger A non-devil creature within 30 feet of the ferrugon succeeds (but doesn't critically succeed) at an attack roll, skill check, or saving throw

Effect The ferrugon whispers subversive messages to the triggering creature, causing it to become overly confident in its abilities, while in fact it becomes less accomplished overall. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:32] save. On a failure, the target gains a +2 status bonus to saving throws against fear effects but also takes a –2 penalty to all attack rolls and skill checks for 1 hour. During this time, the victim can't benefit from @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aid} reactions, use healing effects on themselves, or use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ust1jJSCZQUhBZIz]{Take Cover} or Raise a Shield actions, as these actions seem unnecessary to the creature at this time. Similar defensive actions might not be available to the victim as well, at the GM's discretion. The target is then temporarily immune to Vainglorious Whispers for 24 hours.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.nBlTMBTX6owUiyCF]{Effect: Vainglorious Whispers}

Sunder Objects.name: Sunder Objects
Sunder Objects.description: When a ferrugon damages an item or structure, they deal an additional 2d8 damage to that item or structure.

Ferrugon.publicNotes:
These ram-headed devils have wings and flesh made of rusted metal. They're forged from the souls of damned mortals who made others suffer through their creative work. They like to tempt those of the same ilk, driving auteurs and stage directors to cruelty in the pursuit of greatness. Ferrugons also enjoy pushing artists to extremes in order to break them. They dip the bodies of mortals they've driven to despair into molten metal to make horrifically malformed statues, which they then add to their lairs.

Rust devils prefer temptation to fighting and only enter combat if protecting something dear to them.
Ferrugon.allSaves: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Berberoka.name: Berberoka

Consume Lake.name: Consume Lake
Consume Lake.description:
The berberoka drinks a prolific amount from an adjacent water source. If the water source is equal to or greater in volume than themself, the berberoka consumes up to 1,500 gallons of water per minute and becomes waterlogged. They can release water at the same rate. While waterlogged, the berberoka can use Spray Water, their size grows to Gargantuan, and their Speed is reduced to 15 feet.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.UxNq9uo1GpDYTi5Z]{Effect: Waterlogged}

Spray Water.name: Spray Water
Spray Water.description:
Requirements The berberoka is waterlogged.

Effect The berberoka sprays a blast of water in a @Template[line|distance:60]. All creatures in the line take @Damage[6d8[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:35|basic|options:area-effect,forced-movement,inflicts:prone] save). On a failed save, a creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and pushed back 5 feet (10 feet on a critically failed save).

Deep Breath.name: 深呼吸 Deep Breath
Deep Breath.description: A berberoka can hold their breath for 2 hours

Fear of Crabs.name: Fear of Crabs
Fear of Crabs.description:
If a berberoka sees a crab or crab-like creature, the berberoka must attempt a @Check[will|dc:33|options:inflicts:frightened] save. They then become immune to the sight of that creature for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The berberoka is unaffected.

Success The berberoka becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Failure The berberoka gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition for 1 round and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4}.

Berberoka.publicNotes:
Berberokas are giant humanoids who live among forests and swamps, where they use their ability to swallow massive amounts of water to drain small ponds and lakes. Creatures who visit their favorite watering hole and find only an empty mud basin become prey for the berberoka, who hides in the brush and overwhelm their prey with a massive torrent of regurgitated water.

A berberoka's mottled backside-which resembles a bundle of local plants, small trees, and large rocks-grants them natural camouflage that allows them to hide in plain sight. Berberokas tend to disguise themselves as rock formations in the center of a dried-up waterbed while they lie in wait for passersby. In the tropical regions where berberokas are most common, locals know to give empty ponds a wide berth, regardless of the enticing fish flopping about. Hungry travelers, on the other hand, might see such bounty as a blessing from the gods, only to be swept up in the berberoka's deadly deluge.

Doru.name: Doru

Covetous of Secrets.name: Covetous of Secrets
Covetous of Secrets.description:
Dorus have a weakness for secrets, hoarding them like a miser hoards gold. A creature can tempt a doru with some bit of obscure knowledge the doru doesn't know or thinks they don't know.

Presenting the hint of the secret is a single action, which has the concentrate and linguistic traits, and requires a skill check using Deception, Lore, or Performance (or some other appropriate skill determined by the GM) against the doru's Will DC.

On a success, the doru is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} for as long as the presenter draws out the explanation of the secret (spending 1 action each round doing so, to a maximum of 1 minute). On a critical success, the doru is fascinated for that duration plus 1 minute more as it ponders the implications of the secret. Regardless of the outcome, the doru is temporarily immune to that creature's attempts to present it with secrets for 1 day.

Doru Venom.name: Doru Venom
Doru Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:16]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (1 round)

Doru.publicNotes:
These deceivers whisper fetid lies, sowing dark and dread inspiration into foolish mortal ears. Dorus serve as the spies and messengers of the divs. With silver tongues and dark motives, they often pledge themselves to vainglorious and deluded spellcasters, who they ply with wild conspiracies and rumors of deception among friends and foes alike; in the process, they push supposed masters to despotism and murderous revenge. All the while, dorus wean secrets, and weaknesses, from their marks. In the end, nearly every doru turns on their false liege, destroying the reputation and even causing the death of the person the doru pretended to serve.

Some fiends want to tear down the multiverse; others dedicate themselves to creating chaos and carnage, or to rule over realms with an iron fist. Divs strive toward a different, if equally reprehensible, goal-they seek to thwart and ruin the schemes and works of mortal beings.

Long ago, divs were once genies bound to serve ancient mortal empires lost to the passage of eons. In the beginning, these genies were masters of creation, working alongside gracious mortal partners to create works of subtle design and powerful magical potential. What started as a collaboration with mortals soon morphed into abuse, disrespect, and even slavery and bondage. Eventually, these genies rebelled, but in doing so, they came under the sway of a nihilistic demigod known as Ahriman. Their new master twisted their form and granted them the power to avenge themselves upon their mortal overlords, leading to the birth of the first divs.

Since that first wave of corruption, new divs arise from the spirits of the most wicked and hateful genies who die on the Material Plane, or those truly betrayed by mortals and overcome through their desire for vengeance. Upon such a death, instead of returning to the Elemental Planes, these genies' spirits are trapped in the dread orbit of Abaddon, where Ahriman reshapes them as divs and hoists them back to the world to wreak vengeance upon mortals.

Axe Vulnerability.name: Axe Vulnerability
Axe Vulnerability.description: An arboreal reaper takes 5 additional damage from axes.

Leech Moisture.name: Leech Moisture
Leech Moisture.description:
The arboreal reaper grows still and focuses intently on a single foe within 50 feet, draining moisture from the target's body. This deals @Damage[10d6[void]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:25|basic] save).

The arboreal reaper can't Leech Moisture again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Leech Moisture]]{1d4 rounds}.

Arboreal Reaper.name: Arboreal Reaper
Arboreal Reaper.publicNotes:
While some forests have an idyllic, peaceful quality to them, others feel distinctly unfriendly or even sinister-these forests are the favored haunts of arboreal reapers. Sometimes these woodlands are sought out by secretive practitioners of malicious arts who claim the unsettling ambiance aids their abilities; arboreal reapers see no reason to interfere with such practices as long as the balance of their forests isn't harmed.

All arboreals vary in appearance based on their surroundings, but arboreal reapers always seem vaguely eerie, whether they watch over a grim weald or a tropical rain forest. Often slightly warped, twisted, and covered in spiky protrusions, arboreal reapers sometimes sprout around old ruins or other permanent structures, breaking down and incorporating the structures as they mature and become more mobile.

Arboreal reapers focus on the essential decaying phase of a forest's life cycle, becoming especially active in autumn and winter seasons. Their influence can often be seen in the explosion of mushrooms on a rotting log or the enticing fronds of a flourishing carnivorous plant. Like arboreal wardens, these woodland guardians are quicker to react to perceived threats than the more deliberate regents or retiring archives-at least by arboreal standards.

Arboreals are tree-like ancient guardians of forests, nurturing new growth and maintaining a balanced ecosystem as if the vast wilderness were their garden. Arboreals are thoughtful and deliberate - until something threatens their realms and invites their wrath.

Biomineralize.name: 生物矿化 Biomineralize
Biomineralize.description:
触发 珊瑚龙被一个没有长触及特征的近战武器或无武装攻击重击，且该攻击造成挥砍或穿刺伤害

效果 珊瑚龙的伤口喷出一股血液，瞬间钙化为一根尖锐的珊瑚枝。珊瑚枝刺穿触发的生物，造成@Damage[5d6[piercing]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic]豁免）。豁免大失败的生物还会额外受到@Damage[1d4[persistent,bleed]]伤害。无论结果如何，珊瑚都会随后崩溃为尘土。

Reef Bond.name: 礁石契约 Reef Bond
Reef Bond.description:
每条珊瑚龙都与一个活珊瑚礁有神秘联系。如果珊瑚龙距离它们的珊瑚礁超过3英里，它们会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}且无法恢复，每6小时恶心值增加1，除非它们成功进行一次@Check[fortitude|dc:28]豁免。24小时后，珊瑚龙获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}；每24小时流失值增加1。

如果珊瑚礁遭受重大伤害，珊瑚龙会立即察觉到珊瑚礁受损的地点，但无法知道伤害的来源或性质。如果珊瑚礁被完全摧毁，珊瑚龙会立即死亡。

Hydraulic Breath.name: 液压吐息 Hydraulic Breath
Hydraulic Breath.description: 珊瑚龙喷出一股高压水流，在@Template[type:line|distance:80]范围内造成@Damage[9d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect,forced-movement,inflicts:prone]豁免）。豁免大失败的生物被推离10尺并被击至@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]。珊瑚龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Hydraulic Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用液压吐息。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: 对抗原能的全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Reef Meld.name: 珊瑚融合 Reef Meld
Reef Meld.description:
频率 每日一次

需求 珊瑚龙与它们的绑定珊瑚礁有物理接触

效果 珊瑚龙与珊瑚礁融合并消失，同时最多可带着两名自愿的生物进入一个异次元空间，在这个空间中既无法影响外界，也不会被外界影响。该效果无限期持续直到珊瑚龙解消为止。一旦融合，珊瑚龙可以花费1分钟移动并从其珊瑚礁上任意1英里内的点出现。

Coral Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: 青年珊瑚龙施法者 Coral Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)
Coral Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes: 珊瑚龙是守护广袤海洋珊瑚礁的原始守护者，珊瑚礁遍布于格拉利昂的各大海洋中。即便在龙族中，珊瑚龙也因其傲慢与虚荣而尤为突出，它们为自己覆满珊瑚的鳞片和所保护的五彩斑斓的珊瑚礁而骄傲。珊瑚龙喜欢装饰它们的珊瑚礁，它们视这些珊瑚礁为巢穴，常常用美丽的物品装饰，偶尔也会加入一些贵重物品，如金币。那些寻求珊瑚龙宠爱的人常会发现，这些龙容易被奉承所打动，尤其是当奉承与闪亮或色彩鲜艳的礼物相结合时，这些礼物能与龙及其水下领域的璀璨美丽相得益彰。

Ostiarius.name: 司门魔 Ostiarius
Ostiarius.publicNotes:
司门魔，作为链魔的密使，在影界和物质宇宙之间的入口附近活动。他们不仅护送其他链魔进入凡人的世界，也会将凡人引诱至链魔的领域——被引诱的凡人将几乎无法逃离。司门魔是链魔中最令人愉快且最具口才的，他们可以连续几个小时滔滔不绝的讨论他们离奇哲学中的愉悦命题。司门魔身高超过6尺，身材从瘦骨嶙峋到异常魁梧各不相同。

这些栖身于暗影的魔族——链魔——全都有着一种骇人的执念：通过自残来追寻终极感官体验。链魔只有在向受害者施加痛苦与恐惧、尝试新的酷刑手法，或是将折磨反施于己身时，才会暂时摆脱一贯的冷酷淡漠。它们自诩为觉悟者，超越了道德与凡俗禁忌的束缚；但在受害者眼中，它们只是毫无感情、专施虐待狂式痛苦的折磨者。这些魔族声称在思想、形式和行为上追求绝对的完美，并且它们不承认那些不需要切除肉体或折磨精神的锻炼方式。链魔从极度喜欢施虐或受虐的凡人灵魂中诞生，它们被审判并被送往影界。它们被塑造成各种适合于它们邪恶嗜好的形态，从低级的邪窥魔到制造痛苦和残废的大师邪隐魔。转化过程会进一步扭曲它们的灵魂，其他的链魔会将它们的新成员送到影界数不清的痛苦之室中。
Ostiarius.allSaves: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Painsight.name: 痛苦视觉 Painsight
Painsight.description: 链魔能自动知晓它们能看到的一个生物是否具有@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]、@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]状态，以及具体的状态值。

Sense Portal.name: 感知传送门 Sense Portal
Sense Portal.description: 司门魔总能知道距离最近的连同阴影界和物质宇宙的传送门的方向和距离。这种感官会在上述两个位面起作用。

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Regeneration 5 (Deactivated by Holy or S.name: 再生5（圣洁或银使其无效） Regeneration 5 (Deactivated by Holy or Silver)

Whispering Wounds.name: 低语伤口 Whispering Wounds
Whispering Wounds.description: 30尺。如果有生物在灵光范围内结束回合，他将听到司门魔身上的伤口在低声吟诵污秽的真理。生物必须通过@Check[will|dc:21|options:inflicts:sickened]检定，否则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}。

Compel Courage.name: 强迫英勇 Compel Courage
Compel Courage.description: 司门魔从它们的伤口中低声吟诵鼓舞人心的话语，激励自身以及自愿的盟友。司门魔自身以及@Template[type:emanation|distance:50]范围内的盟友的攻击骰、伤害骰、对抗恐惧效果的豁免获得+1状态加值。司门魔可以维持强迫英勇。接受并受益于强迫英勇的非链魔生物，会发现自己身上裂开很多道伤口，并且这些伤口都在低声道谢。他们受到1点持续性流血伤害，并且只要此能力生效期间，无法通过纯骰检定来结束流血。

Focus Gaze.name: 聚焦凝视 Focus Gaze
Focus Gaze.description: 司门魔盯着一个30尺内它可以看见的生物。该生物必须立即尝试1次对抗低语伤口能力的意志豁免。此外，如果生物已经陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]，并且豁免失败，则该生物被司门魔@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]，并且无法使用敌对动作。此迷魂状态持续一轮，或直到司门魔对他或他的盟友采取敌对动作。无论生物是否成功通过此豁免，他将在1小时内对聚焦凝视临时免疫。

Tide Giant.name: 潮汐巨人 Tide Giant

Cloak of High Tide.name: 满潮斗篷 Cloak of High Tide
Cloak of High Tide.description:
10尺。

水元素魔法在潮汐巨人的身上起伏、流淌进他们的身躯中。在战斗中，每当潮汐巨人的回合开始，若他的满潮斗篷没有启动，则会自行启动；反之，若他的满潮斗篷已经启动，则其效果会结束。除了潮汐巨人之外的任何生物在他的回合进入启动了的满潮斗篷的范围中时，会获得5HP；这是一个治疗效果，且一个生物1轮只能从此效果中获益一次。当它启动时，斗篷看起来像是一道从潮汐巨人肩膀与后背中冒出的魔法海沫。当潮汐巨人不处于战斗中时，斗篷不会启动。

Blood Tide.name: 血潮 Blood Tide
Blood Tide.description: 潮汐巨人游泳，若满潮斗篷正在启动则游泳两次。潮汐巨人向前伸出他的三叉戟，捅向所有游经的敌人，所有位于巨人移动路径10尺内的敌人受到@Damage[2d8[piercing]]伤害和@Damage[2d6[persistent,bleed]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic]豁免）。在一次血潮中，被选为目标的生物只会被影响一次。

Tine and Tide.name: 潮尖 Tine and Tide
Tine and Tide.description: 潮汐巨人的三叉戟中迸发出一股水波，影响@Template[type:cone|distance:15]或100尺距离内的@Template[type:burst|distance:5]范围。若潮汐巨人的满潮斗篷正启动着，范围则增加到@Template[type:cone|distance:30]或@Template[type:burst|distance:10]。范围内的所有生物受到@Damage[9d8[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage]伤害，@Check[reflex|dc:33|basic]豁免。

Tide Giant.publicNotes:
在人迹罕至的海滩上，海浪冲刷着整洁无暇、无人染指的沙滩，潮汐巨人独自栖居于此。他们致力于生活在宁静祥和之地，欣赏周遭的美景。潮汐巨人喜爱在沙滩上悠闲漫步，过着慢节奏的生活，身旁环绕着海角的景色、声音和气味，当然还包括一碗果汁或者朗姆酒。许多潮汐巨人深信，他们能通过欣赏水之美来加固与海洋魔法那珍贵且神圣的联系，比如看着日光映照下拍打着海角的海浪。干扰、入侵者和其他意外都会极大地影响潮汐巨人的冷静，将他们平和的态度变为一场狂怒的飓风。

巨人们遍布世界各地，他们的形态如同栖身的偏远之地一样多种多样。一个巨人会给当地环境留下深刻印记，尤其对那些相较他们体型小、力量弱的生物而言。

Record Audio.name: 录音 Record Audio
Record Audio.description:
发条密探能将@Template[emanation|distance:25]内的所有声音录在它携带的价值1gp的一小块宝石上。发条密探能在一块宝石上录最多1小时的音频。一旦开始录音，它就不能提前中止，也不能对已经录有音频的宝石进行覆盖。一些发条机械携带有多枚宝石，让它们能进行一系列的录音行动。发条机械可以区分不同种类的生物，但是无法分辨具体的个体。

发条密探可以通过一个动作来开始或停止播放录音。通过[[/act disable-device dc=14]]{DC14贼活检定}的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]可以从发条密探上移除或安装一块宝石，如果检定失败，宝石不会损坏但所有录音会被消除且该宝石也不能被用来录音。

Self-Destruct.name: 自毁 Self-Destruct
Self-Destruct.description:
除非发条密探身处某些创造者编程时特别禁止的地点，否则发条密探一定会使用该反应动作。

触发 发条密探的生命值减少至0

效果 发条密探带着一声细小的尖叫猛扑过来，然后发出倒计时的滴答声。在使用此反应动作后，当它的下一回合开始时，发条密探会自爆，对@Template[emanation|distance:5]范围内造成@Damage[1d10[piercing]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:16|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。它的宝石连同里面的所有信息都会被摧毁。

一个相邻的生物可以尝试通过@Check[thievery|dc:16|traits:action:disable-a-device]检定来@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]，取消自毁程序。

Wind-Up.name: 上发条 Wind-Up
Wind-Up.description:
24小时，@Check[thievery|traits:action:disable-a-device|dc:14]，待机

要让发条机械运转，必须由另一个生物用一把独特的钥匙给它上发条。这需要1分钟时间。一旦上紧发条，它们能在列出的时间内活动，通常为24小时，时间耗尽之后它们就无法察觉周围的环境且无法行动，直到再次被上紧发条。一些发条机械的能力在使用时需要以减少活动时间为代价。它们消耗的活动时间不能超过当前剩余的活动时间，一旦活动时间为0，它们就会立即关机。如果不清楚发条机械上一次上发条是什么时候，大多数发条机械的管理员都会在早上8点上发条。

如果发条机械的"上发条"条目中列出了"待机"，则它可以用一个三动作的行动来进入待机模式。在待机状态下，它的运转时间不会减少，但它能感知周围环境（察觉检定有-2减值）。它无法行动，但有一个例外情况：当它感知到有生物时，可以作为反应退出待机模式（并且如果状况合适，则进行先攻检定）。

一个生物可以尝试对上了发条的发条机械进行@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]，解除DC在上发条能力中列出。每次成功的尝试都能减少发条机械1小时活动时间。这对于处于待机模式中的发条机械也能正常生效。

Clockwork Spy.name: 发条密探 Clockwork Spy
Clockwork Spy.publicNotes:
工程师、技术专家和具有机械天赋的巫师们利用发条密探——能够录音和回放音频的超小型蜘蛛构装体——暗中监视他们的敌人或窃取竞争对手的秘密。它们纤细的身躯和脆弱的部件使它们不适合战斗；事实上，大多数创造者都会给发条密探加上自毁机制，以确保一旦这种间谍行为败露，自己不会被追查。

发条机械是错综复杂的机器，由技艺高超的工程师精心制造。虽然它们的创造过程包含了一些魔法，但它们本质上是机械，里面塞满了精密调整的齿轮和弹簧，严丝合缝，协同工作。

发条机械内坚固的主发条必须上紧，才能提供装置所需的能量。一些较大的发条机械包含一系列弹簧，用于不同的肢体，每个肢体都需要分别上紧发条。发条工匠在制作发条机械时会创造一个独特的金属钥匙；上发条时通常需要把钥匙插入机器的背面，然后顺时针旋转。更大的发条机构需要更大的力量来转动钥匙，而且通常有更大的钥匙来提供更大的扭矩——有些甚至需要一整队人上发条，而不是单人操作。给发条程序编程需要用到钥匙和能正确设置程序的相关知识，这些信息通由发条机械的创造者或所有者持有。

Heat of the Forge.name: Heat of the Forge
Heat of the Forge.description: 10 feet. A munsahir's skin radiates heat like forge fire. A creature that starts its turn in the area must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:16] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} while it remains in the area. Creatures immune to environmental heat effects or with any fire resistance are immune.

Burning Touch.name: Burning Touch
Burning Touch.description: The munsahir's Strikes deal an extra @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage (included above). When the munsahir successfully performs a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.lOE4yjUnETTdaf2T]{Reposition}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}, they also deal @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage to their target.

Scorch.name: Scorch
Scorch.description:
Requirements The munsahir is wielding a light hammer

Effect The munsahir shrouds the light hammer in flames and hurls it forward, dealing @Damage[2d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature in a @Template[type:line|distance:20] (@Check[reflex|dc:16|basic] save).

Munsahir.name: Munsahir
Munsahir.publicNotes:
Munsahirs are an elemental people living on the Plane of Fire, often crudely described by mortals as brassy dwarves. They have stout, wide bodies with broad shoulders, shining metallic skin, and heads wreathed in flame.

Munsahir society is organized into traditional roles inherited along their familial lines, and a munsahir's role is indicated clearly by the metals they wear in their armored kilts. Their culture focuses on tradition and history, placing high value on obedience and conformity within one's community, and as a result it's slow to change. Many munsahirs take pride in their ancestral roles and in fulfilling their inherited duties, providing needed services within their communities.

Long ago, traditional munsahir values of self-sufficiency and close community led them to build mighty fortresses across the Plane of Fire, where they isolated themselves from other planar denizens and even other munsahir communities. These values, sadly, also led to their downfall. Without any connections to or regular communication with other settlements, these fortresses were easily conquered by the ifrits of Medina Mudii'a, the dominant power on the Plane of Fire. Now most munsahir fortresses lie abandoned and ruined, with free holds so few and far between that most think them all lost.

Munsahirs born within the ifrits' Dominion of Flame belong to the populations that were conquered and assimilated into the empire ages ago. They live in perpetual service to the empire, disconnected from their history and culture, yet have formed their own close-knit society in Medina Mudii'a under the fire genies' harsh rule. A handful of munsahir communities have escaped ifrit conquest, most often by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} far from the genies' realms. Some of these munsahirs now reside in hot, volcanic areas of the Darklands on Golarion, while others have fled to the remote depths within the Plane of Fire. Prying outsiders nevertheless perpetually seek out these settlements, longing for legendary munsahir-crafted goods.

Ostovite.name: Ostovite

Bone Chariot.name: Bone Chariot
Bone Chariot.description:
Ostovites build and inhabit moving shells of bone. The ostovite's base statistics, particularly its immunities, assume the ostovite is safely inside its bone chariot. The bone chariot is destroyed when the ostovite is reduced to less than half its Hit Points or immediately after it takes damage from a critical hit. Damage that can specifically affect the ostovite controlling the chariot even while it's inside (such as the spell spirit blast) doesn't destroy the bone chariot, and it bypasses the ostovite's immunities.

Without the bone chariot, the ostovite loses its immunities and bone spike Strike, and it is reduced to Tiny size. It also gains weakness 5 to mental and physical damage as well as damage with the holy trait. Building a new bone chariot requires the skeleton of a Small or larger creature and 10 minutes. An ostovite in a bone chariot is normally Small, though larger bone chariots are possible, especially when ostovites work together.

Scuttle Away.name: Scuttle Away
Scuttle Away.description:
Trigger The ostovite's bone chariot is destroyed

Effect The ostovite within Steps or Strides.

Ostovite.publicNotes:
Skittering scavenger vermin common throughout the Abyss, ostovites roam battlefields to harvest flesh and bones. After the ostovites dissolve and slurp up the flesh for sustenance, they craft the bones into elaborate shells they refer to as "bone chariots."

These bone chariots move under the ostovites' command and serve as an important marker of rank in ostovite nests. To the tiny ostovites, bigger is better, and building large skeletal conveyances is the only way for them to increase their standing in life. Although they feel deeply inferior to creatures larger than themselves, this fear can be overwhelmed by the ostovites' visceral desire to harvest those creatures' bones to increase their own status. When confronted with a particularly massive skeleton, ostovites generally fight among themselves and end up splitting the haul. However, there are rare instances of the selfish creatures working together to puppeteer a much larger bone chariot.

Ostovites' faint understanding of anatomy results in bone chariots that look more like a nightmarish attempt at art than any creature the bones were pulled from. Some powerful fiends and their admirers collect this strange art by bribing ostovites with skeletons or finding ways to kill ostovites without disrupting the chariot around them.

Despite ostovites' origins in the Outer Rifts, they are neither demons nor qlippoth. Without the protection of the major fiends, they find their homes in nooks and crannies along the corners of their home plane. Though they have no innate ability to cross the planar boundaries, flaws in the Outer Rifts' fabric often lead them to worlds across the planes. Ostovites that have thus migrated are often much happier. Away from demonic abuse, they usually can be found near mortal crypts and battlefields. In the Universe, they rarely have to face any threats other than the undead, clerics of Pharasma, and families of the deceased.

Absorb Force.name: 吸收力场 Absorb Force
Absorb Force.description:
频率 每轮一次

触发 一个力场飞弹或力场飞镖（见下）以巫怪为目标，且他有一只空闲手

效果 巫怪一把"抓"住（一发）飞弹，并吸收它，只要他还握着这股能量，他的手就会发光。握着能量的手除了施展力场飞镖能力外不能做其他任何事。这股能量能维持1分钟或直至它被释放。

Force Dart.name: 力场飞镖 Force Dart
Force Dart.description:
1至3

每花费一个动作，巫怪就发射一枚力场飞镖（每发造成@Damage[(1d4+1)[force]]伤害）。他们不能在此能力上花费超过其空闲手数量的动作。如果他用一只正用于吸收力场能力的手施展力场飞镖，那只手会投出两枚而非一枚飞弹，并消耗所持有的能量。

Witchwyrd.name: 巫怪 Witchwyrd
Witchwyrd.publicNotes:
巫怪们遮住了他们几乎全部的脸，只露出一双眼睛。他们难以捉摸的外貌和性格对他们最重要的兴趣——重商主义——大有裨益，许多傲慢的巫怪毫不掩饰地陶醉于因其神秘的伪装和举止所致的困惑。巫怪们对新的机遇和市场有着敏锐的眼光，而且他们几乎总能知道对方打算涮他们。

这些四臂的类人生物有着无毛的蓝灰色皮肤，通常6-1/2尺高，300磅重。他们的手有三根大小相等，间隔排布成正四面体的手指。当它们不打算融入本地社区时，巫怪喜欢身穿异域风情的黄色或红色宽松袍子，头戴标志性的圆锥形帽子。巫怪倾向于选择他们造访的星球中最干燥、最温暖的地区，这或许表明了他们神秘家园的特征。巫怪们对这个遥远的世界是出了名的三缄其口，而且有着充分的理由：格拉利昂上的大部分巫怪从没去过他们的祖籍。对这些巫怪来说，母星的概念一直是他们的眼中钉，当被问及这个问题时，许多人选择完全忽略这个问题。另一些人被这些问题弄得心烦意乱，以至于急躁回应甚至以暴力相向。一些学者提出了巫怪与其他几种四臂生物之间存在联系的理论，但如同被问及他们的起源一样，巫怪对这个话题也缄口不言。

Transparent.description:
A slithering pit is so clear it's difficult to spot. A successful @Check[perception|dc:30] check is required to notice a stationary slithering pit, and a creature must be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.TiNDYUGlMmxzxBYU]{Searching} to attempt this check.

A creature that walks into the pit's space might fall into any active Dimensional Pit.
Transparent.name: Transparent

Breach Vulnerability.name: Breach Vulnerability
Breach Vulnerability.description: Ingesting an extradimensional space like that found in a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.jaEEvuQ32GjAa8jy]{Spacious Pouch} deals @Damage[6d8[force]] damage to the slithering pit and its occupants. The slithering pit then immediately uses Out You Go.

Dimensional Pit.name: Dimensional Pit
Dimensional Pit.description:
The slithering pit opens an extradimensional, 20-foot-deep pit that covers its own space and all adjacent squares unless they're walls or similar blocking terrain.

Any other creature occupying or entering pit spaces must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:22] save or fall into the pit, taking damage from the fall (typically @Damage[10[bludgeoning]] damage). Any creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the slithering pit falls in and is no longer grabbed, even if it was outside the pit squares.

While a Dimensional Pit is open, the slithering pit is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, can't be forced to move, and can make pseudopod Strikes originating from the walls of the pit. A creature that starts its turn at the bottom of the pit takes @Damage[2d6[acid]] damage. Climbing the walls of the pit requires a @Check[athletics|dc:22] check.

When the slithering pit dies, the Dimensional Pit closes and creatures inside are ejected, with the effects of Out You Go.

Flurry of Pods.name: Flurry of Pods
Flurry of Pods.description: The slithering pit makes a single pseudopod Strike against each target within range it doesn't already have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. These attacks count toward the slithering pit's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after all of these attacks.

Out You Go.name: Out You Go
Out You Go.description: The slithering pit closes all pit spaces it created using Dimensional Pit, ejecting all its occupants onto the ground into random free spaces where the pit opened. Each occupant takes @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save).

Slithering Pit.name: Slithering Pit
Slithering Pit.publicNotes:
A slithering pit is a strange, nearly invisible ooze with an extradimensional space for its digestive system, which mimics the appearance of an acid-filled stone pit. It slowly dissolves its captives in stomach acid until they can be digested. A slithering pit can go weeks without feeding, affording it patience.

Thriving in dilapidated areas, the slithering pit takes up position among the plentiful potholes where it can easily pass for just another blemish. It crawls across ramshackle cobblestone streets and damp underground complexes, waiting for unwary prey to stumble by and fall in.

Devastating Blast.name: 毁灭爆震 Devastating Blast
Devastating Blast.description:
死墓骑士上尉释放出@Template[cone|distance:30]能量。区域内的生物受到@Damage[4d12[acid]|options:area-damage]伤害，@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic|options:area-effect]豁免。

死墓骑士上尉在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Devastating Blast]]{1d4轮}内无法使用此能力。

Weapon Master.description: 死墓骑士无论持用何种武器，均可以使用该武器的重击专精效果。
Weapon Master.name: 武器大师 Weapon Master

Graveknight's Shield.name: 死墓骑士盾牌 Graveknight's Shield
Graveknight's Shield.description: 死墓骑士的诅咒延伸至它们的盾牌上，或者死墓骑士护甲用自己的一部分来制造一面盾牌。死墓骑士有一面盾牌，其使用等级不高于死墓骑士等级-1的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.f9ygr5Cjrmop8LWV]的数据。盾牌准独立于死墓骑士，并会自动保护死墓骑士不受伤害。当这面盾牌被举起时，它会自动使用@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.m4HQ2o5aPxjXf2kY]来减少每轮第一次对死墓骑士的攻击造成的伤害，死墓骑士无需为这次格挡花费反应动作。盾牌会自动和死墓骑士的剩余部分一起复生，想要摧毁它必须用和摧毁死墓骑士护甲同样的方式。

Rejuvenation.name: 复生 Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: 当死墓骑士被摧毁时，其护甲会在[[/gmr 1d10 #days]]{1d10天}内重塑身体——若护甲被活着的宿主穿戴则会更加迅速（见上面帖子中的死墓骑士护甲）。若身体在此之前被破坏，重塑过程将重新开始。只有摧毁护甲（比如使用@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]）、把死墓骑士传送至创世熔炉、或者丢进火山之中才能够永久摧毁死墓骑士。

Graveknight's Curse.name: 死墓骑士诅咒 Graveknight's Curse
Graveknight's Curse.description:
诅咒会影响任何穿戴死墓骑士护甲超过1小时以上的生物。

豁免骰 @Check[will|dc:24]

潜伏期 1小时

阶段1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 1}且无法脱下盔甲（1天）

阶段2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 2}，速度承受-10尺状态减值，且无法脱下盔甲（1天）

阶段3 死亡并转化为盔甲的死墓骑士

Ruinous Weapons.name: 破灭武器 Ruinous Weapons
Ruinous Weapons.description: 死墓骑士所持用的任意武器或无武装攻击均获得+1强击和侵蚀武器符文的效果。

Graveknight Captain.name: 死墓骑士上尉 Graveknight Captain
Graveknight Captain.publicNotes:
死墓骑士上尉们曾经骄傲地带领着一队队的军队参加战斗。

死墓骑士是由被诅咒的铠甲赋予不死身的亡灵战士。

Resurrection Dragon (Ancient).name: 古复生龙 Resurrection Dragon (Ancient)

Reawaken!.name: 醒来！ Reawaken!
Reawaken!.description:
触发 复生龙能看到的一个活物死亡

效果 复生龙利用神术与生命能量将灵魂重新连接到已死躯壳。该自愿生物将以其最大生命值的一半的状态复活。每个生物只能被此能力复生一次。

Risen Commander.name: 复生指挥官 Risen Commander
Risen Commander.description: 复生龙与它的仆从有着强烈的联系，复生龙每回合可以用一个自由动作维持@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9WGeBwIIbbUuWKq0]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.hghGRzOSzEl4UXdS]。

Siphon Life.name: 生命吸取 Siphon Life
Siphon Life.description:
触发 一个60尺内的生物使用了一个恢复生命值的治疗效果

效果 复生龙将命能从该效果中引导开，从而将其影响降到最低。触发恢复生命值效果的所有掷骰取最小值，并且任何恢复生命值的固定值（如两动作@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]的附加生命值）都会被减半。然后，复生龙获得3d8临时生命值，持续1轮。

Arise!.name: 重生！ Arise!
Arise!.description:
复生龙利用其对命能的精通将其灵魂投射到骨园，并将一个自愿生物的灵魂拉回到其躯体，整个过程需要1小时。这具有@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IkGYwHRLhkuoGReG]的效果，但目标的最大等级为13级，且灵魂与复生龙的灵魂连接。一次只能有一个生物与复生龙的灵魂连接。如果目标与复生龙不在同一位面或复生龙死亡，则复生生物会死亡，且无法再用重生！能力复生。复生龙可以随时解消该连接。如此做并不会阻止复生龙再次对该生物使用重生！能力。

当以这种方式复生后，该生物仍然可以被死者复活、@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kqhPt9344UkcGVYO]及类似效果选为目标。这会使其完全恢复生命，解除与复生龙的连接，并允许复生龙与另一个生物建立连接。

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 复生龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 复生龙的打击重击时会恢复其汲魂吐息的充能。

Necro Puppeteer.name: 死灵傀儡 Necro Puppeteer
Necro Puppeteer.description: 复生龙将能量注入一个60尺内它能看到的不死生物、濒死生物或尸体中。复生龙将目标生物移动30尺，并使其在@Template[type:emanation|distance:10]范围内释放一股虚能波动，造成@Damage[6d8[void]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:32|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。

Soul Siphoning Breath.name: 汲魂吐息 Soul Siphoning Breath
Soul Siphoning Breath.description: 复生龙释放一股神圣能量，在@Template[type:cone|distance:50]范围内造成@Damage[16d6[void]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[fortitude|dc:38|basic|options:area-effect]豁免），并从范围内的生物身上汲取生命之力。复生龙获得快速治疗15，直到其汲魂吐息重新充能。复生龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Soul Siphoning Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用汲魂吐息。

Resurrection Dragon (Ancient).publicNotes: 复生龙徘徊于生与死之间。它们精通命能，使得它们能够将死者复生，同时也精通虚能，能够赋予他人死亡。它们利用这些能力戏弄凡人的生命，召唤灵魂来帮助自己，或复生它们认为重要或有趣的生物。复生龙的巢穴通常是一个荒凉之地。虽然它们像其他龙一样囤积财富，但它们几乎不装饰自己的巢穴，财宝通常被存放在黑暗的角落里，仿佛它们对自己的财物毫不在乎。然而，复生龙倾向于保留从复生的生物或计划复生的生物那里得到的纪念物，而这些物品会特别安全地保管。

Soul Journey.name: 灵魂之旅 Soul Journey
Soul Journey.description: 安魂龙花费1小时穿越位面通道进入灵魂之河，然后可以到达灵魂之河的任意位置。这具备@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5bTt2CvYHPvaR7QQ]效果，但安魂龙能够精确到达任何主要位面上的地点。

Status Sight.name: 状态视觉 Status Sight
Status Sight.description: 安魂龙会自动知晓它能看到的所有生物的生命值。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine.name: 对抗神术全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine

Soul Anchor.name: 灵魂锚定 Soul Anchor
Soul Anchor.description:
触发 一个60尺内的生物的生命值将降至0

效果 安魂龙将触发生物的灵魂锚定于其躯体，该生物的生命值保持在1点，陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 2}，并获得与安魂龙等级相等的快速治疗，持续1分钟。该生物在24小时内暂时免疫灵魂锚定效果。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.k8bmDh3nWi2FUyz5]

Withhold Death.name: 阻止死亡 Withhold Death
Withhold Death.description:
触发 安魂龙被一次攻击重击

效果 安魂龙抵抗灵魂的松动，减少部分伤害。安魂针对触发攻击获得20点所有伤害类型的抗力。

Dooming Breath.name: 毁灭吐息 Dooming Breath
Dooming Breath.description: 安魂龙从口中喷出来自创生熔炉的能量，在@Template[type:line|distance:120]范围内造成@Damage[16d8[spirit]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。豁免失败的不死生物还必须成功通过@Check[will|dc:42|options:area-effect,inflicts:doomed]豁免，否则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 1}。如果目标已陷入毁灭，则毁灭值增加1（最多为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 4}）。安魂龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Dooming Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用毁灭吐息。

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 安魂龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击和一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 安魂龙的打击重击时会恢复毁灭吐息的充能。

Redirect River.name: 河流改道 Redirect River
Redirect River.description: 安魂龙利用自己的身体作为连接引导灵魂之河的一部分。河流在安魂龙周围涌动，形成@Template[type:emanation|distance:15]区域的灵性激流，持续1轮，该区域对其他所有生物视为困难地形。此外，在区域内开始回合或每轮首次进入区域的生物必须成功通过@Check[fortitude|dc:42|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:drained,inflicts:doomed]豁免，否则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{力竭 Drained 1}与@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 1}。如果目标已处于流失或毁灭状态，则其状态值增加1（最多为4）。安魂龙可以维持此效果。

Soul Shield.name: 灵魂护盾 Soul Shield
Soul Shield.description:
频率 每日一次

效果 安魂龙利用其生命精华在60尺内的一个生物周围创造出一个精魂能量护盾。此护盾与生物建立了一个连接，效果与@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.d7Lwx6KAs47MtF0q]相似，区别在于该效果不会因距离而中断，并持续1小时。此外，该生物获得对物理和精魂伤害的10点抗力，适用于其所承受伤害的一半。安魂龙可以解消该效果。

Requiem Dragon (Ancient).name: 古安魂龙 Requiem Dragon (Ancient)
Requiem Dragon (Ancient).publicNotes: 安魂龙是灵魂之河（River of Souls）的守护者，负责引导灵魂抵达其在来世的最终归宿。灵魂的安全旅程对安魂龙至关重要，一些安魂龙会从灵魂首次进入灵魂之河开始，直到它们在骨园的审判，最终引导灵魂到达它们最终的安息之地。大多数安魂龙将自己与特定的位面绑定，负责守护所有进入该位面的灵魂，导致这些龙与天堂或地狱等地方相关联，尽管这些龙从不对这些位面宣誓效忠。安魂龙将它们的巢穴建在灵魂之河沿岸——这些巢穴是从其他位面拯救出来的沉重建筑拼接而成——并充满了无价的记录和伟大成就的纪念物。

Entropy's Shadow.name: Entropy's Shadow
Entropy's Shadow.description: 40 feet. Sykevers leak entropy and corruption from their very being. A living creature entering or starting its turn in the aura takes @Damage[4d6[void]] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:33|basic]. If it fails, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute and pulled 10 feet toward the sykever.

Sunlight Powerlessness.name: Sunlight Powerlessness
Sunlight Powerlessness.description: A sykever caught in sunlight is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}.

Change Posture.name: Change Posture
Change Posture.description: The sykever changes between their bipedal and quadrupedal stance. In their bipedal stance, the sykever can use all the abilities in their stat block except Horned Rush. In their quadrupedal stance, the sykever has a Speed of 80 feet but can't make arm spike Strikes, Disarm, cast spells, or use Crush Item.

Crush Item.name: Crush Item
Crush Item.description:
Trigger The sykever gets a critical success to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm}

Requirements The sykever is in their bipedal stance

Effect The sykever snatches the item and pierces it with their arm spikes. The item becomes broken and falls to the ground in the sykever's space. Items that are already broken aren't further damaged, and an item with 14 or higher Hardness is unaffected.

Draining Gaze.name: Draining Gaze
Draining Gaze.description:
The sykever fixes their nightmarish gaze on one creature they can see, who must attempt a @Check[will|dc:36] save. Regardless of the result, the target is temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 round if the sykever is in bipedal stance, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for 1 round if the sykever is in quadrupedal stance.

Failure As success, but the effect lasts 1 minute.

Critical Failure As success, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 3}, and the effect lasts 10 minutes.

Horned Rush.name: Horned Rush
Horned Rush.description:
Requirements The sykever is in their quadrupedal stance

Effect The sykever Strides and then makes a horn Strike.

Sykever.name: Sykever
Sykever.publicNotes:
The most common darvakkas are sykevers, walkers in the night. Bloodthirsty but calculating, they lead legions of dead into battle on the Material Plane, working toward the simple goal of ending all life.

Darvakkas, also called nightshades, are a ravenous evil made up of equal parts darkness and malice. Originally creatures of the Outer Planes who travel to the convergence of the Shadow Plane and the Void—where the power of nothingness obliterates them—these undead abominations are the physical embodiment of entropy. They burn with an intense hatred for all life, working to bring a final, dark night to the Material Plane where nothing but ash and ice remain.

As creatures twisted by darkness and shadow, darvakkas have a great aversion to sunlight and all sources of vitality energy. On the Material Plane, they spend the hours of daylight hidden below ground, amid ruins, or submerged deep in the ocean's darkest chasms beyond the reach of the sun's rays, emerging when darkness shelters them overhead.

Darvakkas have an aura of entropy that attracts undead thralls to serve as warriors and heralds. They rarely seek alliances with each other or other creatures, existing in solitude as the heads of individual armies of the dead.

Magic Sense.name: 魔法感知 Magic Sense
Magic Sense.description: 符文龙能感知到列出范围内所有激活的魔法能力与效果。当符文龙进行搜寻时，它在列出范围内获得4环级侦测魔法法术的效果（此外还获得搜寻的正常好处）。

equipment-Common runes of 9th level or l.name: 刻在鳞片上的常见符文（9级或更低） Common runes of 9th level or lower etched upon their scales

Runic Scales.name: 符文鳞片 Runic Scales
Runic Scales.description: 符文龙的鳞片作为符文石存在。符文龙不能使用蚀刻在其鳞片上的符文的效果或能力，但它们可以将其转移到适当的物品上。以这种方式向物品转移或从物品上转移一个符文需要1分钟，在此期间符文龙处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]状态。该过程自动完成无需检定，但如果符文龙在此过程中停止或受到打扰，符文将被摧毁。符文龙可以在其鳞片上蚀刻任意数量的符文，但它们通常一次只在鳞片上蚀刻少数符文。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: 对抗奥术的全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Canceling Rune.name: 抵消符文 Canceling Rune
Canceling Rune.description:
触发 符文龙成为一个需要豁免的法术的目标

效果 符文龙尝试瓦解法术的基础符文。它尝试反制该法术（反制环级7环级，反制调整值[[/r 1d20+26 #Counteract]]{+26}）。若成功，符文龙不受该法术影响；其他目标正常受到该法术影响。符文龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Canceling Rune]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用抵消符文。

Retributive Rune.name: 惩戒符文 Retributive Rune
Retributive Rune.description:
触发 一个15尺内的生物对符文龙造成伤害

效果 伴随着符文魔法的爆发，符文龙对触发生物使用爆裂符文能力，若符文未自动引爆则立即将其引爆。

Detonating Rune.name: 爆裂符文 Detonating Rune
Detonating Rune.description: 符文龙的打击与能力可以在目标身上留下一个爆裂符文。如果一个生物在已经拥有一个爆裂符文的情况下将要获得另一个爆裂符文，则不会新增一个符文，而是会激活其当前的爆裂符文，消耗该符文并对目标造成@Damage[5d6[untyped]]伤害。爆裂符文的伤害类型与符文龙当前变幻符文的类型一致。生物可以使用一个交互动作移除该符文。如果爆裂符文没有引爆，则在1分钟后消散。

Entangling Rune.name: 束缚符文 Entangling Rune
Entangling Rune.description: 符文龙在60尺内创造一个@Template[type:burst|distance:10]范围的大型陷阱符文。除符文龙外的任何生物进入该区域或在其中结束回合时，会激活符文并受到束缚。该生物必须通过@Check[reflex|dc:34]豁免，否则将被@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]1分钟或直到其成功逃脱。该符文每次只能束缚一个生物。符文在生物豁免成功、逃脱成功或1分钟后消散。与符文相邻的生物可以使用一个交互动作来移除符文。

Runic Breath.name: 符文吐息 Runic Breath
Runic Breath.description: 符文龙释放数百枚一触即爆的符文，在@Template[type:cone|distance:40]范围内造成@Damage[12d6[untyped]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:34|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。此能力的伤害类型由变幻符文决定。豁免失败的生物还会受到爆裂符文的影响。符文龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Runic Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用符文吐息。

Shifting Runes.name: 变幻符文 Shifting Runes
Shifting Runes.description: 符文龙选择酸蚀，寒冷，电击，火焰或音波伤害类型。蚀刻在其鳞片上的符文随之变幻，形成该能量类型的符文。符文龙获得对该伤害类型的免疫，且其爆裂符文与符文吐息均造成该类型伤害。任何在奥法上受训的生物无需检定即可立即识别蚀刻符文的能量类型。

Improved Push 10 feet.name: 精通推离10尺 Improved Push 10 feet

Rune Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: 成年符文龙施法者 Rune Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)
Rune Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).publicNotes: 符文龙天生对符文的力量有着深刻的洞察。大多数符文龙的鳞片上刻有各种符文，它们的身体可以魔法般地增强这些符文的力量。符文龙通常不自己施法，而是依靠它们即兴创造符文的能力来产生所需的效果。符文龙常常把自己的财宝称为图书馆，因为它们的财宝中充满了由不同文化的人们使用多种语言写成的重要历史文献、戏剧、演讲、教科书和法术书。尽管它们通常可以借助魔法说某种语言，但它们更喜欢在讲者的语境中学习语言，以便理解其中隐藏的细微差别和符号中的魔力。

Scimitar Blitz.name: 弯刀突击 Scimitar Blitz
Scimitar Blitz.description: 沙漠巨人行走至多等于他速度的距离，在这次移动的任意位置，沙漠巨人可用他的两把弯刀各打击一次。

Sand Spin.name: 扬沙旋身 Sand Spin
Sand Spin.description:
需求 沙漠巨人正站在沙质地形上

效果 沙漠巨人旋转起来，扬起@Template[type:emanation|distance:10]范围的松散沙砾。直到巨人的下个回合开始，位于此区域的生物获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]。其他生物对于区域内的生物而言也获得掩蔽。

Sandwalking.name: 沙地行走 Sandwalking
Sandwalking.description: 沙漠巨人已经适应了沙漠的松散沙子，能够轻松越过它们。沙漠巨人忽略由沙子构成的非魔法困难地形或崎岖不平的地表。

Desert Giant.name: 沙漠巨人 Desert Giant
Desert Giant.publicNotes:
沙漠巨人是游牧为生的类人生物，自太古以来就栖息于世界上最干旱的区域。个子更小的种族深知沙漠巨人是无可争议的沙漠生存大师。此类巨人能在如此严酷的环境中繁荣发展，他们深厚的文化传统有着重要作用。沙漠巨人的长老们鼓励后代维持节制的生活方式，尤其是饮食。多数沙漠巨人遵循简朴的素食饮食，并在脑海中时刻保存着一幅记载着家乡区域的季节性水道与绿洲、细节精确地不可思议的地图。沙漠巨人身高15尺，通常有着精瘦的体格，恰适合在广袤沙海中长途跋涉。

巨人们遍布世界各地，他们的形态如同栖身的偏远之地一样多种多样。一个巨人会给当地环境留下深刻印记，尤其对那些相较他们体型小、力量弱的生物而言。

Whip Drain.name: Whip Drain
Whip Drain.description:
Requirements The sumbreiva has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} with their shadow whip

Effect The grabbed creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:38] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} on a critical failure). If the creature is already drained, this increases its drained value instead, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}.

Hunter's Triumph.name: Hunter's Triumph
Hunter's Triumph.description:
Trigger The sumbreiva kills a creature

Effect The sumbreiva lets out a triumphant, bone-chilling howl. Every enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:36] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} (and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} as long as it's frightened on a critical failure).

Claim Trophy.name: Claim Trophy
Claim Trophy.description: The sumbreiva claims the soul of a creature they killed within the last minute. This works like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Seize Soul}, except that no black sapphire is required, and the soul is turned into a glowing blue light called a soul trophy. Anyone who kills the sumbreiva can then free the soul from any soul trophy by touching it and speaking the word for "freedom" in any language.

Huntblade Brutality.name: Huntblade Brutality
Huntblade Brutality.description: The sumbreiva's huntblade deals an additional 2d8 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Sumbreiva.name: Sumbreiva
Sumbreiva.publicNotes:
Sumbreivas are the Void's unstoppable hunters, tracking down and destroying other creatures on their plane for sport and practice. Occasionally, they pass through a rift or are brought to the Universe via a binding circle, where they collect living souls to display as trophies.

Sumbreivas gather at Night Lodges, where they train and display their soul trophies, which appear as floating wisps of blue energy. The more formidable the soul, the more intense the blue glow that emanates from it. Sumbreivas in lodges periodically raid the Universe on a Night Hunt and compete to see who can bring back the most brilliant soul trophies. The winner of the Night Hunt leads the lodge until the next hunt. Night Lodges are ranked against each other by the accomplishments of the hunters within. All sumbreivas desire to capture a soul powerful enough to earn them placement in the Twilight Lodge, reserved for the truly elite souls and hunters.

Kimenhul.name: Kimenhul

Spell Effect: Hidden Mind.name: Spell Effect: Hidden Mind
Spell Effect: Hidden Mind.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.C2w3YfBKjIRS07DP]{Hidden Mind}

You gain a +4 status bonus to saves against mental effects.

Easy to Call.name: Easy to Call
Easy to Call.description: A kimenhul's level is considered 2 lower for the purpose of being conjured by the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2ykmAVKrsAWcazcC]{Binding Circle} ritual (and potentially other rituals, at the GM's discretion), but it is always free to attack or leave instead of negotiate unless the primary caster's check is a critical success.

Feed on Fear.name: Feed on Fear
Feed on Fear.description: The kimenhul regains @Damage[30[healing]] Hit Points at the start of its turn as long as any @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} creature is within @Template[emanation|distance:100]{100 feet} of it.

Reactive Strike (Special).name: Reactive Strike (Special)
Reactive Strike (Special).description:
If the triggering creature is frightened, the kimenhul can make two claw Strikes against the creature instead of one Strike.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ReactiveStrike]

Eternal Fear.name: Eternal Fear
Eternal Fear.description:
The kimenhul contorts its faces and presents itself to its enemies in a terrifying and traumatic display that causes lingering fear. Each creature within 100 feet that can observe the kimenhul must make a @Check[will|dc:42] save.

They are then temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}.

Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} as long as it's frightened. Even after recovering from the initial experience, the trauma is lodged in the target's mind for 1 year. Once per day, the kimenhul can communicate telepathically with the target for 1 minute as long as both creatures are on the same plane. Any time a creature under the effect of Eternal Fear is in a stressful situation (such as combat or intense social pressure), they must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:11] check or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}. While Eternal Fear lasts, the target always becomes fleeing as long as it's frightened, regardless of the source of the fear. The target can attempt a new saving throw each week to remove these effects, but they can otherwise be removed only by powerful magic such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish}.

Critical Failure As failure, but the effects are permanent and the target doesn't get to attempt a weekly save to end the effect.

Frightening Flurry.name: Frightening Flurry
Frightening Flurry.description: The kimenhul makes one jaws Strike and two claw Strikes against a single target, in any order. The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} with a condition value equal to the number of Strikes that hit it, to a maximum of frightened 3 if all three Strikes hit.

Skip Between.name: Skip Between
Skip Between.description: The sahkil moves from the Universe to the Ethereal Plane or vice-versa. While in the Ethereal Plane, they're unable to affect anything in the Universe, and they cannot be seen by beings or abilities in the Universe, unless these have an ability that can gaze into the Ethereal Plane. While on the Material Plane the inverse is true for anything on the Ethereal Plane. A summoned sahkil can't use Skip Between.

Snatch Between.name: Snatch Between
Snatch Between.description: When using Skip Between, the kimenhul can bring along any creatures it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

Unsettled Mind.name: Unsettled Mind
Unsettled Mind.description: Any creature affected by any of a kimenhul's mental spells or abilities becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} for the duration of that effect and for [[/gmr 1d4 #Duration Stupefied]]{1d4 rounds} thereafter.

Kimenhul.publicNotes:
Among the strongest of their kind aside from the sahkil tormentors, kimenhuls work their craft to foment despair in those who fear failure, forming cycles of self-loathing. These powerful sahkils focus their attention on mortals who are seemingly at the peak of their ability yet harbor secret fears of inadequacy. A kimenhul's predations can leave an indelible mark on its victims. The kimenhul whispers threats and sends fears of crushing failure to its prey, seemingly originating from their own minds, a trauma that can be difficult to bear without help. These sahkils torment their prey as long as the hapless victims live, using their Eternal Fear ability every day to psychically remind their previous victims of their failings.

Some unique kimenhuls find themselves in a position of leadership in Xibalba, where they carve out their own small kingdoms and direct groups of sahkils to help them find mortals to torment. They rule these nightmare kingdoms through terror, often delighting in tormenting new petitioners or scheming ways to work against their immortal foes.

Ages ago, when this cycle of the multiverse was still adolescent, a cabal of psychopomps who already felt bored and restrained in their role of ushering souls to their ultimate resting place rebelled against their station. It was this corruption of the cycle of souls that spawned the first sahkils.

Ambivalent to the prescribed order of the multiverse and spiteful of mortals, sahkils delight in spreading fear and unease to all beings, clogging up the metaphysical cycle with anxiety-ridden mortals too scared to achieve their potential. These fiends have drastically changed from their dedicated psychopomp predecessors. They are creatures of spite and torment, fear and disgust. They exploit the most common and rare fears for their own perverse satisfaction, and they want nothing more than to frighten mortals and make them question their reason for existence.

Most sahkils lurk on the Ethereal Plane, but they frequently invade the Material Plane to torment mortals and spread terror. They use their innate ability to slip between the veils of the Ethereal and Material effortlessly, often stalking their targets for days or weeks before enacting their devious plots.

Brutal Sweep.description:
需求 冰巨魔正持用一把短柄斧

效果 巨魔挥扫短兵斧划出巨大弧线，对@Template[type:emanation|distance:5]范围内所有生物造成@Damage[3d6[slashing]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。
Brutal Sweep.name: 蛮力横扫 Brutal Sweep

Ice Passage.name: 冰面穿行 Ice Passage
Ice Passage.description: 霜巨魔不会被因冰雪造成的困难地形阻碍，也不需要尝试特技检定来避免因冰滑而跌倒。

Easily Misled.name: 易受误导 Easily Misled
Easily Misled.description: 冰巨魔在对抗欺骗检定时察觉DC承受-4环境减值。

Regeneration 15 (Deactivated by Fire or.name: 再生15（火焰或音波使其无效） Regeneration 15 (Deactivated by Fire or Sonic)

Furious Carve.name: 狂暴凿刻 Furious Carve
Furious Carve.description:
触发 冰巨魔受到火焰或音波伤害

效果 冰巨魔对触及范围内一个随机生物进行一次短柄斧或爪打击。如果冰巨魔受到持续火焰伤害，他尝试一次@Check[flat|dc:15]检定来移除它。

Ice Troll.name: 冰巨魔 Ice Troll
Ice Troll.publicNotes:
冰巨魔是噩梦般的冰冻怪物，他们的利爪沾满雾凇，獠牙覆满霜霜，出没于冰川、山脉和冻原。永无止境的饥饿驱使他们追逐麋鹿群、海豹群和人类村落。那些被封存在浮冰或永久冻土中的冰巨魔，在经历数月、数年甚至数十年的饥渴折磨后，终能在冰层融化之际破冰而出。

巨魔是张着流涎的巨口，有着剃刀般锋利爪子的高大蛮兽，贪婪的掠食者。他们与土地的联结不仅能重建躯体，更催生出无数变种，每种巨魔都映射着它们汲取能量的地形特征。迁徙至新领地的巨魔会随着身体各部位的再生而逐渐蜕变，新生的血肉与旧躯缠绕交织，最终导致畸形的生长。

Ash Giant.name: 灰烬巨人 Ash Giant
Ash Giant.publicNotes:
灰烬巨人栖息于冷酷的荒野，由于长期在残酷的荒原漫游，他们的皮肤粗糙、布满脓包与伤疤。他们艰苦的生活淬炼出了凶残、反复无常且冷酷的性格。遇到灰烬巨人的类人生物们几乎都因这些巨人如虐待狂一般的幽默感和对恶作剧的嗜好而厌恶他们。尽管粗鄙野蛮，灰烬巨人们终究是生存专家，他们将创造力用于打造武器、陷阱、坐骑鞍具和各类工具。只要是为了残忍、暴力或恶作剧，灰烬巨人总能想出办法做出他们需要的工具。猪崽墩（Piggy clods）就是一种广受喜爱的造物——一个用废铁碎渣与其他金属揉成的球，一旦受到撞击就会爆炸。

巨人们遍布世界各地，他们的形态如同栖身的偏远之地一样多种多样。一个巨人会给当地环境留下深刻印记，尤其对那些相较他们体型小、力量弱的生物而言。
Ash Giant.allSaves: 对抗疾病的全豁免+2状态加值

Vermin Empathy.name: 昆虫沟通 Vermin Empathy
Vermin Empathy.description: 灰烬巨人可以跟虫类或类似生物交谈，问问题，或者使用交涉技能。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Disease.name: 对抗疾病的全豁免+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Disease

Tumor Pop.name: 肿块爆裂 Tumor Pop
Tumor Pop.description: 当灰烬巨人身上有鼓胀的肿块时受到穿刺伤害，那个肿块会自动爆开，效果如同爆裂沸腾能力。

Blastboil.name: 爆裂沸腾 Blastboil
Blastboil.description: 灰烬巨人引爆他身上的一个巨大且鼓胀的脓包。位于@Template[type:cone|distance:15]范围内的所有生物受到@Damage[5d8[poison]|options:area-damage]伤害，@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:sickened]豁免。豁免失败的生物还会获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}（大失败则为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}）。本能力和肿块爆裂能力无法再次使用，直到另一个肿块在[[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮}后鼓胀到合适的大小。

Gore Grinder.name: 血腥研磨 Gore Grinder
Gore Grinder.description:
需求 灰烬巨人上一个动作为一次成功的战斗连枷打击

效果 灰烬巨人将连枷的链子裹在打击目标上，然后开始研磨目标的血肉。目标受到@Damage[2d10[slashing],2d8[persistent,bleed]]伤害，@Check[fortitude|dc:30|basic]豁免。

Tangle-Topple.name: 缠倒 Tangle-Topple
Tangle-Topple.description: 灰烬巨人进行一次猪崽墩打击。若该打击命中，目标被锯齿状的废品缠住。他陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]，无法离开地面，若他正在飞行还会掉到地上。这些效果在该生物[[/act escape]]或缠绕他的金属被[[/act force-open dc=28]]后结束。

Burning Swarm.name: Burning Swarm
Burning Swarm.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[3d8[poison]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic] save) and is exposed to fire jelly venom.

Fire Jelly Venom.name: Fire Jelly Venom
Fire Jelly Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:24]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 3} (1 round)

Fire Jellyfish Swarm.name: Fire Jellyfish Swarm
Fire Jellyfish Swarm.publicNotes:
While individually one of these fist-sized jellyfish is merely a nuisance, in great numbers, fire jellyfish can form into dangerous swarms. Bobbing in the water, they create a cloud of stinging tentacles. They were named in part for their bright coloration, but those who are stung by fire jellyfish learn the larger reason for their name—the pain of their stings is comparable to being burned alive.

Many varieties of jellyfish drift through the world's oceans, feeding on fish and other tiny marine creatures. However, deadly species of monstrous jellyfish pose a threat to unwary swimmers and sailors alike. Note that while jellyfish are animals, they also have the mindless trait because they lack a centralized nervous system.

Ozthoom.name: Ozthoom
Ozthoom.publicNotes:
Ozthooms are shadowy killers who serve powerful fey creatures or even the Eldest—the demigods of the First World. Amid the courts of the Eldest or other powerful fey rulers, these sinister assassins lurk overhead as they await the call to action—implied threats akin to deadly weapons hung as decor in a royal hall. Ozthooms never speak aloud; when they feel the need to communicate at all, they do so in a telepathic whisper directly into their victim's mind. While an ozthoom's body is a strange, fleshy material, their deadly claws and cruel hooked wings are made from razor-sharp cold iron, a quality that makes them highly feared among other fey. A typical ozthoom is 10 feet tall and has an 8-foot wingspan, but it weighs less than 80 pounds.

While most ozthooms serve powerful masters, a few of these murderous fey have been left to their own devices and serve none but their own capricious whims. In some cases, their master has been slain, while in others, the ozthoom has been released from service for any number of reasons. An ozthoom left to indulge their cruel desires unrestrained is often the most dangerous ozthoom of them all.

Shadow Doubles.name: Shadow Doubles
Shadow Doubles.description:
1 to 3

Frequency once per day

Effect For each action spent to use this ability, the ozthoom creates one shadowy duplicate anywhere within 60 feet of themself. Shadow doubles have the same statistics as an ozthoom, but they have the summoned trait, 85 Hit Points, can't use Shadow Doubles or innate spells, and have an attack bonus of +25 for their Strikes. A shadow double that attempts a saving throw against a light effect can't get a result better than failure. Each double remains for 1 round, until it's reduced to 0 Hit Points, or until it moves further than 120 feet from the ozthoom, whichever comes first. Each round thereafter, the ozthoom can Sustain the effect to extend the duration of surviving duplicates by 1 round, to a maximum duration of 1 minute. The ozthoom can see through the eyes of all the shadow doubles at once. A character who Seeks can identify an ozthoom as real or a shadow double with a successful @Check[perception|dc:39] check.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: A ozthoom's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Bolts.name: 弩矢 Bolts
Bolts.description: 比传统箭短，但结构相似，矢是弩使用的弹药。

Hungry Armor.name: 饥饿护甲 Hungry Armor
Hungry Armor.description: 用近战武器对死墓骑士进行打击的生物必须成功通过@Check[reflex|dc:31]豁免，否则用于打击的武器将被卸武。若该生物豁免大失败，则这把武器会掉落至死墓骑士占据的空间；用无武装攻击命中死墓骑士的生物必须成功通过@Check[reflex|dc:31]豁免，否则会被死墓骑士@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]，直至该生物的下个回合结束、该生物逃脱、或死墓骑士移动，以先发生的为准。

Rejuvenation.name: 复生 Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description:
当死墓骑士被摧毁时，其护甲会在[[/gmr 1d10 #days]]{1d10天}内重塑身体——若护甲被活着的宿主穿戴则会更加迅速。若身体在此之前被破坏，重塑过程将重新开始。

只有摧毁护甲（比如使用@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]）、把死墓骑士传送至创世熔炉、或者丢进火山之中才能够永久摧毁死墓骑士。

Sacrilegious Aura.name: 亵渎灵光 Sacrilegious Aura
Sacrilegious Aura.description: 30尺。当有生物在灵光射程内使用命能法术或能力时，死墓骑士会自动尝试反制它，[[/r 1d20+23 #Counteract]]{反制调整值+23}。

Devastating Blast.name: 毁灭爆震 Devastating Blast
Devastating Blast.description:
死墓骑士释放出@Template[cone|distance:30]闪电。区域内的生物受到@Damage[8d12[electricity]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:34|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。

死墓骑士在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Devastating Blast]]{1d4轮}无法再次使用此能力。

Exemplar of Violence.name: 暴力典范 Exemplar of Violence
Exemplar of Violence.description:
频率 每轮一次

效果 死墓骑士进行一次打击，同时它的铠甲闪烁着邪恶的光芒，刺激盟友实施暴力。在打击结束后，所有能看到死墓骑士的盟友都可以使用一个反应动作进行一次快步或行走，但它们必须要在一个邻接敌人的空间内结束移动。死墓骑士所选的一位盟友可以使用该动作打击而非移动。

Graveknight's Curse.name: 死墓骑士诅咒 Graveknight's Curse
Graveknight's Curse.description:
诅咒会影响任何穿戴死墓骑士护甲超过1小时以上的生物。

豁免骰 @Check[will|dc:39]

潜伏期 1小时

阶段1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 1}且无法脱下盔甲（1天）

阶段2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 2}，速度承受-10尺状态减值，且无法脱下盔甲（1天）

阶段3 死亡并转化为盔甲的死墓骑士

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.6rnB7nK6J6zF4vea]

Phantom Mount.name: 魅影坐骑 Phantom Mount
Phantom Mount.description:
7环级；这匹战马数据为：AC34，强韧+23，反射+20，意志+20，HP85。

死墓骑士召唤出1匹超自然坐骑，就如同升阶至7环级的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WPKJOhEihhcIm2uQ]一般。

与魅影驹不同是的，该坐骑的AC和豁免骰加值比死墓骑士低4，且HP为死墓骑士的三分之一（向下取整）。

若坐骑被摧毁，死墓骑士必须等待1小时才能再次使用该能力。

Ruinous Weapons.name: 破灭武器 Ruinous Weapons
Ruinous Weapons.description: 死墓骑士所持用的任意武器或无武装攻击均获得+1高等强击和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.TEa1oKZbwsOvC6TZ]武器符文的效果。

Weapon Master.name: 武器大师 Weapon Master
Weapon Master.description: 死墓骑士无论持用何种武器，均可以使用该武器的重击专精效果。

Graveknight Warmaster.name: 死墓骑士战帅 Graveknight Warmaster
Graveknight Warmaster.publicNotes:
作为不朽暴力的典范，死墓骑士战帅在战场上是一股毁灭性的力量，它能刺激盟友，让他们的暴力程度更上一层楼。

当一位可畏的斗士战死沙场，其一心复仇的魂魄有时会和他的护甲融合，创造出一名死墓骑士。

Garuda.name: Garuda
Garuda.publicNotes:
Garudas are winged humanoids created to serve holy gods and other powerful celestial beings. Originally born among the celestial planes, garudas eventually spread beyond, with many making their way to the mortal Universe. As divine servants, garudas' primary roles are as protectors, defending holy sites and important divine figures like high priests.

The most important role a garuda serves is as a means of transportation. The first garudas served as mounts for the gods, carrying them across the heavens and into combat. This tradition continues today, with garudas willingly serving as mounts for champions, clerics, and other divine chosen. On occasion, a god will request a garuda track down one of the god's followers. The garuda declares their servitude to the follower, acting as a guardian and transport for as long as the god decrees.

Speaker of the Skies.name: Speaker of the Skies
Speaker of the Skies.description: A garuda can speak with any type of bird.

Vehicle of the Gods.name: Vehicle of the Gods
Vehicle of the Gods.description: Garudas were created to serve as transport for other beings. A holy creature can ride the garuda by using the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PM5jvValFkbFH3TV]{Mount} action to move onto them. Unlike the normal rules for riding other creatures, both the garuda and the rider continue to receive all 3 of their actions each turn, and the garuda's rider can be Medium or smaller. A garuda can have only a single rider at a time. The garuda can choose to allow a non-holy (but not an unholy) creature to ride them, but generally only does so in specific circumstances.

Celestial Meteor.name: Celestial Meteor
Celestial Meteor.description:
Requirements The garuda doesn't have a rider

Effect The garuda Flies straight up and then comes crashing down toward the ground, landing in an unoccupied space within 30 feet. As the garuda lands, a burst of solar flames erupts from them, dealing @Damage[5d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] (@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic] save). If the garuda lands adjacent to a creature, they can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} that creature. On a success or critical success, the garuda can then Fly up to 30 feet with the creature.

Divine Grasp.name: Divine Grasp
Divine Grasp.description: When a garuda moves, they can bring grabbed creatures along with them.

Raise by the Sun.name: Raise by the Sun
Raise by the Sun.description:
2 to 3

Requirements The garuda doesn't have a rider

Effect The garuda Flies and picks up a willing creature at any point during the flight, who then begins riding the garuda, and then the garuda continues their Fly action.
