If the garuda uses three actions, they can instead Fly twice. At any point during the garuda's movement, the rider can use a reaction to attempt a Strike with a ranged weapon.

Vanyver.name: Vanyver
Vanyver.publicNotes:
Vanyvers are large, humanoid bats shaped from void and shadowstuff, their red eyes glowing like tiny stars in an otherwise lightless night. Though powerful, they're the least of the darvakkas, and the most likely to submit to a master, either another of their kind or a mortal with a reputation for being especially murderous and destructive. Vanyvers agree to follow their masters as a temporary means of maximizing the death and destruction they can enact but will quickly turn on any master they feel falters in this goal.

Darvakkas, also called nightshades, are a ravenous evil made up of equal parts darkness and malice. Originally creatures of the Outer Planes who travel to the convergence of the Shadow Plane and the Void—where the power of nothingness obliterates them—these undead abominations are the physical embodiment of entropy. They burn with an intense hatred for all life, working to bring a final, dark night to the Material Plane where nothing but ash and ice remain.

As creatures twisted by darkness and shadow, darvakkas have a great aversion to sunlight and all sources of vitality energy. On the Material Plane, they spend the hours of daylight hidden below ground, amid ruins, or submerged deep in the ocean's darkest chasms beyond the reach of the sun's rays, emerging when darkness shelters them overhead.

Darvakkas have an aura of entropy that attracts undead thralls to serve as warriors and heralds. They rarely seek alliances with each other or other creatures, existing in solitude as the heads of individual armies of the dead.

Catching Bite.name: Catching Bite
Catching Bite.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the vanyver's jaws makes a melee Strike against the vanyver with a weapon

Effect The vanyver chooses to be hit. If the attack would've missed, it hits. The vanyver catches the weapon in their jaws and uses Drain Magic on it without fulfilling Drain Magic's requirements.

Drain Magic.name: Drain Magic
Drain Magic.description:
Requirements The vanyver's last action was a successful jaws Strike against a creature, object, or spell effect

Effect The vanyver casts an innate @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} on the same target; if the target was a creature, the vanyver can target a spell affecting the creature instead. If a spell effect or item is successfully counteracted, the vanyver gains temporary Hit Points equal to double the counteract rank of the effect that was counteracted.

Entropy's Shadow.name: Entropy's Shadow
Entropy's Shadow.description: 40 feet. Vanyvers leak entropy and corruption from their very being. A living creature entering or starting its turn in the aura takes @Damage[3d6[void]] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:30|basic]. If it fails, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute and pulled 10 feet toward the vanyver.

Snatch.name: Snatch
Snatch.description: The vanyver can Fly at half Speed while they have a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in either or both of their talons, carrying that creature along with them.

Sunlight Powerlessness.name: Sunlight Powerlessness
Sunlight Powerlessness.description: A vanyver caught in sunlight is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}.

Withering Opportunity.name: Withering Opportunity
Withering Opportunity.description:
Trigger The meladaemon is attacked by an adjacent creature and the attack misses

Effect The meladaemon swipes at the triggering creature, which must immediately attempt a save against the meladaemon's withering touch.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Consumptive Aura.name: Consumptive Aura
Consumptive Aura.description: 20 feet. A meladaemon emanates an aura of intense hunger. Each round a creature begins its turn in the aura, it must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:27|traits:damaging-effect] save. On a failure, the creature takes @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (@Damage[2d6[void]] damage on a critical failure) and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}. This fatigue ends as soon as the creature eats any food.

Daemonic Famine.name: Daemonic Famine
Daemonic Famine.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:29]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 day)

Stage 4 as stage 3

Stage 5 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} (1 week)

Stage 6 dead

Withering Touch.name: Withering Touch
Withering Touch.description: When the meladaemon hits with a claw Strike or a creature begins its turn grabbed by the meladaemon, the creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:30|traits:damaging-effect] save. On a failure, the creature takes @Damage[1d6[void]] damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}. This fatigue ends when the creature drinks.

Meladaemon.name: Meladaemon
Meladaemon.publicNotes: Meladaemons personify death by starvation and thirst, and revel in spreading the same despair that brought about their mortal demise. When they aren't blighting fields, massacring livestock, or tainting water supplies, they experiment on prisoners to study how long creatures can go without sustenance and the deleterious effects that result from such deprivation. Fiercely loyal to Trelmarixian, Horseman of Famine, they serve no other beings. They work alongside other daemons if Trelmarixian wills it, but are notoriously traitorous.
Meladaemon.allSaves: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Distracting Whisper.name: 干扰低语 Distracting Whisper
Distracting Whisper.description:
触发 低语龙成为攻击的目标

效果 一个神秘的声音在触发生物耳边低语，使触发攻击受到-2环境减值。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.qsvSWxRqVQofjDdH]

Cogitation Breath.name: 凝思吐息 Cogitation Breath
Cogitation Breath.description: 低语龙释放出一股迷惑性毒雾，在@Template[type:cone|distance:30]范围内造成@Damage[6d6[mental]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[will|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:stupefied]豁免）。豁免失败的生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}（大失败则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}），持续1分钟。低语龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Cogitation Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用凝思吐息。

Steal Knowledge.name: 窃取知识 Steal Knowledge
Steal Knowledge.description:
低语龙从60尺内一个生物的意识中摘取知识片段，选择一个技能作为影响目标。该生物必须进行@Check[will|dc:23]豁免。

成功 该生物不受影响。

失败 在接下来的1分钟内，该生物使用该技能的检定时承受-1状态减值，而低语龙在使用该技能的检定中获得+1状态加值。

大失败 同失败，但减值为-2，加值为+2。

+2 to Sense Motive.name: 察言观色时+2 +2 to Sense Motive

Information Network.name: 信息网络 Information Network
Information Network.description: 低语龙可以尝试一个社群检定来@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]以代替搜集信息检定，从先前的线人处回忆情报。

+2 Status To All Saves Vs. Occult.name: 对抗异能的全豁免+2状态加值 +2 Status To All Saves Vs. Occult

Diplomatic Solution.name: 外交解决 Diplomatic Solution
Diplomatic Solution.description:
触发 低语龙进行先攻检定

效果 低语龙将其视线内60尺范围内的所有敌人作为目标，施放环级等于低语龙等级一半（向上取整）的安定心神（@Check[will|dc:23]豁免）。低语龙无需维持此效果，但如果低语龙对受到影响的生物采取任何敌对行动，则对所有生物终止该效果。

Whisper Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: 青年低语龙施法者 Whisper Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)
Whisper Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes: 低语龙是敏锐的谣言和秘密收藏家，花费几个世纪来磨练他们的信息网络和人际关系。它们这样做通常并非出于想要控制他人或利用这些信息来进行阴谋，而仅仅是因为学习和收集信息的过程本身就是一种满足。与其他龙的财宝相比，它们的巢穴较为简陋，因为它们真正的财富——秘密——都藏在它们的脑海中。

Sensory Fever.name: Sensory Fever
Sensory Fever.description:
A ximtal's withering attacks cause a debilitating disease targeting the senses

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:36]

Stage1 creature loses one sense determined randomly: taste, smell, hearing, or sight (1 day)

Stage 2 creature loses an additional sense from the stage 1 list (1 day)

Stage 3 creature loses an additional sense from the stage 1 list (1 day)

Stage 4 creature loses the last sense from the stage 1 list and any special senses, such as tremorsense or lifesense (1 day)

Stage 5 all lost senses are permanent unless restored via @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Et8RSCLx8w7uOLvo]{Sound Body} or a similar effect.

Skip Between.name: Skip Between
Skip Between.description: The sahkil moves from the Universe to the Ethereal Plane or vice-versa. While in the Ethereal Plane, they're unable to affect anything in the Universe, and they cannot be seen by beings or abilities in the Universe, unless these have an ability that can gaze into the Ethereal Plane. While on the Material Plane the inverse is true for anything on the Ethereal Plane. A summoned sahkil can't use Skip Between.

Easy to Call.name: Easy to Call
Easy to Call.description: A ximtal's level is considered 2 lower for the purpose of being conjured by the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2ykmAVKrsAWcazcC]{Binding Circle} ritual (and potentially other rituals, at the GM's discretion), but it is always free to attack or leave instead of negotiate unless the primary caster's check is a critical success.

Despoiler.name: Despoiler
Despoiler.description:
1000 feet. Creatures within the aura take a –2 circumstance penalty to all saving throws against poisons, diseases, and drugs.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.itdoXvcDo8wwmTME]{Effect: Despoiler}

Isolate Foes.name: Isolate Foes
Isolate Foes.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The ximtal attempts to isolate its enemy's companions, forcing an impression that each creature's friends and allies have vanished and they are all alone against an insurmountable threat. The ximtal chooses up to four creatures, each of whom must be adjacent to one other target. Each target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:38] save. On a failure, a target becomes out of phase with all allies. The affected creatures can't perceive their allies or interact with them in any way, and they can move into allies' spaces as if their allies simply weren't there. Allies similarly can't perceive or interact with the affected creatures with one exception: an ally can target an affected creature with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SUKaxVZW2TlM8lu0]{Cleanse Affliction} to remove the effects. Every 24 hours, an affected creature can attempt a new saving throw to end this effect.

Ximtal.name: Ximtal
Ximtal.publicNotes:
The struggles of loneliness and the anxiety that accompanies that feeling plague many creatures, and ximtals delight in exploiting this fear for their own perverse gain. Appearing as hybrids of rats and crabs with grasping tentacles, these scheming fiends manipulate their victims over long spans of time, like pakalchis, to savor the most fear they can. Ximtals use subtlety to entrap their prey and often don't directly engage their targets. They use insecurities as a tool and force poor behavior in mortals they set their sights on. They prefer to focus their machinations on strong-willed and well-intentioned mortals, hoping to erode their pride and self-worth and ultimately lead them eschew altruistic efforts.

Rather than focusing on a single victim, a ximtal might instead seek out a particular cause of interest to the sahkil's appetites. These creatures often wander the multiverse seeking to sabotage societal crusades or suppress divergent ideologies.

While most ximtals work alone, they sometimes enlist the assistance of pakalchis, who share similar tastes in mortal fear. Together and focused, these two types of fiends can dissolve individual self-worth, relationships, and even entire organizations.

Ages ago, when this cycle of the multiverse was still adolescent, a cabal of psychopomps who already felt bored and restrained in their role of ushering souls to their ultimate resting place rebelled against their station. It was this corruption of the cycle of souls that spawned the first sahkils.

Ambivalent to the prescribed order of the multiverse and spiteful of mortals, sahkils delight in spreading fear and unease to all beings, clogging up the metaphysical cycle with anxiety-ridden mortals too scared to achieve their potential. These fiends have drastically changed from their dedicated psychopomp predecessors. They are creatures of spite and torment, fear and disgust. They exploit the most common and rare fears for their own perverse satisfaction, and they want nothing more than to frighten mortals and make them question their reason for existence.

Most sahkils lurk on the Ethereal Plane, but they frequently invade the Material Plane to torment mortals and spread terror. They use their innate ability to slip between the veils of the Ethereal and Material effortlessly, often stalking their targets for days or weeks before enacting their devious plots.

Coil.name: 盘绕 Coil
Coil.description: 地精群蛇使用一个动作将自身盘绕起来，使其尖牙的船机范围从5尺提升至10尺。在地精群蛇使用其尖牙打击后，它变为未盘绕。

Coiled Strike.name: 盘绕打击 Coiled Strike
Coiled Strike.description: 如同@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.W7SbTykXrNwxDzJc]，但地精群蛇只能在盘绕后使用此反应。

Incessant Yammering.name: 喋喋不休 Incessant Yammering
Incessant Yammering.description:
15尺

地精群蛇的众多头颅不断争吵互怼，令附近生物烦躁分心。每个在灵光内开始回合的非地精生物，必须尝试一次@Check[will|dc:21]豁免。失败时，它在察觉检定和意志豁免上承受-1状态减值，持续1轮。成功时，它临时免疫1分钟。

Infighting.name: 内斗 Infighting
Infighting.description: 当地精群蛇的攻击掷骰或技能检定大失败时，它必须成功通过一次@Check[flat|dc:5]检定，否则此时它的头颅会争论该归咎于哪一个头而陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}。敌人也可以通过使用一个具有听觉，专注，语言和心灵特征的单动作，来尝试一次@Check[deception|dc:20]检定，以挑起争论。

Goblin Breath.name: 地精吐息 Goblin Breath
Goblin Breath.description: 地精群蛇喷出一团@Template[type:cone|distance:15]范围的恶臭蒸汽。蒸汽范围内的非地精生物必须成功通过一次@Check[fortitude|dc:20]豁免，否则将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}。大失败时，生物在处于恶心状态期间还将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}。成功豁免的生物免疫24小时。地精群蛇在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Goblin Breath]]{1d4轮}内不能再次使用地精吐息。

Gobmob Snake.name: 地精群蛇 Gobmob Snake
Gobmob Snake.publicNotes:
这些变异的地精蛇拥有不少于三颗头颅。

地精蛇是一种散发恶臭的蛇形生物，全身覆盖油腻的黑色鳞片，口中布满獠牙，长着酷似地精的无唇头颅。

Echolocation 20 feet.description: A sabosan can use their hearing as a precise sense at the listed range.
Echolocation 20 feet.name: Echolocation 20 feet

Drain Blood.name: Drain Blood
Drain Blood.description:
Requirements The sabosan has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

Effect The sabosan drains blood from the creature. The creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. The sabosan gains a number of temporary Hit Points equal to the number of Hit Points lost by the creature due to its drained condition.

Fell Shriek.name: Fell Shriek
Fell Shriek.description: The sabosan emits a deafening cry in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. Non-sabosan creatures in this area must each succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 minute.

Powerful Charge.name: Powerful Charge
Powerful Charge.description: The sabosan Strides or Flies up to double their Speed and then makes a claw Strike. If the sabosan moved at least 20 feet, they deal an additional 1d6 slashing damage on a hit.

Sabosan.name: Sabosan
Sabosan.publicNotes:
Sabosans are intelligent, bat-like humanoids who live in warm forests and drink the blood of other creatures, particularly people. They have thin, emaciated torsos and broad, leathery wings that can reach a span of almost 20 feet. Sabosans' heads, necks, shoulders, and upper chests are covered with red or dark-brown fur that obscures their stretched-thin flesh. Though their ears are large and pointed like a bat's and they can echolocate as bats do, their vision is also quite strong, enough so that they can use it to easily track quarry in low light.

Some naturalist scholars believe that sabosans are distant descendants of humans who were afflicted with vampirism but managed to avoid succumbing to undeath. Others posit they were once a cult of demon worshippers whose dark rites transformed them into their current forms. No matter their true origins, sabosans have infamous reputations among towns and cities south of Golarion's equator. Even mere rumors of sabosans in an area are enough to set off city-wide hunts, and the truly superstitious aren't above setting fires near every grotto, nook, and foxhole they come across in order to smoke out the nocturnal creatures.

Sabosans hunt during the twilight hours or just after dark, when their echolocation gives them an edge over sleeping prey. They are capable hunters but indiscriminating when it comes to food sources; their rapid metabolisms means sabosans must eat nearly 20 pounds of meat and fruit per day, supplemented, of course, with copious amounts of blood.

Sabosans' obscure faith reveres two deities: the slain Demon Lord Vyriavaxus, Lord of Shadows, and the nearly forgotten sun god Easivra. Vyriavaxus has an obvious link with the creatures, with his appearance as a giant bat, but their connection to the sun god hints at a complex depth in sabosan beliefs.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Hellstrider.name: Hellstrider
Hellstrider.description:
A levaloch ignores the effects of non-magical difficult terrain. They take no damage from caltrops or from damaging terrain that deals physical, acid, or cold damage.

A levaloch can move through liquids up to 5 feet deep at their full Speed.

Phalanx Fighter.name: Phalanx Fighter
Phalanx Fighter.description:
All devils of equal or lower level adjacent to a levaloch gain a +1 circumstance bonus to their AC as the levaloch shields them from harm.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.KjWPSJonzrZ8jv7X]{Effect: Phalanx Fighter}

Stable Stance.name: Stable Stance
Stable Stance.description: A levaloch gains a +2 circumstance bonus to their Fortitude DC against being Shoved and to other saving throws to resist being moved against their will.

Barbed Net.name: Barbed Net
Barbed Net.description:
When a levaloch hits a creature with their barbed net, the net wraps around the target, which becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds. If the Strike was a critical success, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}.

When a creature [[/act escape dc=22]]{Escapes}, or if the Strike misses, the net crumbles into rust.

Each time a creature attempts to Escape, it takes @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage from the net's barbs, regardless of whether the attempt succeeds.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.HafP5vrdGdoqoFMo]{Effect: Barbed Net}

Forge Weapon.name: Forge Weapon
Forge Weapon.description:
A levaloch reforges part of their barbed iron substance into a new +1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.DxCuJKynlnMQZHgp]{Striking} trident or barbed net. Their previous trident crumbles to rust.

When the levaloch is destroyed, any tridents or barbed nets they created crumble to rust.

Merciless Thrust.name: Merciless Thrust
Merciless Thrust.description: When a levaloch hits a creature that has the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} conditions with a melee trident Strike, the Strike deals an additional [[/r 2d6]] damage.

Levaloch.name: Levaloch
Levaloch.publicNotes:
Fearsome giants of jagged iron, levalochs serve in the armies of Hell as potent warriors and tenacious hunters-creatures of absolute discipline endlessly obedient to diabolical tyrants.

There are countless legions of lawful fiends in the nine layers of Hell, warring against the celestial planes and scouring the Material Plane for souls to corrupt.
Levaloch.allSaves: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Tickle.name: Tickle
Tickle.description:
The nightgaunt can use its tail to tickle a foe with horrible efficiency. A creature hit by its tail Strike must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:21] save; if the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the nightgaunt, it uses the outcome one degree of success worse than the result it rolled.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Success The creature is overcome with laughter and can't perform reactions for 1 round.

Failure As success, and the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Critical Failure As success, and the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} and can't speak for 1 round.

Faceless.name: Faceless
Faceless.description: The nightgaunt has no face, but it can still see in all directions as if its entire body were an eye. It has no need to breathe, and it is immune to all inhaled toxins and other olfactory effects.

Clutches.name: Clutches
Clutches.description: A nightgaunt can Fly at full Speed while it has a Medium or smaller creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in its claws, carrying that creature along with it.

Nightgaunt.name: Nightgaunt
Nightgaunt.publicNotes:
Nightgaunts lurk in dreams, lying in wait to spirit away the unwary dreamer. Once connected to such a being, the nightgaunt feeds upon the mortal's emotions before abandoning them—often in a place they might never wake from.

A nightgaunt appears as a bony humanoid with inky black skin, batlike wings, a long sinuous tail, and demonic horns atop a head that lacks any face or features. Most nightgaunts have little interest in anything other than sating their hunger for emotions. They find the art of inducing nightmares to be a surefire way to feast, but they're even more adept at tormenting their victims through tickling while carrying them at precarious heights.

Nightgaunts often gather in vast colonies in the Dreamlands, where they entertain each other by sharing emotion memories of their meals through strange caresses. These colonies pose great danger to any adventurer foolish enough to approach.

When conjured forth into other worlds, they serve only grudgingly, often working equally as hard to find a way to escape servitude and feed on their conjurer's emotions as they do on the task they've been compelled to perform.

Instinctive Alloy.name: Instinctive Alloy
Instinctive Alloy.description:
Trigger The assault alloy is hit by an attack with a metal weapon or metal spell or effect

Effect The physical damage from the triggering weapon, spell, or effect instead restores the assault alloy's Hit Points as they seamlessly incorporate some of the metal used into their body. If already at full Hit Points, the assault alloy gains temporary Hit Points that last for 1 round instead. If a metal weapon triggers this, the weapon's die size decreases by one step to a minimum die size of d4 for 1 minute, and that weapon can't trigger Instinctive Alloy again during this time.

Metal Manipulation.name: Metal Manipulation
Metal Manipulation.description: 30 feet. An assault alloy has control over all unattended metal within the emanation and can use any of this metal as the origin point for their metal needle ranged Strikes.

Idle Transmutation.name: Idle Transmutation
Idle Transmutation.description: An assault alloy has full alchemical control over the properties of their metal. Each time they make a metal needle Strike or Cast a Spell with the metal trait, they choose whether the metal they use is adamantine, cold iron, dawnsilver, or any other solid precious metal.

Metal Blink.name: Metal Blink
Metal Blink.description:
Requirements The assault alloy is adjacent to metal of at least 1 bulk

Effect An assault alloy can liquefy the metals of their body and travel up to their Speed through spaces with contiguous metal, even if it's not uniformly connected (as in a scrap heap or a pile of treasure). This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Verdurous Ooze.name: 翠绿泥怪 Verdurous Ooze

Motion Sense.name: 运动感知 Motion Sense
Motion Sense.description: 翠绿泥怪能通过震动以及空气或水的流动来感知附近的生物。

Corrosive Surface.name: 腐蚀性表面 Corrosive Surface
Corrosive Surface.description: 当一个生物用金属武器或无武装攻击命中翠绿泥怪时，攻击者必须尝试一次@Check[reflex|dc:21|traits:damaging-effect]豁免。失败时，武器或攻击者受到@Damage[2d4[acid]]伤害（在对泥怪正常造成伤害后）。投掷武器无法豁免自动承受此伤害。

Enliven Foliage.name: 焕活植被 Enliven Foliage
Enliven Foliage.description:
20尺。翠绿泥怪不断散发超自然蒸汽，促使附近植物急速生长，在弥漫范围内内扭动缠绕，试图抓住任何事物。这片区域对于非翠绿泥怪的生物变为困难地形。当生物在此灵光中开始其回合时，它必须成功通过一次@Check[reflex|dc:21]豁免，否则在速度上承受-10尺环境减值，直到其离开弥漫范围。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.4fmRhCljZ9l0Tr3J]

Split.name: 分裂 Split
Split.description: 当具有不低于10点生命值的翠绿泥怪受到穿刺或挥砍伤害时，它会分裂成两只相同的泥怪，每只具有原本一半的生命值。一只泥怪保持在原本相同空间，另一只则处于一个相邻的为被占据的空间。如果没有相邻空间未被占据，它自动推离生物和物体来让自己填满空间（GM来决定物体和生物是否过大或过重而无法推离）。

Sleep Gas.name: 催眠气体 Sleep Gas
Sleep Gas.description:
翠绿泥怪调整其超自然蒸汽灵光以影响@Template[emanation|distance:20]范围内的活物，迫使他们尝试一次@Check[will|dc:24]豁免。

大成功 生物不受影响且临时免疫催眠气体24小时。

成功 生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}，持续1轮。

失败 生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]。如果它在1分钟后仍然失去意识，它自动醒来。

大失败 生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]。如果它在1小时后仍然失去意识，它自动醒来。

Verdurous Ooze Acid.name: 翠绿泥怪酸 Verdurous Ooze Acid
Verdurous Ooze Acid.description: 翠绿泥怪的酸蚀伤害只会影响金属和血肉——不会影响骨头，石头或其他材料。

Verdurous Ooze.publicNotes: 翠绿泥怪常见于温带森林、温暖的丛林或其他植被繁茂之地。与多数泥怪不同，它们攀爬能力欠佳，常被困于天然或人工壕沟之中。军阀与法师们常利用此特性，将翠绿泥怪作为守卫，安置在堡垒或塔楼墙壁周围的深坑中。

Vicious Blow.name: Vicious Blow
Vicious Blow.description: Effect The oread guard makes a melee Strike. This counts as two attacks when calculating the guard's multiple attack penalty. If this Strike hits, the oread guard deals an extra die of weapon damage.

Oread Guard.name: Oread Guard
Oread Guard.publicNotes:
Elemental earth laces through the bones of oreads, who appear similar to stone statues of their mortal ancestry, with delicate crystals in place of hair, fur, or scales. Most oreads are stoic and slow to plan but steadfast in their resolve and unwavering in their convictions.

The typical oread cherishes quiet seclusion. Yet as they age, many oreads find themselves inexplicably drawn to some far-flung location with a pull like that exerted on the needle of a compass—intangible, constant, and ultimately irresistible. The destination of this mysterious pilgrimage is unique to each oread, though it usually ends in some place of great mystical power, natural splendor, or esoteric learning. Most oreads are drawn to a place that's somewhat familiar, but a rare few feel drawn to travel in a seemingly random direction, departing with only the hope that they'll discover whatever mystery lies at the end of their invisible path.

Many oreads find that the role of a guard suits their personality well, for in such a role they can feel as if they're helping promote order but also find time to stand vigil as lone sentinels over a specific portion of a fortification or a remote location on a wilderness trail.

Lovelorn.name: Lovelorn
Lovelorn.publicNotes:
A particularly macabre form of undead, these spiderlike creatures resemble still-beating hearts with rib bones for legs and tendrils of gore dangling beneath. Their twisted forms hint at their ghastly origin, as these undead form from those who die tragic deaths in service to toxic love: star-crossed lovers who die rather than accept a life apart from one another, rejected suitors whose unrequited affections warp into malice, and other victims of tragic relationships both romantic and otherwise. Any of these might spawn a lovelorn in death, their anguish and fixation on their broken heart causing the organ to animate.

A freshly spawned lovelorn often seeks out those it knew in life, stalking and tormenting them or, in some cases, those around them. In undeath, they gain an understanding of emotions and how to manipulate them, cultivating the misery, anger, and cruelty they thrive upon. Typically, these undead long to enact vengeance upon those they feel drove them to their tragic fates, although in rare cases they may instead act as dark guardians, fixating on a particular loved one and "protecting" them by visiting misery upon anyone who slights them.

Gloom Aura.name: Gloom Aura
Gloom Aura.description:
60 feet. A lovelorn's presence instills unease and turns the air cold, dark, and stale. Creatures within the aura take a -1 circumstance penalty to saving throws made to resist emotion effects.

If the lovelorn makes a place home for a week or more, that location can become suffused with this magic even outside the lovelorn's aura, lasting until the lovelorn leaves or is destroyed.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.Me16QQGxpivWE2WW]{Effect: Gloom Aura}

Skitter Away.name: Skitter Away
Skitter Away.description:
Trigger A creature ends its movement in a space adjacent to the lovelorn

Effect The lovelorn Strides or Climbs 10 feet away from the triggering creature. This movement does not trigger reactions.

Cynic's Curse.name: Cynic's Curse
Cynic's Curse.description:
A creature hit by a lovelorn's fangs Strike must attempt a @Check[will|dc:19] save as it grows morose and listless. If the creature would be affected by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.b515AZlB0sridKSq]{Calm} spell, that spell attempts to counteract this curse instead of having its normal effect.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success For 1 minute, the target can't benefit from helpful emotion effects, but can still be affected by harmful emotion effects.

Failure As success, plus the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for the same duration.

Critical Failure As failure, but the curse's effects are permanent.

Augur.name: 邪窥魔 Augur
Augur.publicNotes:
这些由强壮的肌肉、锯齿状的刀片和染血的金属组成的球体是影界最常见的链魔。每个邪窥魔只有一只眼睛，他们从这只眼睛里可以看到其他链魔造成的恐怖。在经过其他链魔的调教之后，邪窥魔期待并懂得欣赏这种痛苦。邪窥魔直径1尺，重约30磅。

这些栖身于暗影的魔族——链魔——全都有着一种骇人的执念：通过自残来追寻终极感官体验。链魔只有在向受害者施加痛苦与恐惧、尝试新的酷刑手法，或是将折磨反施于己身时，才会暂时摆脱一贯的冷酷淡漠。它们自诩为觉悟者，超越了道德与凡俗禁忌的束缚；但在受害者眼中，它们只是毫无感情、专施虐待狂式痛苦的折磨者。这些魔族声称在思想、形式和行为上追求绝对的完美，并且它们不承认那些不需要切除肉体或折磨精神的锻炼方式。链魔从极度喜欢施虐或受虐的凡人灵魂中诞生，它们被审判并被送往影界。它们被塑造成各种适合于它们邪恶嗜好的形态，从低级的邪窥魔到制造痛苦和残废的大师邪隐魔。转化过程会进一步扭曲它们的灵魂，其他的链魔会将它们的新成员送到影界数不清的痛苦之室中。

Painsight.name: 痛苦视觉 Painsight
Painsight.description: 链魔能自动知晓它们能看到的一个生物是否具有@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]、@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]状态，以及具体的状态值。

Regeneration 2 (Deactivated by Holy or S.name: 再生2（圣洁或银使其无效） Regeneration 2 (Deactivated by Holy or Silver)

Feel the Blades.name: 如芒刺背 Feel the Blades
Feel the Blades.description: 30尺。当有生物在灵光范围内结束回合时，会觉得邪窥魔锋利的刀片正在切割自己的皮肤。该生物必须成功通过@Check[will|dc:17|options:area-effect,inflicts:frightened]检定，否则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}（大失败则@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}）。

Focus Gaze.name: 专注凝视 Focus Gaze
Focus Gaze.description: 邪窥魔盯着一个30尺内它们能看见的生物。目标必须立即尝试1次针对如芒刺背能力的意志豁免。在尝试豁免后，该生物直到邪窥魔下一回合开始对专注凝视临时免疫。

Whilring Slice.name: 旋刃切割 Whilring Slice
Whilring Slice.description: 邪窥魔飞行或行走，在移动的时候旋转自身。邪窥魔对路径上每个空间内的敌人造成1次刀刃打击的伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:16|basic]豁免）。即使邪窥魔多次经过同一空间，每个生物也只能被影响1次。

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description: The larabay can take on the appearance of a specific Medium or Small humanoid. This removes their fly Speed but doesn't change the attack and damage modifiers with their Strikes.

Mischief.name: Mischief
Mischief.description:
Requirements The larabay's last action was a successful rapier Strike

Effect The larabay attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} the creature they hit. They gain a +4 status bonus to the Athletics check. This attempt neither applies nor counts toward the larabay's multiple attack penalty.

Rainbow Flight.name: Rainbow Flight
Rainbow Flight.description:
The larabay Flies up to its fly Speed, creating a stunning rainbow in its wake. This movement doesn't provoke reactions. Any creature adjacent to the larabay at any point during this movement must attempt a @Check[will|dc:30] saving throw to resist staring at the magnificent rainbow. The larabay cannot use Rainbow Flight again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Rainbow Flight]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Failure The target is dazzled for 1 round and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

Critical Failure The target is dazzled for 1 minute and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2}.

Befuddling Visions.name: Befuddling Visions
Befuddling Visions.description:
The larabay's gaze creates disorientation and confusion. A creature hit by befuddling gaze must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and temporarily immune to befuddling visions for 1 minute.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target becomes clumsy and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round, and clumsy and dazzled for 1 round afterward.

Larabay.name: Larabay
Larabay.publicNotes: Larabays are bright-eyed, humanoid-looking fey with colorful wings and needlelike teeth who generally reside along warm coastal regions and islands. Like other fey, they enjoy lavish pranks and fantastical illusions that create chicanery and confusion. A larabay's desire for a joke can sometimes reach dire extremes, such as employing illusions to lure ships into rocks and travelers off cliffs. While some have fortuitously become heroes by playing pranks on tyrants or cruel people, this is almost entirely coincidental, as larabays do not often consider the morals or goals of their targets; they simply enjoy the fruits of their chaos.

Stunning Pulse.name: Stunning Pulse
Stunning Pulse.description:
The nymolus emits a powerful mental pulse that overwhelms nearby creatures. Creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:27|options:area-effect,inflicts:stunned] save to avoid being stunned. The nymolus can't use Stunning Pulse again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Stunning Pulse]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3}.

Inhabit Ugothol.name: Inhabit Ugothol
Inhabit Ugothol.description: The nymolus spends 10 minutes with a willing ugothol to become enmeshed with the creature. The nymolus then fully inhabits the ugothol's body. While inhabited, the ugothol retains its mental abilities, but its body is completely controlled by the nymolus. The nymolus and ugothol each have an initiative count as if they were separate creatures. The nymolus can't use any ability that relies on their physical form while inhabiting the ugothol, but the nymolus can still perceive and cast spells normally. The two remain enmeshed until the nymolus uses the ugothol's Assume Form ability to separate them, or until the ugothol is slain. If the ugothol dies, the nymolus becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} due to the force of the separation.

Replace Recollection.name: Replace Recollection
Replace Recollection.description: The nymolus can spend 10 minutes to replace any memory with another memory they have access to via a memory crystal.

Extract Memory.name: Extract Memory
Extract Memory.description:
Requirements The target creature must be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing; Efect The nymolus reaches into an adjacent creature's memory and extracts up to 10 minutes of the target's experiences, forming them into a memory crystal within the nymolus's brain. The target creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:27] save to avoid losing its memory.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature loses the target memory.

Failure The creature loses the target memory and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature can only roll to end this condition if it takes damage from the nymolus themself or if counteracted by an efect of at least 13th level or 7th rank.

Nymolus.name: Nymolus
Nymolus.publicNotes:
Alghollthus share a genetic memory and are theoretically capable of recalling every experience dating back to the existence of the frst alghollthu hundreds of millions of years ago.

Accessing these memories all at once would be lethally taxing to most alghollthus, but nymoluses are different. They revel in tapping into this genetic memory and add to it by stealing memories from others, turning them into memory crystals. A single nymolus can store up to 10 crystals at a time within their brain, replacing more mundane ones as they fll this storage and keeping the rest in collections among their lairs. To collect memories, nymoluses venture further from the seas than some of their siblings by establishing symbiotic links with ugothols. They're able to coordinate with these creatures by reshaping their bodies, then compressing and interweaving their fesh into the ugothols, which allows them to search for rare and intriguing recollections.

Deep One.name: 深潜者 Deep One

Pressurized.name: 稳压 Pressurized
Pressurized.description: 深潜者免疫因水压变化而造成的伤害和其他负面效果。

Endless.name: 无终 Endless
Endless.description: 深潜者不会衰老，且免疫造成魔法衰老的法术和其他效果。除非被杀死，深潜者永生不死。

Fervent Frenzy.name: 炽烈狂暴 Fervent Frenzy
Fervent Frenzy.description: 深潜者以任意顺序进行两次爪打击和一次颚打击。如果目标生物当前因深潜者的分享敬拜能力而陷入惊惧，则它对于这些攻击@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]。深潜者陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1}直到其下个回合开始。

Share Devotion.name: 分享敬拜 Share Devotion
Share Devotion.description:
深潜者令敌人的心灵充斥着外神带来的恐怖幻觉。@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]范围内所有敌对生物必须尝试一次@Check[will|dc:17]豁免；无论结果如何，生物都将临时免疫分享敬拜24小时。

大成功 生物不受影响

成功 生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}

失败 生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}

大失败 同失败，但生物只要处于惊惧就还会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]

Deep One.publicNotes:
成年深潜者平均体重300磅，身高7尺，不过在陆地上因其开阔的站姿和天生的驼背，看起来会显得更矮一些。

这种笨重，两栖，不灭的类人生物被称作深潜者，栖息于格拉利昂的沿海地带与深海海沟。尽管多数只求独善其身，仍有部分成员不遗余力地扩张族群规模。

Carbuncle.name: Carbuncle
Carbuncle.publicNotes:
Never have legend and misinformation met upon a more inauspicious brow than that of the lowly carbuncle. At frst glance, they appear to be little more than ungainly reptiles. What sets them apart are their strange magical abilities and the gemstone-like horn protruding from between their goggling eyes. Although rumors suggest various uses for carbuncle horns, ranging from miracle cure-alls to potent magical components, the truth is much more mundane: a carbuncle's horn is merely a highly refective growth, not unlike a fngernail.

Carbuncles also possess a strange sense that allows them to detect treasure that has been hidden or obscured. The creatures generally feel a compulsion to move toward these treasures and remain nearby. Strangely, carbuncles seem disinterested once the valuables are laid out in the open, as if the obfuscation were part of their interest. Many would-be treasure hunters end up following the creatures in hopes of fnding treasures, though the fearfulness of carbuncles makes this a very diffcult prospect. Most carbuncles abandon their nests after being scared away, even when their sense would typically draw them back.

Carbuncle Empathy.name: Carbuncle Empathy
Carbuncle Empathy.description: The carbuncle can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.kdhbPaBMK1d1fpbA]{Telepathically} send mild feelings and sensations to nearby creatures. It can't use this ability to communicate in language or hinder a target, but it might convey a feeling of dread or the scent of food cooking nearby.

Treasure Sense.name: Treasure Sense
Treasure Sense.description: The carbuncle can sense the presence and location of any object or grouping of objects worth at least 50 gp in total within 500 feet of it. The carbuncle's sense only functions if the treasure is within in a container or physically obscured, such as when buried underground. Objects worn on a person or left out in open air don't trigger the carbuncle's sense.

Easy to Influence.name: Easy to Influence
Easy to Influence.description: Any mental spell can affect a carbuncle, regardless of creature type limitations. Against a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qwlh6aDgi86U3Q7H]{Suggestion} spell, a carbuncle always gets an outcome one degree of success worse than it rolled on its saving throw.

Fatal Faker.name: Fatal Faker
Fatal Faker.description:
Trigger The carbuncle takes damage

Effect The carbuncle feigns death by teleporting away and leaving a replica of its corpse behind, creating a colorful flash of light and a croaking sound. The real carbuncle transports to a clear space within 30 feet that it can see, and a hollow shell remains behind. The fake body appears solid until it is touched, at which point it crumbles to dust.

Specious Suggestion.name: Specious Suggestion
Specious Suggestion.description:
Frequency three times per day

Effect The carbuncle concentrates on a creature it can see and tries to manipulate that creature, imploring them to perform harmless, pointless, and usually embarrassing actions. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:18] save. The target then becomes temporarily immune for 24 hours. This has the ef ects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qwlh6aDgi86U3Q7H]{Suggestion} except that a critical success bolsters the target and grants them a +1 status bonus to Will saves for 1 hour, the duration on a failure is 1 round, and the duration on a critical failure is a 1 minute. The target can attempt a new save at the end of its turn each round to end the ef ect.

Void Breath.name: Void Breath
Void Breath.description: The ravener breathes a blast of necrotic flame that deals @Damage[20d6[fire]] damage plus @Damage[4d6[persistent,void]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:44|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:drained] save). A creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} on a critical failure). If a creature is drained by the ravener's Void Breath, the ravener's soul ward gains 5 HP. The ravener can't use Void Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Void Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair a cinder ravener's vision; it ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

Soulsense 60 feet.name: Soulsense 60 feet
Soulsense 60 feet.description: A ravener senses the spiritual essence of living and undead creatures within the listed range. Creatures whose material bodies are one unit with their souls, like celestials and fiends, appear brighter to this sense.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: 对抗原能的全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Cowering Fear.name: Cowering Fear
Cowering Fear.description:
90 feet. @Check[will|dc:42]

A ravener's frightful presence causes creatures to cower in fear as well. As long as a creature is at least @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} or more as a result of the ravener's frightful presence, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} from the fear.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]

Discorporate.name: Discorporate
Discorporate.description:
Trigger The ravener takes excess damage to their soul ward but still has at least 51 Hit Points in their soul ward

Effect The ravener draws deeply into their soul ward, discorporating their body into soul energy to escape. They take@Damage[50[untyped]] damage to their soul ward and their physical body vanishes, reappearing [[/gmr 1d4 #hours]]{1d4 hours} later in a random location within 1 mile from the location where they used Discorporate.

Soul Ward.name: Soul Ward
Soul Ward.description:
200 HP

An intangible field of necromantic energy protects a ravener from total destruction. A soul ward has 150 maximum Hit Points, or 200 if the ravener is level 21 or higher. Whenever a ravener would be reduced below 1 Hit Point, all damage in excess of what would reduce them to 1 Hit Point is instead dealt to their soul ward. If this damage reduces the soul ward to fewer than 0 Hit Points, the ravener is destroyed. A soul ward's Hit Points can be restored only via specific ravener abilities such as Consume Soul, Void Breath, or vicious criticals. A ravener who goes more than a week without successfully using Consume Soul to feed on a dying creature starves, and their soul ward loses 1d4 Hit Points each day until they feed. If the ravener's soul ward loses all its Hit Points while the ravener still has more than 1 HP, they become a ravener husk.

All Becomes Flame.name: All Becomes Flame
All Becomes Flame.description:
The ravener curses a creature within 60 feet to have their magic replaced with primordial flames. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:42] save. Regardless of the result, the target becomes temporarily immune for 1 day. Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is cursed for 1 round. While cursed, any spells that the creature casts gain the fire trait and have their damage type changed to fire damage, regardless of the original damage type or types of the spell. Additionally, any magical items that the cursed target holds or wields are affected in the same manner, such as changing the cold damage of a frost rune to fire damage. The cursed creature can attempt to temporarily suppress the curse as an action, which has the concentrate trait. If the creature succeeds a @Check[will|dc:42] save, the curse is suppressed until the end of their turn.

Failure As success, but the curse's duration is 1 hour.

Critical Failure As success, but the curse's duration is 1 day, and the DC to suppress the curse increases to DC 44.

Consume Soul.name: Consume Soul
Consume Soul.description:
Trigger A living creature within 30 feet of the ravener dies

Effect The ravener tears the creature's soul from its body with their maw and gulps it down. The dying creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:44] save with the same DC as the ravener's breath ability.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The ravener tears off a small chunk of the creature's soul. If the victim is restored to life, they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} in addition to any other side effects of returning to life. The ravener adds a number of Hit Points to their soul ward equal to half the creature's level.

Failure As success, but the creature's soul is ravaged. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} and the ravener adds a number of Hit Points to their soul ward equal to the creature's level.

Critical Failure As failure, but the ravener devours the entire soul. The victim can't be restored to life as long as the ravener exists except via powerful magic such as a wish ritual, and the ravener adds a number of Hit Points to their soul ward equal to twice the creature's level.

Manipulate Flames.name: Manipulate Flames
Manipulate Flames.description: The ravener intensifies nearby fires. Every foe within 60 feet taking persistent fire damage takes @Damage[5d6[fire]] damage.

Vicious Criticals.name: Vicious Criticals
Vicious Criticals.description: The ravener treats an attack roll as a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20, as long as the attack roll was a success. Additionally, whenever the ravener makes a critical hit with one of their Strikes, the target must succeed on a @Check[fortitude|dc:42] save or gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} condition. If the target already has a drained value of greater than 0, their drained value instead increases by 1, to a maximum of drained 4. Whenever the ravener applies drain to a creature in this way, their soul ward gains 5 Hit Points.

Ravener.name: Ravener
Ravener.publicNotes:
The ravener presented here was once an ancient cinder dragon.

Though their lifespans can measure in millennia, all dragons must eventually perish. While many do so on the blades or under the spells of dragonslayers, some manage to outlast their enemies and must, in time, face the truth that awaits all living creatures at the end of their natural life span. As with many other creatures, some dragons respond to such looming reminders of their own mortality poorly, and the particularly prideful or wrathful of their kind often lash out in anger when confronted by this grim truth. Peace and acceptance are found by some dragons, but the most stubborn of their ilk (and invariably the most wicked) can pursue a different answer to the problem. These dragons seek out sinister rites that can transform them into undead creatures known as raveners.

A ravener's flesh is stripped away as part of the transformation, leaving only bones. What they lose in flesh, however, the dragon gains in soul-rending power, as their spiritual energy forms a protective barrier around their body, keeping it intact and allowing flight with now-skeletal wings. This existence isn't as easy to maintain as other forms of undeath, however, and the ravener must feed regularly on living souls to power their profane metabolism. Their hunger is much greater than that of a living dragon, so raveners are forced to relocate regularly, traveling to fresh hunting grounds each time they strip their current home of prey.
Ravener.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. primal

Esipil.name: Esipil
Esipil.publicNotes:
Among the least of the sahkils, esipils delight in spreading fears and uncertainty among people who live with animals that could turn on them. They generally appear to their prey as some benign creature such as a domesticated dog or cat, but once they gain trust and get their victims close, they transform into a terrifying creature that looks part dog and part worm with tendrils of viscera that the creature uses as both a tongue and a weapon.

Of all the sahkils, esipils are most likely to ingratiate themselves with mortals, sometimes serving powerful spellcasters and other times simply living among unsuspecting victims, biding their time until they strike.

Ages ago, when this cycle of the multiverse was still adolescent, a cabal of psychopomps who already felt bored and restrained in their role of ushering souls to their ultimate resting place rebelled against their station. It was this corruption of the cycle of souls that spawned the first sahkils.

Ambivalent to the prescribed order of the multiverse and spiteful of mortals, sahkils delight in spreading fear and unease to all beings, clogging up the metaphysical cycle with anxiety-ridden mortals too scared to achieve their potential. These fiends have drastically changed from their dedicated psychopomp predecessors. They are creatures of spite and torment, fear and disgust. They exploit the most common and rare fears for their own perverse satisfaction, and they want nothing more than to frighten mortals and make them quetion their reason for existence.

Most sahkils lurk on the Ethereal Plane, but they frequently invade the Material Plane to torment mortals and spread terror. They use their innate ability to slip between the veils of the Ethereal and Material effortlessly, often stalking their targets for days or weeks before enacting their devious plots.

Easy to Call.name: Easy to Call
Easy to Call.description: A esipil's level is considered 2 lower for the purpose of being conjured by the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2ykmAVKrsAWcazcC]{Binding Circle} ritual (and potentially other rituals, at the GM's discretion), but it is always free to attack or leave instead of negotiate unless the primary caster's check is a critical success.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The esipil transforms into a Tiny cat, dog, or other unassuming domestic animal. This doesn't affect the esipil's statistics, but it could change the damage type of its Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Skip Between.name: Skip Between
Skip Between.description: The sahkil moves from the Universe to the Ethereal Plane or vice-versa. While in the Ethereal Plane, they're unable to affect anything in the Universe, and they cannot be seen by beings or abilities in the Universe, unless these have an ability that can gaze into the Ethereal Plane. While on the Material Plane the inverse is true for anything on the Ethereal Plane. A summoned sahkil can't use Skip Between.

Dislocating Breath.name: 错位吐息 Dislocating Breath
Dislocating Breath.description: 相位龙吐出一股将生物撕裂的能量旋涡，在@Template[type:cone|distance:40]范围内造成@Damage[12d6[force]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:33|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。相位龙可以传送任何豁免失败的生物，将其向任意方向传送最多40尺（若大失败则传送距离加倍）。目标位置必须为地面且位于无危害的空间。相位龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Dislocating Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用错位吐息。

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 相位龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击和一次尾扫打击。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: 对抗奥术的全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Shoo!.name: 走开！ Shoo!
Shoo!.description:
触发 一个15尺内的敌人对相位龙造成伤害

效果 相位龙将该生物传送至最多25尺远的地方。目标位置必须为地面且位于无危害的空间。

Unerring Location.name: 精准定位 Unerring Location
Unerring Location.description: 相位龙自动尝试反制任何以其为目标的传送效果（反制环级7环级，反制调整值[[/r 1d20+25 #Counteract]]{+25}）。相位龙也可以选择正常受到影响。其他被同一效果选为目标的生物会照常受到影响。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 相位龙的打击重击时，恢复错位吐息的使用次数，或恢复一个已消耗的传送法术。

Phase Jump.name: 相位跳跃 Phase Jump
Phase Jump.description:
频率 每轮一次

效果 相位龙传送最多75尺。如果它们正在空中飞行，它们将保持动量，这使它即使没有使用飞行动作，在回合结束时也不会坠落。

Portal Strike.name: 传送打击 Portal Strike
Portal Strike.description: 相位龙短暂开启一个小型传送门，对75尺范围内的一个生物进行一次爪抓打击。目标对该打击处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]状态。

Phase Dragon (Adult).name: 成年相位龙 Phase Dragon (Adult)
Phase Dragon (Adult).publicNotes: 没有任何地方能限制相位龙，甚至没有任何地方能够长时间吸引它们的兴趣；它们与生俱来的奥术联系使它们与传送和移位魔法紧密相连。作为探索者和学者，相位龙随心所欲地四处游荡，探索新的地点和传送的奥秘。它们常在反复造访的遥远之地建立多处巢穴。除了巢穴中常见的财富外，相位龙更倾向于珍藏旅途中具有情感价值的物品——比如当地特有的珍稀花卉，或当地艺术家的创作。

Animated Trebuchet.name: Animated Trebuchet
Animated Trebuchet.publicNotes:
Large armies sometimes pay exorbitant fees to animate their siege weapons.

Many animated objects have useful functions but become dangers when uncontrolled.

Construct Armor (Hardness 14).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 14)
Construct Armor (Hardness 14).description: Like normal objects, an animated trebuchet has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage the trebuchet takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once an animated trebuchet is reduced to fewer than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, removing the Hardness and reducing its Armor Class to 32.

Launch.name: Launch
Launch.description:
Requirements The animated trebuchet has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in its arm.

Effect The animated trebuchet attempts an @Check[athletics|against:fortitude] check against the grabbed creature's Fortitude DC.

On a success, it fires the creature up to 40 feet in height and up to 120 feet away. The creature takes @Damage[4d12[bludgeoning]] damage plus the appropriate falling damage. If the flung creature lands on another creature, the creature it lands on takes the same amount of bludgeoning damage (@Check[reflex|dc:33|basic] save).

On a successful Launch, the animated trebuchet must Interact to reposition its arm into the proper position before it can Launch again.

Drain Blood.name: 吸血 Drain Blood
Drain Blood.description:
需求 一个处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]状态或自愿的生物在血鬼婆的触及内

效果 鬼婆将尖牙插进生物体内饮用其血。如果受害者处于受擒状态，这需要一次成功对抗受害者强韧DC的运动检定，而其他状态则自动成功。受害者陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}。鬼婆恢复15点生命值，获得的任何过量生命值将作为持续1小时的临时生命值。从已经陷入流失状态的生物吸血不会恢复鬼婆任何生命值，但是会增加1点受害者的流失状态值，当达到@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}时会杀死受害者。

受害者的流失状态每周减少1。输血需要一次成功的@Check[medicine|dc:20]检定，以及足够的血液或献血者，能在经历10分钟后减少1点流失状态值。

Bloodsense (Imprecise) 90 feet.name: 血液感知（模糊） 90尺 Bloodsense (Imprecise) 90 feet
Bloodsense (Imprecise) 90 feet.description: 血鬼婆可以感知到血液和拥有血液的生物的存在。她能够分辨出溅落的血液和活物体内血液的不同。

Borrowed Skin.name: 借用皮肤 Borrowed Skin
Borrowed Skin.description:
血鬼婆穿着一张从她杀死的类人生物那里偷来的皮肤，隐藏了她的真实形态。她外貌与所穿戴皮肤所属生物相同，包括侦测该生物的法术也不能识破。生物仍然如@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.AJstokjdG6iDjVjE]动作描述中所述，有可能侦测出伪装。

在皮肤内洒上粗盐可以阻止鬼婆将它穿回去，迫使她保持火焰形态，直到她杀死另一个类人生物，并花费1小时将其制成新的伪装。

Coven.name: 巫团 Coven
Coven.description:
血鬼婆能将@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.NzXpEzcZAjuDTZjK]， @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.XS7Wyh5YC0NWeWyB]和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Uqj344bezBq3ESdq]添加到巫团法术中。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Coven]

Assume Fiery Form.name: 展现火焰形态 Assume Fiery Form
Assume Fiery Form.description:
血鬼婆褪去她借来的皮肤，变成一团明亮的火球。她变得不定型（允许她穿过至少1尺宽的缝隙，而无需挤入，且在挤入时能以全速移动），获得火焰特征以及60尺飞行速度，变得免疫火焰，并如同火炬一样发光。她失去近战打击，且不能使用吸血，但当她会对每个接触她的生物造成@Damage[4d6[fire]|options:area-damage]伤害，进行@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic]豁免，包括由从一处相邻方格使用无武装攻击或武器攻击命中她的生物。如果她的皮肤未受损且她与皮肤相邻，则她可以使用交互来进入皮肤内从而返回其通常形态。

鬼婆也可以用一个单动作使用展现火焰形态能力，在一团烈焰中冲破她的皮肤。这样做会摧毁她借用的皮肤，并对@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]范围内所有生物造成@Damage[9d6[fire]|options:area-damage]伤害 ，进行DC 26的基础反射豁免。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.H99PJXU5cvJ4Oycm]

Blood Hag.name: 血鬼婆 Blood Hag
Blood Hag.publicNotes:
血鬼婆，亦被称作吸血女妖（soucouyant），常伪装成纯真少女潜入聚落中。这种伪装绝非幻术，因为血鬼婆会穿上之前受害者的皮肤来隐藏她的真实外貌。在白天，她的伪装几乎是完美的。但在日落之后，这个生物就会褪下她的皮，藏在安全所在，在夜间狩猎畅饮鲜血为生。

血鬼婆能够以火球的形态快速移动，穿过钥匙孔或者门和窗户上最小的缝隙，以熟睡的受害者为食，然后在黎明到来前回家披上她们偷来的皮肤。

鬼婆是来历不明的诡异掠食者，最臭名昭著的便是以孩童和年轻人为猎物。她们无一例外呈现女性外貌，在日常生活中通常伪装成凡人女性。她们强大的魔法与操纵手段让让她们能引诱天真脆弱的猎物，在绑架或吞噬之前，先将受害者折磨得体无完肤以满足其虐待狂的欲望。典型的鬼婆皆以虚荣心和控制欲为特征。虽可能存在恶意较弱的鬼婆，但此类存在往往深藏不露，既为躲避冒险者的追捕，亦为逃避其喜爱虐待的亲族。

Runic Breath.name: 符文吐息 Runic Breath
Runic Breath.description: 符文龙释放数百枚一触即爆的符文，在@Template[type:cone|distance:30]范围内造成@Damage[9d6[untyped]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。此能力的伤害类型由变幻符文决定。豁免失败的生物还会受到爆裂符文的影响。符文龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Runic Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用符文吐息。

Shifting Runes.name: 变幻符文 Shifting Runes
Shifting Runes.description: 符文龙选择酸蚀，寒冷，电击，火焰或音波伤害类型。蚀刻在其鳞片上的符文随之变幻，形成该能量类型的符文。符文龙获得对该伤害类型的免疫，且其爆裂符文与符文吐息均造成该类型伤害。任何在奥法上受训的生物无需检定即可立即识别蚀刻符文的能量类型。

equipment-Common runes of 5th level or l.name: 刻在鳞片上的常见符文（5级或更低） Common runes of 5th level or lower etched upon their scales

Magic Sense.name: 魔法感知 Magic Sense
Magic Sense.description: 符文龙能感知到列出范围内所有激活的魔法能力与效果。当符文龙进行搜寻时，它在列出范围内获得4环级侦测魔法法术的效果（此外还获得搜寻的正常好处）。

Runic Scales.name: 符文鳞片 Runic Scales
Runic Scales.description: 符文龙的鳞片作为符文石存在。符文龙不能使用蚀刻在其鳞片上的符文的效果或能力，但它们可以将其转移到适当的物品上。以这种方式向物品转移或从物品上转移一个符文需要1分钟，在此期间符文龙处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]状态。该过程自动完成无需检定，但如果符文龙在此过程中停止或受到打扰，符文将被摧毁。符文龙可以在其鳞片上蚀刻任意数量的符文，但它们通常一次只在鳞片上蚀刻少数符文。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: 对抗奥术的全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Retributive Rune.name: 惩戒符文 Retributive Rune
Retributive Rune.description:
触发 一个15尺内的生物对符文龙造成伤害

效果 伴随着符文魔法的爆发，符文龙对触发生物使用爆裂符文能力，若符文未自动引爆则立即将其引爆。

Detonating Rune.name: 爆裂符文 Detonating Rune
Detonating Rune.description: 符文龙的打击与能力可以在目标身上留下一个爆裂符文。如果一个生物在已经拥有一个爆裂符文的情况下将要获得另一个爆裂符文，则不会新增一个符文，而是会激活其当前的爆裂符文，消耗该符文并对目标造成@Damage[4d6[untyped]]伤害。爆裂符文的伤害类型与符文龙当前变幻符文的类型一致。生物可以使用一个交互动作移除该符文。如果爆裂符文没有引爆，则在1分钟后消散。

Rune Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: 青年符文龙施法者 Rune Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)
Rune Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes: 符文龙天生对符文的力量有着深刻的洞察。大多数符文龙的鳞片上刻有各种符文，它们的身体可以魔法般地增强这些符文的力量。符文龙通常不自己施法，而是依靠它们即兴创造符文的能力来产生所需的效果。符文龙常常把自己的财宝称为图书馆，因为它们的财宝中充满了由不同文化的人们使用多种语言写成的重要历史文献、戏剧、演讲、教科书和法术书。尽管它们通常可以借助魔法说某种语言，但它们更喜欢在讲者的语境中学习语言，以便理解其中隐藏的细微差别和符号中的魔力。

Theletos.allSaves: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Envisioning.name: Envisioning
Envisioning.description: When a theletos conveys information, it does so wordlessly through psychic projections. This acts as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.kdhbPaBMK1d1fpbA]{Telepathy} with a range of 100 feet but is understandable to all creatures regardless of whether they have a language. The meaning to non-aeons can be vague and is often mysterious. A theletos can use this ability to communicate flawlessly with any other aeon on the same plane.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Fate Drain.name: Fate Drain
Fate Drain.description:
A creature damaged by the theletos's tentacle must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:22] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}.

As long as the creature is stupefied, it can no longer benefit from fortune effects. If the target fails additional saves against this ability, the condition value increases by 1 (to a maximum of stupefied 4). This condition value decreases by 1 every 24 hours.

Wrath of Fate.name: Wrath of Fate
Wrath of Fate.description:
The theletos releases a @Template[cone|distance:60] of energy from its center. Creatures in the cone become overwhelmed with the knowledge of various fates that destiny has in store for them and lack of clear pathways to these potential futures. They must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:26] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} indefinitely.

An affected creature can choose to roll twice when it attempts an attack, saving throw, or skill check and take the lower result. Regardless of the outcome, that creature is no longer slowed after that roll.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.QSy3KaLI1AYTR7rP]{Effect: Wrath of Fate}

The theletos can't use Wrath of Fate again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Wrath of Fate]]{1d4 rounds}.

Theletos.name: Theletos
Theletos.publicNotes: Theletoses maintain the balance between fate and free will. A theletos is a roughly spherical mass of crystals from which emerge four limbs, each split at the elbow and ending in three-fngered hands. A pair of crystalline tentacles also emerges from its body. Those who have been damaged by a theletos's tentacles describe being presented with a disorienting dilemma: they feel forced to make a single choice while simultaneously being overwhelmed by the endless options available to choose from. Theletoses are more likely than most aeons to interfere in non-aeon societies, particularly in regions with draconian laws. Their involvement is twofold; a theletos concerns itself with both the freedom of individuals and the laws that restrict these individuals, even (or especially) when the two are in opposition.

Unnatural Shriek.name: Unnatural Shriek
Unnatural Shriek.description:
The argorth emits a terrible howl not of the mortal world. Each non-aberration creature within 120 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:30|options:area-effect,inflicts:frightened] save. Regardless of the result, a creature is temporarily immune to the argorth's Unnatural Shriek for 24 hours.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is stupefed 1 for 1 minute and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is stupefed 2 for 1 minute and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}.

Bloodsense.name: Bloodsense
Bloodsense.description: The argorth can detect any creature that has a heartbeat, such as most humanoids, or any creature that's consumed blood within 1 week, such as a vampire.

Death Slam.name: Death Slam
Death Slam.description:
Trigger The argorth is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect Before it's knocked out, the argorth makes a tail Strike against a random creature within reach.

Constrict.name: Constrict
Constrict.description:
The argorth can only Constrict creatures @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by its tail.

@Damage[(2d8+7)[bludgeoning]], @Check[fortitude|dc:27|basic]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Constrict]

Ground Pound.name: Ground Pound
Ground Pound.description: The argorth rears up its massive bulk and slams it downward with incredible force. Each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] takes @Damage[5d8[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:27|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:prone] save). A creature who critically fails this save is also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Argorth.name: Argorth
Argorth.publicNotes:
An argorth is a huge, worm-like creature with three massive spiked mandibles surrounding its gnashing maw. It moves atop a series of hook-shaped bones protruding from its underbelly, supplemented by an occasional push with the back half of its 30-foot length. The mindless, eyeless argorth knows nothing but rage and destruction, making it more like a natural disaster than any known beast of the natural world.

Argorths are the incomprehensible spawn of dibrasgorths. They slough off fully formed from the parent creature's mass of tentacles, though scholars and sages don't know exactly when or why this process occurs. The study of such aberrations is hindered by their incredibly violent nature; not many can escape the fury of an argorth, let alone a molting dibrasgorth. Once birthed, an argorth immediately engages in the wanton destruction of everything around it. Though it has no eyes, both its ability to instinctively sense creatures with pumping blood as well as the thousands of tiny coarse hairs covering its body allowing it to "smell" the air around it ensure that nothing escapes its rampage.

Giant Leech.name: Giant Leech
Giant Leech.publicNotes: Capable of growing to lengths of nearly 5 feet, giant leeches have circular maws filled with hook-like teeth. They prefer to dwell in stagnant or slow-moving shallow water or in damp, moist undergrowth. Horses and larger animals are their favorite prey, but they won't balk at a chance to latch onto a human- or halfling-sized meal.

Blood Drain.name: Blood Drain
Blood Drain.description:
Requirements The giant leech has a living creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

Effect The giant leech drains blood from the creature it has grabbed or restrained. This deals @Damage[2d4[piercing]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:18|basic] save). A creature that takes any damage from having its blood drained by a giant leech is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} until it receives any kind or amount of healing.

Adaptive Strike.name: Adaptive Strike
Adaptive Strike.description:
The naunet chooses adamantine, cold iron, or silver; its melee Strikes count as that type for 1 minute or until it uses Adaptive Strike again.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.361dIAAhiZE0wg8v]{Effect: Adaptive Strike}

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The naunet can take the appearance of any Small, Medium, or Large animal, beast, or humanoid. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes but might change the damage type its Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet
Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet.description: A naunet can anticipate the most likely presence of a creature through a supernatural insight into chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants them the ability to sense creatures within the listed range. Veil of privacy prevents a creature from being detected via entropy sense automatically (without a counteract check).

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Protean Anatomy 10.name: Protean Anatomy 10
Protean Anatomy 10.description:
A protean's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the protean takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first. The protean is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the protean automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.c6SiBB3mzV8lZUQr]{Effect: Protean Anatomy}

Confounding Slam.name: Confounding Slam
Confounding Slam.description: A creature hit by the naunet's tentacle Strike is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} (@Check[will|dc:25] negates). If the creature was already stupefied in this way, the duration extends by 1 round instead.

Naunet.name: Naunet
Naunet.publicNotes:
Pugnacious and powerfully muscled, naunets serve as the scouts and rank-and-file troops of protean armies.

Proteans are manifestations of chaos made flesh, natives of the Maelstrom that embody the primeval potency of entropy in their serpentine forms.
Naunet.allSaves: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Requiem Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).name: 古安魂龙施法者 Requiem Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster)
Requiem Dragon (Ancient, Spellcaster).publicNotes: 安魂龙是灵魂之河（River of Souls）的守护者，负责引导灵魂抵达其在来世的最终归宿。灵魂的安全旅程对安魂龙至关重要，一些安魂龙会从灵魂首次进入灵魂之河开始，直到它们在骨园的审判，最终引导灵魂到达它们最终的安息之地。大多数安魂龙将自己与特定的位面绑定，负责守护所有进入该位面的灵魂，导致这些龙与天堂或地狱等地方相关联，尽管这些龙从不对这些位面宣誓效忠。安魂龙将它们的巢穴建在灵魂之河沿岸——这些巢穴是从其他位面拯救出来的沉重建筑拼接而成——并充满了无价的记录和伟大成就的纪念物。

Soul Journey.name: 灵魂之旅 Soul Journey
Soul Journey.description: 安魂龙花费1小时穿越位面通道进入灵魂之河，然后可以到达灵魂之河的任意位置。这具备@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5bTt2CvYHPvaR7QQ]效果，但安魂龙能够精确到达任何主要位面上的地点。

Status Sight.name: 状态视觉 Status Sight
Status Sight.description: 安魂龙会自动知晓它能看到的所有生物的生命值。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine.name: 对抗神术全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine

Soul Anchor.name: 灵魂锚定 Soul Anchor
Soul Anchor.description:
触发 一个60尺内的生物的生命值将降至0

效果 安魂龙将触发生物的灵魂锚定于其躯体，该生物的生命值保持在1点，陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 2}，并获得与安魂龙等级相等的快速治疗，持续1分钟。该生物在24小时内暂时免疫灵魂锚定效果。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.k8bmDh3nWi2FUyz5]

Withhold Death.name: 阻止死亡 Withhold Death
Withhold Death.description:
触发 安魂龙被一次攻击重击

效果 安魂龙抵抗灵魂的松动，减少部分伤害。安魂针对触发攻击获得20点所有伤害类型的抗力。

Dooming Breath.name: 毁灭吐息 Dooming Breath
Dooming Breath.description: 安魂龙从口中喷出来自创生熔炉的能量，在@Template[type:line|distance:120]范围内造成@Damage[16d8[spirit]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。豁免失败的不死生物还必须成功通过@Check[will|dc:42|options:area-effect,inflicts:doomed]豁免，否则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 1}。如果目标已陷入毁灭，则毁灭值增加1（最多为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 4}）。安魂龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Dooming Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用毁灭吐息。

Redirect River.name: 河流改道 Redirect River
Redirect River.description: 安魂龙利用自己的身体作为连接引导灵魂之河的一部分。河流在安魂龙周围涌动，形成@Template[type:emanation|distance:15]区域的灵性激流，持续1轮，该区域对其他所有生物视为困难地形。此外，在区域内开始回合或每轮首次进入区域的生物必须成功通过@Check[fortitude|dc:42|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:drained,inflicts:doomed]豁免，否则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{力竭 Drained 1}与@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 1}。如果目标已处于流失或毁灭状态，则其状态值增加1（最多为4）。安魂龙可以维持此效果。

Soul Shield.name: 灵魂护盾 Soul Shield
Soul Shield.description:
频率 每日一次

效果 安魂龙利用其生命精华在60尺内的一个生物周围创造出一个精魂能量护盾。此护盾与生物建立了一个连接，效果与@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.d7Lwx6KAs47MtF0q]相似，区别在于该效果不会因距离而中断，并持续1小时。此外，该生物获得对物理和精魂伤害的10点抗力，适用于其所承受伤害的一半。安魂龙可以解消该效果。

Revived Retaliation.name: Revived Retaliation
Revived Retaliation.description:
Trigger The opossum is attacked or disturbed by a creature within reach while Feigning Death

Effect The opossum Strikes the triggering creature.

Grasping Tail.name: Grasping Tail
Grasping Tail.description: A giant opossum can drag a Small or Tiny creature it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} with its tail along with it when it Strides.

+2 Circumstance to All Saves vs. Disease.name: +2 Circumstance to All Saves vs. Disease

Feign Death.name: Feign Death
Feign Death.description:
Trigger The opossum is reduced below 15 HP

Effect The opossum collapses. It is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} and can use actions that require only its mind, but any other action ends the ruse.

A successful @Check[perception|dc:18|traits:action:seek] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} or @Check[medicine|dc:18|traits:action:recall-knowledge] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} is required to determine that the animal is not, in fact, dead.

Giant Opossum.name: Giant Opossum
Giant Opossum.publicNotes:
Larger species of opossum can eat nearly anything human-sized or smaller.

Few creatures have survived as long and in as many environments as the opossum.
Giant Opossum.allSaves: +2 circumstance to all saves vs. disease

Phase Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: 成年相位龙施法者 Phase Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)
Phase Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).publicNotes: 没有任何地方能限制相位龙，甚至没有任何地方能够长时间吸引它们的兴趣；它们与生俱来的奥术联系使它们与传送和移位魔法紧密相连。作为探索者和学者，相位龙随心所欲地四处游荡，探索新的地点和传送的奥秘。它们常在反复造访的遥远之地建立多处巢穴。除了巢穴中常见的财富外，相位龙更倾向于珍藏旅途中具有情感价值的物品——比如当地特有的珍稀花卉，或当地艺术家的创作。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: 对抗奥术的全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Shoo!.name: 走开！ Shoo!
Shoo!.description:
触发 一个15尺内的敌人对相位龙造成伤害

效果 相位龙将该生物传送至最多25尺远的地方。目标位置必须为地面且位于无危害的空间。

Unerring Location.name: 精准定位 Unerring Location
Unerring Location.description: 相位龙自动尝试反制任何以其为目标的传送效果（反制环级7环级，反制调整值[[/r 1d20+25 #Counteract]]{+25}）。相位龙也可以选择正常受到影响。其他被同一效果选为目标的生物会照常受到影响。

Dislocating Breath.name: 错位吐息 Dislocating Breath
Dislocating Breath.description: 相位龙吐出一股将生物撕裂的能量旋涡，在@Template[type:cone|distance:40]范围内造成@Damage[12d6[force]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:33|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。相位龙可以传送任何豁免失败的生物，将其向任意方向传送最多40尺（若大失败则传送距离加倍）。目标位置必须为地面且位于无危害的空间。相位龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Dislocating Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用错位吐息。

Phase Jump.name: 相位跳跃 Phase Jump
Phase Jump.description:
频率 每轮一次

效果 相位龙传送最多75尺。如果它们正在空中飞行，它们将保持动量，这使它即使没有使用飞行动作，在回合结束时也不会坠落。

Portal Strike.name: 传送打击 Portal Strike
Portal Strike.description: 相位龙短暂开启一个小型传送门，对75尺范围内的一个生物进行一次爪抓打击。目标对该打击处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]状态。

Sprint.name: Sprint
Sprint.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The terror shrike Strides three times in a straight line

Stunning Screech.name: Stunning Screech
Stunning Screech.description:
The terror shrike unleashes a haunting screech that causes prey to freeze in fear. Each non–terror bird creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] must attempt a @Check[will|dc:19|options:inflicts:stunned] save. Regardless of the result, creatures are then temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

Sudden Charge.name: Sudden Charge
Sudden Charge.description: The terror shrike Strides twice. If it ends its movement within melee reach of one creature, it can make a melee Strike against that creature.

Tearing Clutch.name: Tearing Clutch
Tearing Clutch.description: The terror shrike's powerful beak can tear through flesh. On a successful beak Strike, the target takes 1 persistent bleed damage. This bleed damage increases to 1d8 on a critical hit.

Scuttle.name: Scuttle
Scuttle.description:
Trigger A creature that the giant crab can see targets the crab with an attack

Effect The giant crab scuttles to the side and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. After the attack resolves, the crab can Stride up to its speed in a straight line as part of the reaction.

Vulnerable to Prone.name: Vulnerable to Prone
Vulnerable to Prone.description: If a creature critically succeeds on a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} the giant crab, the crab is flipped over onto its back in addition to the usual effects. A giant crab that is flipped onto its back has a particularly hard time defending itself; instead of taking the normal -2 circumstance penalty to AC for being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}, it takes a -4 circumstance penalty to AC.

Giant Crab.name: Giant Crab
Giant Crab.publicNotes:
Crabs are scavenging crustaceans known for their hard shells and iconic sideways gait. They use their claws to defend themselves, hunt, and fight other crabs for territory. When confronted with threats from outside their species, most crabs prefer to flee, but when retreat isn't possible, they clamp on to their foes as tightly as they can.

The statistics presented here represent giant crabs that live close to the water's surface. Crabs that live deeper underwater often exhibit more extreme adaptations to their environment. Crabs who live in the depths where little light reaches gain darkvision and cold resistance, and those adapted to the most hostile reaches of the deep sea can detect nearby creatures through subtle shifts in ocean currents.

These skittering creatures are prized for their delicious meat, but their size makes them dangerous targets for harvesting.

Smoke Vision.name: 烟雾视觉 Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: 烟雾不会妨碍灰烬龙的视觉；它能无视由烟雾造成的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]状态。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: 对抗原能的全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Boiling Blood.name: 沸血 Boiling Blood
Boiling Blood.description:
触发 灰烬龙被一次近战攻击重击

效果 灰烬龙的高热之血飞溅至攻击者。该目标受到@Damage[6d6[fire]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic]豁免）。

Reactive Strike (Jaws only).name: 反应打击（仅颚咬） Reactive Strike (Jaws only)

Pyre Breath.name: 烈焰吐息 Pyre Breath
