Pyre Breath.description: 灰烬龙喷吐出一股灼热烈焰，在@Template[type:cone|distance:40]范围内造成@Damage[9d6[fire]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。豁免大失败的生物会着火，受到@Damage[2d6[persistent,fire]]伤害。随后该区域被黑烟笼罩1分钟，效果与薄雾相同，但仅覆盖该锥形区域。灰烬龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Pyre Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用烈焰吐息。

Stoke the Flames.name: 煽燃烈焰 Stoke the Flames
Stoke the Flames.description: 灰烬龙激化周围的火势。所有在60尺范围内并正承受持续火焰伤害的敌人，额外受到@Damage[3d6[fire]]伤害。

Cinder Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: 青年灰烬龙施法者 Cinder Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)
Cinder Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes: 在所有龙类之中，灰烬龙体型最为庞大，亦是最为凶猛的种类之一。它们通常性情暴躁易怒，要求他者给予敬畏——乃至臣服。灰烬龙的外貌正如其体内的烈焰，鳞片上常呈现红、橙、黄交错的火焰纹理。许多灰烬龙居住在活火山或其他同样炽热的地域之中。它们偏爱那些能承受高温的宝藏，因此宝石、黄金与白银常见于其囤积的财宝中。

+2 Status Bonus to Saves vs. Fear.name: +2 Status Bonus to Saves vs. Fear

Deflect Arrow.name: Deflect Arrow
Deflect Arrow.description:
Trigger The doprillu is the target of a physical ranged attack

Requirements The doprillu is aware of the attack, isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against it, and has a hand free

Effect The doprillu gains a +4 circumstance bonus to its AC against the triggering attack.

Mask of Power.name: Mask of Power
Mask of Power.description:
A doprillu's unique wooden mask is the source of its power.

A doprillu deprived of its mask loses its regeneration and its immunity to Enfeebled and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, and it immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}. The Enfeebled value increases by 1 at the start of each of the doprillu's turns, to a maximum of Enfeebled 4. If the mask is put back on, the doprillu immediately regains its abilities and loses the Enfeebled condition.

A creature can pull off the mask with a successful Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SjmKHgI7a5Z9JzBx]{Force Open}.

Volcanic Veins.name: Volcanic Veins
Volcanic Veins.description: Fiery magma runs through the doprillu's veins. A creature that starts its turn @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the doprillu takes @Damage[7d6[fire]] damage.

Whirlwind Throw.name: Whirlwind Throw
Whirlwind Throw.description:
Requirements The doprillu has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The doprillu whirls the grabbed creature about, making a Body Strike against each creature in reach. After that Strike, the doprillu can hurl the grabbed creature up to 50 feet as a ranged Strike. This Strike has the same attack modifier and damage as Body Strike, but has the thrown 20 feet weapon trait.

Doprillu.name: Doprillu
Doprillu.publicNotes: The aberrations known as doprillus are hulks with banded muscles who wear ornate masks at all times that fill their wearers with magical strength and fighting spirit. Doprillus love to battle, especially by grappling, and are eager to start brawls. On neutral ground, a doprillu offers to duel the strongest-looking opponent, but when a doprillu's home turf is invaded, no rules apply to the confrontation. As befits the superheated blood that fuels them, doprillus make their homes in warm locations: hot jungles, sunny deserts, and underground caverns near sulfur vents.
Doprillu.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. fear

Aerial Feint.name: 空中虚招 Aerial Feint
Aerial Feint.description: 空行者选定20尺内的一个生物，并以特技检定对抗目标的察觉DC。成功时，目标在接下来的1轮内对空行者的攻击处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]状态。

Dive Bomb.name: 俯冲轰炸 Dive Bomb
Dive Bomb.description: 枭鬼空行者以直线飞行至多两倍飞行速度，且下降高度不少于10尺，随后进行一次近战打击。

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: 枭鬼空行者的打击对@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]的生物造成额外2d6精准伤害。

Strix Aerialist.name: 枭鬼空行者 Strix Aerialist
Strix Aerialist.publicNotes:
枭鬼空行者是天赋异禀的杂技好手。

枭鬼在自己的语言中被称为"伊塔瑞"（itarii），他们是一种有着鸟类特征的类人生物，生有宽长的黑色羽翼与尖锐的利爪。枭鬼们长有棱角分明的五官，其锐利的双目始终固定向前。

Faithful Weapon.name: Faithful Weapon
Faithful Weapon.description:
dagger, striking rune

A divine warden always wields its patron deity's favored weapon. If the weapon is a ranged weapon, the divine warden automatically generates new ammunition with each attack. For a divine warden of 4th level or higher, the deity's favored weapon gains the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.DxCuJKynlnMQZHgp]{Striking} rune while the divine warden wields it; at 12th level, these effects are of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.KCQRFvUgbyclvOGi]{Greater Striking} rune, and at 19th level, they're instead of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.woxl2FrrgAcJDu0t]{Major Striking} rune.

Instrument of Faith.name: Instrument of Faith
Instrument of Faith.description: The divine warden is a beacon for its deity's faith. A cleric of the divine warden's patron deity can channel a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal} spell through a divine warden they can see within 60 feet. The cleric determines any targets or area for the spell as if they were standing in the divine warden's space.

Divine Destruction.name: Divine Destruction
Divine Destruction.description:
When the divine warden is reduced to 0 HP, it erupts with divine energy in a @Template[emanation|distance:30], dealing @Damage[7d6[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage per level. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21|options:area-effect,damaging-effect] save with the following outcomes.

Critical Success The creature takes half damage.

Success The creature takes full damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and becomes temporarily cursed by the patron deity. The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 day; this is a curse effect that uses the Will save DC as the counteract DC.

Critical Failure As failure, except the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}.

Faith Bound.name: Faith Bound
Faith Bound.description: A divine warden can't attack a creature that openly wears or displays the religious symbol of the divine warden's patron deity unless that creature uses a hostile action against the divine warden first. If the divine warden is intelligent, it can also attack a creature it believes isn't faithful to its deity or who wears the religious symbol as a ruse (typically after succeeding at a Perception check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1xRFPTFtWtGJ9ELw]{Sense Motive}).

Mask of Fate.name: Mask of Fate
Mask of Fate.description:
The divine warden of Pharasma peers at a single creature within 60 feet through the eyes of its mask to alter its destiny. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes a –1 status penalty to the next saving throw it attempts within the next minute against a divine effect from a divine warden of Pharasma or worshipper of Pharasma.

Failure For the next saving throw the target attempts within the next minute against a divine effect from a divine warden of Pharasma or worshipper of Pharasma, it rolls twice and takes the worse result.

Critical Failure As failure, but the misfortune effect applies to all applicable saving throws.

Divine Warden of Pharasma.name: Divine Warden of Pharasma
Divine Warden of Pharasma.publicNotes: This divine warden serves Pharasma, the goddess of birth, death, and fate. It protects a temple or shrine to the Lady of Graves.

Wolf Skeleton.name: 骷髅狼 Wolf Skeleton
Wolf Skeleton.publicNotes:
没有了肉体的负担，骷髅狼以骇人的速度冲越战场。

在亡者的行列中，没有哪种不死有着如骷髅一般无穷的数量与种类。虽然大多数骷髅几乎完全由骨头构成，但少部分还保留着一些肉屑来帮助它们运动，比如翼膜。

Surge of Speed.name: 急速猛冲 Surge of Speed
Surge of Speed.description: 骷髅狼行走3次，但它直到它的下个回合开始前都@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]。

Wrench Spirit.name: 撕扯灵魂 Wrench Spirit
Wrench Spirit.description:
需求 有生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]于骨园鳄犬的颚部

效果 骨园鳄犬将目标从擒获中放开，但在这么做的同时撕扯并拽出对方的灵魂。该生物必须尝试@Check[will|dc:20]豁免。没有灵魂（比如大多数构装体）以及肉体与灵魂同为一体的生物（比如大多数天族、魔族和观察者）在豁免中掷出失败或大失败时能够得到成功的结果作为替代

大成功 目标不受影响

成功 目标陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}

失败 骨园鳄犬用啃咬将目标的灵魂从其体内扯到自己的嘴里。2级或更低等级的无心智不死生物会被摧毁，其他不死生物会在1轮内陷入震慑，所有其他生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]。在其每个回合结束时，被该效果麻痹的生物能尝试1次新的豁免来终止该效果。当骨园鳄犬尝试颚打击或者说话时，该麻痹状态会自动结束

大失败 同失败，但是当生物陷入震慑或麻痹时，还会额外陷入呆滞2

Pounce.name: 猛扑 Pounce
Pounce.description: 骨园鳄犬行走然后作出1次打击。若他在开始该动作之前处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]状态，则打击之后依然维持藏匿状态。

Shepherd's Touch.name: 牧者之触 Shepherd's Touch
Shepherd's Touch.description: 招魂者的打击能如同具有 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]性能符文的效果一般影响虚体生物，对活物造成@Damage[1d6[void]]伤害，对不死生物造成@Damage[1d6[vitality]]伤害。

Esobok.name: 骨园鳄犬 Esobok
Esobok.publicNotes:
骨园鳄犬是野蛮的猎手和好斗的哨兵，他们的职责是骨园（the Boneyard）的看门狗。这些粗矮、强壮的四足生物的独特头部类似于鳄鱼的头骨，在头骨的周围生有一圈黑色羽毛构成的装饰。骨园鳄犬几乎不会打扰那些真正逝去之人，他们会警惕着周遭的危险并让骨园的亡者去做他们应尽之事。尽管骨园鳄犬在追寻骨园的威胁或者面对他们的招魂者训练员时会表现得很狡猾，但他们是招魂者之中智力最低下的存在，除了在咆哮着吼出威胁之时以外几乎不会开口说话。聪明人会在他们警告威胁之时安静聆听，因为这些生物不会重复第二遍。

许多招魂者都与骨园的庞大官僚机构有着密切的联系。 很少人追求仁慈、正义或个人利益；他们对法莱斯玛和骨园的职责是至高无上的。然而，个别招魂者以不同的方式解释他们的职责，这可能使他们与凡人之间发生冲突。

All This Has Happened Before.name: All This Has Happened Before
All This Has Happened Before.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger The samsaran anchorite is about to roll initiative

Effect The anchorite experiences a flash of recognition from a previous existence, gaining a +4 circumstance bonus to the triggering roll.

If this causes the anchorite to be the first creature to act, they also become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round, but they can use the extra action only to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} or Step.

All This Will Happen Again.name: All This Will Happen Again
All This Will Happen Again.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger The samsaran anchorite fails or critically fails a Will save against an emotion effect

Effect Even in the face of overwhelming tribulation, the anchorite finds solace in the notion that all things are merely part of a never-ending cycle.They reroll the saving throw with a +1 status bonus; they must use the second result.

Sling Bullets.name: Sling Bullets
Sling Bullets.description: These are small metal balls, typically either iron or lead, designed to be used as ammunition in slings.

Cryptomnesia.name: Cryptomnesia
Cryptomnesia.description: A samsaran anchorite subconsciously retains bits of knowledge from their innumerable former lives, granting them a +1 circumstance bonus to skill checks that aren't listed in their skills above, and allowing them to attempt all skill actions that normally require the user to be trained.

Samsaran Anchorite.name: Samsaran Anchorite
Samsaran Anchorite.publicNotes:
A unique connection to the cycle of life and death defines the mortal lives of samsarans. With a tendency toward reclusiveness, samsarans have delicate builds, enigmatic and pupilless eyes, and blood as clear as water. When a samsaran dies, their body vanishes and their soul instantly reincarnates into a newborn child elsewhere on the same plane: usually another samsaran, but occasionally a humanoid of a different ancestry.

Though all samsarans have an innate understanding of their nature, they consciously remember little from their former lives. Some, however, are occasionally struck by disjointed memories or flashes of déjà vu linked to a previous existence that can earn them a reputation for preternatural wisdom and insight. Most samsarans prefer to lead studious lives filled with moments of deep reflection. Their sights remain set on the eternal and on enlightenment, reducing the appeal of the short-term material gains one can achieve in just one lifetime. A samsaran ceases their cycle of reincarnation only upon reaching perfect state of enlightenment-or falling so far from harmony that they proceed to a doomed afterlife.

The ancestral home of the samsarans lies in Zi Ha, a remote mountain nation in Tian Xia. These treacherous mountains help ensure the solitude most samsarans prefer, and they're further protected by misguiding illusions, defensive wards, and secure fortifications.

Ninkonda.name: 宁康达 Ninkonda
Ninkonda.publicNotes: 当曾经高尚的凡人堕入邪恶并犯下滔天暴行时，宁康达便会出发追捕他们。宁康达身着胸前镶有一面璀璨明镜的板甲，其上镶嵌着荆棘与钉刺，象征着其代天行狩的猎手身份。然而，宁康达通常并不会立即处决他们的猎物，而是会尽力帮助目标回心转意，并促使他们最终获得救赎。宁康达用它们的镜子映照出目标的罪愆，并展示其灵魂的状态，许多目标在瞥见这幅倒影后便会寻求改变。而那些不为所动者，很快就会发现自己要面对的是天堂猎手那无可言表的强大力量。

Aura of Refection.name: 倒影灵光 Aura of Refection
Aura of Refection.description:
60尺。宁康达的镜子映照出生物灵魂中的弱点。进入或在其回合开始时位于灵光内的生物必须成功通过@Check[will|dc:36]豁免，否则在1轮内会@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]，并且在对抗宁康达能力的意志豁免中承受–2减值。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.BmptyIaMhq7siOqR]

Refect Spell.name: 反射法术 Refect Spell
Refect Spell.description:
触发 宁康达成为一个远程法术攻击的目标

效果 宁康达尝试用其盔甲上的镜子反射该法术。它在对抗触发的攻击时AC获得+4环境加值。若攻击失手，法术将被反射回施法者，施法者必须使用自己的AC进行第二次远程法术攻击检定，以决定法术是否转而击中自己。

Nail Barrage.name: 钉矢弹幕 Nail Barrage
Nail Barrage.description: 宁康达散射出漫天的钉刺，在一个@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]范围内造成@Damage[14d8[piercing]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[Refex|dc:38|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。它在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Nail Barrage]]{1d4轮}内不能再次使用钉矢弹幕。

Soul Reflection.name: 灵魂倒影 Soul Reflection
Soul Reflection.description: 宁康达将其盔甲上的镜面对准一个被其倒影灵光@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]的生物，迫使该生物凝视自己过去的罪愆。该生物必须成功通过@Check[will|dc:38]豁免，否则在反思其行为时获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}，持续1轮（若大失败则持续1分钟，因为其行为持续地压在心头）。一个圣洁生物或道德高尚的生物（由GM决定）在豁免检定中使用比其掷骰结果高一阶的成功度。豁免失败的生物随后在1分钟内对灵魂倒影暂时免疫。

Center of Destiny.name: Center of Destiny
Center of Destiny.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet benefits from a fortune effect

Effect Shadows surround and steal away the destiny tempest, who reappears in an open space adjacent to the triggering creature.

Ebbing Cloud.name: Ebbing Cloud
Ebbing Cloud.description: 15 feet. Destiny tempests surround themselves with thoughts of averted fates, creating a thick metaphysical soup that cloys the mind and clouds ambition. Creatures in the area moving toward the destiny tempest treat the area as difficult terrain.

No Breath.name: No Breath
No Breath.description: Destiny tempests do not need to breathe.

Unspeakable Insights.name: Unspeakable Insights
Unspeakable Insights.description:
Touching a destiny tempest's mind even briefly grants a powerful and painful awareness of uncharted pasts, presents, and futures, too impossibly vast for mortal minds to conceptualize or contain. Whenever a creature targets the destiny tempest with a magical mental effect, it must attempt a @Check[will|dc:33] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and becomes immune to unspeakable insights for 24 hours.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[6d6[mental]] damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round.

Divergent Potential.name: Divergent Potential
Divergent Potential.description: The destiny tempest chooses two creatures it can see within 60 feet and rolls two slithering whisper Strikes, one against each creature. After seeing the outcomes of the two Strikes, the destiny tempest chooses one of the two targets to pursue, Flies up to 60 feet to reach the chosen target, and uses the result of the chosen Strike; the other Strike is lost. If the destiny tempest is prevented from reaching its chosen target, the attack is prevented and the chosen Strike is lost.

Sound Without Voice.name: Sound Without Voice
Sound Without Voice.description: A creature damaged by the destiny tempest's slithering whisper Strike must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:33|basic] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Swiftness.name: Swiftness
Swiftness.description: A destiny tempest's movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Destiny Tempest.name: Destiny Tempest
Destiny Tempest.publicNotes: Before the Jaathoom Empire, the Plane of Air was ruled by destiny tempests from their Reverient Empire of Lost Nights. When the jaathoom armies crushed the Reverient Empire, they trapped the defeated destiny tempests in bronze spheres scattered across the Plane of Air, prisons of time and everlasting nightmare.

Swim the Dead Roads.description: In a process that takes 1 week, a spawning soulrider can travel through channels in the multiverse only it can sense, moving from the Outer Sphere plane whose energy it has absorbed to the Dead Roads that connect the Boneyard to the mortal Universe. From there, it travels to a random place in the Universe that can support life.
Swim the Dead Roads.name: Swim the Dead Roads

Grind Soul.name: Grind Soul
Grind Soul.description:
Requirements The spawning soulrider is attached to a creature's soul

Effect The soulrider grinds the creature's soul with its jagged inner mouth, dealing @Damage[2d8[spirit]] damage (@Check[will|dc:16|basic] save). On a critical failure, the creature also takes @Damage[1d4[persistent,spirit]] damage. Regardless of the result, the spawning soulrider is no longer attached to the creature.

Planar Adaptation (Monitor).name: Planar Adaptation (Monitor)
Planar Adaptation (Monitor).description: A spawning soulrider has traits appropriate to the planar energy it's absorbed: celestial and holy, fiend and unholy, or monitor.

Monitor Escape.name: Monitor Escape
Monitor Escape.description: The soulrider's form blurs as it exploits loopholes in the multiverse. It teleports to an empty space within 60 feet.

Propulsive Launch.name: Propulsive Launch
Propulsive Launch.description: The soulrider Leaps up to 40 feet, then makes a sucker Strike. If it's in the air and not attached to a creature after the Strike, it falls.

Soul Attach.name: Soul Attach
Soul Attach.description: When a soulrider succeeds at a sucker Strike against a target with a soul capable of facing judgment, its sucker attaches it to that soul. While attached, both the soulrider and the host creature are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}, and the soulrider moves with its host until the soulrider dies or the host pulls it loose (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC 16). If the host dies while the soulrider is attached, the soulrider disappears immediately to follow the soul leaving the body. A creature returned to life before reaching its final destination generally returns with any attached soulrider.

Tail Thrash.name: Tail Thrash
Tail Thrash.description:
Requirements The soulrider is attached to a creature's soul

Effect The soulrider makes a tail Strike against the creature whose soul it's attached to, then one against another creature adjacent to the original target. These Strikes count towards the soulrider's multiple attack penalty, but it doesn't increase until after the second attack.

Spawning Soulrider (Monitor).name: Spawning Soulrider (Monitor)
Spawning Soulrider (Monitor).publicNotes:
When soulriders absorb sufficient planar energy, they become gravid with countless tiny eggs. Such soulriders instinctively return to the Universe via the Dead Roads to lay their spawn, although the exact metaphysical process has yet to be fully understood. Fiends and others keen to enter the mortal world have begun capturing and studying spawning soulriders, though such experiments carry their own risks, for soulriders prevented from returning to the Universe will continue to grow larger as they absorb more energy.

Once back in the Universe, spawning soulriders become fiercely protective of their near-translucent eggs and tiny spawn, using their remora-like maws to fend off potential threats. Anyone disturbing a soulrider in the process of spawning might find out what it feels like to have pieces of their soul torn away.

Resembling a lamprey or hagfish with a long whiplike tail, a soulrider uses its harmless sucker to hitch rides on a creature's soul. This seemingly simple connection transcends the physical, attaching directly to the host's soul and even riding along with the soul to its final destination. Once there, a soulrider leaves its host to absorb the surrounding planar energies, adapting to the new environment and growing large enough to produce spawn. However, it can only do so in the mortal Universe, so it must find a portal or other way to return. With this cycle, they've spread to every plane in the Outer Sphere, as well as many mortal worlds.

Although increasingly widespread, soulriders only appeared a little over a century ago. Thought to be a fleshwarper's attempt to cheat Pharasma's judgment by attaching several innocent souls to their own, soulriders' numbers have grown explosively since then.

Soulriders require little more than air to survive, but they're instinctually aware of their need for a mortal soul. Although their suckers are harmless, soulriders who feel threatened or become impatient will finish off their hosts or nearby threats with their tail.

Feast.name: Feast
Feast.description:
Requirements The festrog's last action was a jaws Strike that damaged a living creature

Effect The festrog tears into the creature's flesh and gulps it down voraciously, dealing @Damage[1d4[slashing]] damage to the creature and gaining temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. These temporary HP last for 1 minute.

Diseased Pustules.name: Diseased Pustules
Diseased Pustules.description: Whenever the festrog takes piercing or slashing damage, creatures adjacent to the festrog take @Damage[1d4[poison]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:14|basic] save).

On All Fours.name: On All Fours
On All Fours.description:
Requirements The festrog has nothing in their hands

Effect The festrog Strides with a +10-foot circumstance bonus to their Speed.

Festrog.name: Festrog
Festrog.publicNotes:
Spawned from corpses of those who died of illness or starvation and were twisted by void energy, festrogs display a viciousness that rivals other undead. They resemble decaying humanoids, but with elongated arms, teeth, and bone-like spikes protruding from their upper backs. Festrogs' tendency to run on all fours has led to them gaining the moniker dog-ghouls, causing the unwary to mistake them for mindless predators.

Festrogs are in fact intelligent, stalking victims in packs and choosing hunting grounds that suit their abilities. They can often be found roaming farmlands, open forests, or wide plains, anywhere they can use their quadrupedal speed to overtake quarry. Belying their mindless appearance, festrogs use tactics similar to those of hunters with hounds: the leader of the pack often flushes prey from cover so that the victim can be brought down by the pack.

Researchers of the necromantic processes that create risen corpses have found that festrogs spawn more often from slow demises than sudden deaths. Festrogs typically animate from corpses afflicted with disease, while victims of violence are more likely to become more common undead, such as zombies. One well-documented way to create a festrog is to have scavengers feed on the dead flesh before animating it. This potentially explains why festrogs most often arise in remote areas stricken with famine and desperate predators.

Though most festrogs arise from humans and other prevalent humanoids, other creatures that die in the same circumstances can rise as festrogs. Festrogs that were once larger humanoids, such as ogres, hill giants, or trolls behave similarly to other humanoid festrogs and are simply larger and more powerful. More peculiar are the beastkin festrogs formed of quadrupedal animals, which typically have feet or hooves instead of hands, travel on all fours at all times, and have only animal intelligence. In fact, some humanoid festrogs capture and starve beastkin in hopes of the creatures rising as grotesque festrog pets.

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 相位龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击和一次尾扫打击。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane.name: 对抗奥术的全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Arcane

Shoo!.name: 走开！ Shoo!
Shoo!.description:
触发 一个15尺内的敌人对相位龙造成伤害

效果 相位龙将该生物传送至最多35尺远的地方。目标位置必须为地面且位于无危害的空间。

Unerring Location.name: 精准定位 Unerring Location
Unerring Location.description: 相位龙自动尝试反制任何以其为目标的传送效果（反制环级9环级，反制调整值[[/r 1d20+32 #Counteract]]{+32}）。相位龙也可以选择正常受到影响。其他被同一效果选为目标的生物会照常受到影响。

Blinking Barrage.name: 闪现连击 Blinking Barrage
Blinking Barrage.description: 相位龙将其所有传送技巧集中到一系列令人惊叹的攻击上。相位龙可传送至多60尺到一个邻接某个生物的方格中，并对该生物进行一次爪抓打击。相位龙最多可如此做四次，每次都必须传送到不同的生物旁。每次攻击均计入多重攻击减值，但该减值在所有攻击完成前不会增加。相位龙在下一回合结束前不能再使用带有传送特征的动作。

Dislocating Breath.name: 错位吐息 Dislocating Breath
Dislocating Breath.description: 相位龙吐出一股将生物撕裂的能量旋涡，在@Template[type:cone|distance:50]范围内造成@Damage[17d6[force]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。相位龙可以传送任何豁免失败的生物，将其向任意方向传送最多50尺（若大失败则传送距离加倍）。目标位置必须为地面且位于无危害的空间。相位龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Dislocating Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用错位吐息。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 相位龙的打击重击时，恢复错位吐息的使用次数，或恢复一个已消耗的传送法术。

Phase Jump.name: 相位跳跃 Phase Jump
Phase Jump.description:
频率 每轮一次

效果 相位龙传送最多75尺。如果它们正在空中飞行，它们将保持动量，这使它即使没有使用飞行动作，在回合结束时也不会坠落。

Portal Strike.name: 传送打击 Portal Strike
Portal Strike.description: 相位龙短暂开启一个小型传送门，对90尺范围内的一个生物进行一次爪抓打击。目标对该打击处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]状态。

Phase Dragon (Ancient).name: 古相位龙 Phase Dragon (Ancient)
Phase Dragon (Ancient).publicNotes: 没有任何地方能限制相位龙，甚至没有任何地方能够长时间吸引它们的兴趣；它们与生俱来的奥术联系使它们与传送和移位魔法紧密相连。作为探索者和学者，相位龙随心所欲地四处游荡，探索新的地点和传送的奥秘。它们常在反复造访的遥远之地建立多处巢穴。除了巢穴中常见的财富外，相位龙更倾向于珍藏旅途中具有情感价值的物品——比如当地特有的珍稀花卉，或当地艺术家的创作。

Shade (Plane of Metal).name: 残影（金元素位面） Shade (Plane of Metal)
Shade (Plane of Metal).publicNotes:
金魂灵的外形与其凡人本体相似，却由各种金属（通常是锋利的金属）构成

当凡人死亡时，他们的灵魂将前往外环位面中的骨园（Boneyard），在那里接受死亡女神法莱斯玛的审判。一旦他们受到审判，他们的灵魂就会前往来世接受最终奖赏或惩罚，在这个过程中，他们会变成一种叫做"残影"的生物。这个过程会赋予这些灵魂一个新的身体，其身体的外形由它前往的位面的主要意识形态所塑造。残影的生前记忆几乎被抹去，只留下一些如同梦境般模糊的记忆碎片。无论残影生前的体型、力量或天性如何，他们在来世都是中型生物。

阴魂的存在可能会持续无数纪元，但这种状态并非一成不变的。神祇、浩瀚众界（Great Beyond）的居民、甚至位面本身都可能进一步转变残影的本质，通过将其转变为原始的精粹（quintessence），心魂要素（spiritual essence）被用于扩张位面的物理表征，或被转变为天族、魔族、观察者之类的新形态。如果残影死亡，他们的身体会在类似腐烂的过程中分解，他们的本质会回归至组成位面本身的精粹或元素中。这代表着灵魂之旅的真正终结——它们的生命精华与浩瀚众界的核心融为一体，被回收到创生熔炉中，为新灵魂的诞生提供能量。

Planar Incarnation - Plane of Metal (Met.name: 金元素位面位面塑形（金魂灵） Planar Incarnation - Plane of Metal (Metal Pneuma)
Planar Incarnation - Plane of Metal (Met.description:
所有残影都会被所在的位面塑造形体，并表现出位面的本质。他们的数据有如下调整。他们也可能获得和位面相关的生物特征。

金元素位面Plane of Metal（"金魂灵"Metal Pneuma） 金魂灵的外形与其凡人本体相似，却由各种金属（通常是锋利的金属）构成

  • 语言 金元素语
  • 额外能力 3点电击抗力
  • 近战 爪抓+7（金，多用P），伤害 1d8+2挥砍

Shade (Dreamlands).name: 残影（幻梦境） Shade (Dreamlands)
Shade (Dreamlands).publicNotes:
梦想者呈现出他们生前肉体的理想的外貌、年龄和性别

当凡人死亡时，他们的灵魂将前往外环位面中的骨园（Boneyard），在那里接受死亡女神法莱斯玛的审判。一旦他们受到审判，他们的灵魂就会前往来世接受最终奖赏或惩罚，在这个过程中，他们会变成一种叫做"残影"的生物。这个过程会赋予这些灵魂一个新的身体，其身体的外形由它前往的位面的主要意识形态所塑造。残影的生前记忆几乎被抹去，只留下一些如同梦境般模糊的记忆碎片。无论残影生前的体型、力量或天性如何，他们在来世都是中型生物。

阴魂的存在可能会持续无数纪元，但这种状态并非一成不变的。神祇、浩瀚众界（Great Beyond）的居民、甚至位面本身都可能进一步转变残影的本质，通过将其转变为原始的精粹（quintessence），心魂要素（spiritual essence）被用于扩张位面的物理表征，或被转变为天族、魔族、观察者之类的新形态。如果残影死亡，他们的身体会在类似腐烂的过程中分解，他们的本质会回归至组成位面本身的精粹或元素中。这代表着灵魂之旅的真正终结——它们的生命精华与浩瀚众界的核心融为一体，被回收到创生熔炉中，为新灵魂的诞生提供能量。

+1 Circumstance Bonus on all Saving Thro.name: 全豁免+1环境加值 +1 Circumstance Bonus on all Saving Throws

Planar Incarnation - Dreamlands (The Dre.name: 幻梦境位面塑形（梦想者） Planar Incarnation - Dreamlands (The Dreamers)
Planar Incarnation - Dreamlands (The Dre.description:
所有残影都会被所在的位面塑造形体，并表现出位面的本质。他们的数据有如下调整。他们也可能获得和位面相关的生物特征。

幻梦境 Dimension of Dreams（"梦想者" the Dreamers） 梦想者呈现出他们生前肉体的理想的外貌、年龄和性别

  • 语言 邪灵语
  • 额外能力 所有豁免有+1环境加值
  • 近战 拳击+7，伤害 1d8+2钝击

Temporal Reversion.name: Temporal Reversion
Temporal Reversion.description:
Trigger The bythos fails or critically fails a check

Frequency once per day

Effect The bythos rerolls the triggering check and takes the better result.

Envisioning.name: Envisioning
Envisioning.description:
When a bythos conveys information, it does so wordlessly through psychic projections. This acts as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.kdhbPaBMK1d1fpbA]{Telepathy} with a range of 100 feet but is understandable to all creatures regardless of whether they have a language.

The meaning to non-aeons can be vague and is often mysterious. A bythos can use this ability to communicate flawlessly with any other aeon on the same plane.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Confusing Gaze.name: Confusing Gaze
Confusing Gaze.description: 30 feet. A creature that ends its turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:34] save. If it fails, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round (or [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} on a critical failure).

Aging Strikes.name: Aging Strikes
Aging Strikes.description:
The bythos make two fist Strikes against a single target. If both Strikes hit, the target attempts a @Check[fortitude|dc:37] save. Creatures that don't get weaker with age or don't age are immune (GM's discretion).

If a creature becomes clumsy 4, drained 4, and enfeebled 4 due to Aging Strikes, it dies of old age.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}, or increases each of these conditions by 1. This effect is cumulative with other aging strikes from bythoses, to a maximum of clumsy 4, drained 4, and enfeebled 4.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}, or increases these conditions by 2.

Focused Gaze.name: Focused Gaze
Focused Gaze.description: The bythos focuses its gaze on a creature it can see within 30 feet. The target must attempt a save against the bythos's confusing gaze. A bythos can't use this ability against the same creature more than once per turn.

Temporal Flurry.name: Temporal Flurry
Temporal Flurry.description: The bythos makes four fist Strikes. Its multiple attack penalty increases normally with each attack.

Temporal Strike.name: Temporal Strike
Temporal Strike.description:
The bythos touches a creature or object to displace it from time. The target attempts a @Check[fortitude|dc:37|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success Time flows around the target; the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The target disappears from the present moment and reappears in the same location [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} later as if no time had passed for it. If a creature or object occupies that space when the target returns, the target appears in the closest available space to its original location.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for an extra [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} after it returns.

Bythos.name: Bythos
Bythos.publicNotes: The bythos is a guardian of space and time and ever seeks those who misuse planar and temporal magic. A bythos is a roughly humanoid creature with four arms and a body made of swirling clouds and mist. Despite their appearance, their body feels like dry stone. A bythos seeks out paradoxes caused by irresponsible planar or dimensional travelers and repairs breaches where the barriers between planes have become thin or damaged. If the mortals responsible remain in the area and cannot be convinced to cease their activities, the bythos has no qualms about removing them. Using their ability to manipulate time, a bythos might cause an opponent to quickly die of old age as time speeds up around them or cause a target to disappear from time and space.
Bythos.allSaves: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Wicked Bite.name: Wicked Bite
Wicked Bite.description:
Requirements The urdefhan damaged a creature with a jaws Strike on their last action

Effect The urdefhan maintains contact, turning the creature's flesh translucent around the site of the injury. The target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save or be affected by drain blood or drain vitality (the urdefhan's choice). If the jaws Strike was a critical hit, the creature is affected by both effects, using the same save result for both.

  • Drain Blood The urdefhan drinks some of the creature's blood. On a failed save, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and the urdefhan regains 5 HP (or, on a critical failure, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and the urdefhan regains 10 HP).

  • Drain Vitality The urdefhan draws out some of the creature's vital essence. The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 hour on a failed save (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 hour on a critical failure).

Arrows.name: Arrows
Arrows.description: 这些箭头是弓的弹药。箭杆是木制的。一端是羽毛保持飞行中的平稳，另一端是金属头。

Necrotic Decay.name: Necrotic Decay
Necrotic Decay.description: When an urdefhan dies, their translucent flesh quickly rots away and sublimates into a foul-smelling gas that fills a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] around the body. This gas deals @Damage[3d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage to creatures in this area as their flesh curdles and rots (@Check[fortitude|dc:17|basic] save).

Ravenous Attack.name: Ravenous Attack
Ravenous Attack.description: The urdefhan makes one rhoka sword Strike and one jaws Strike against a single creature. Their multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks.

Urdefhan Warrior.name: Urdefhan Warrior
Urdefhan Warrior.publicNotes:
From the moment they're born, urdefhans are prepared for war. Urdefhan warriors are among the least powerful urdefhans one might encounter outside of their eerie underground cities.

The violent warmongers, occultists, and poisoners known as urdefhans dwell within the Darklands. They were created in eons past by the mysterious First Apocalypse Riders to serve as agents of the end times of the Universe. Urdefhans continue to honor their creators by worshipping the wretched beings who rule over the plane of Abaddon, and like their fiendish lieges, urdefhans exist for one reason and one reason alone: to kill.

While urdefhans are humanoid and dwell together in large groups, this is where their similarities to other ancestries end. Their visages are horrific, with transparent skin and musculature displaying their glistening entrails, gleaming bones, and perhaps worst of all, their baleful red eyes. This appearance, combined with their gaping maws full of sharp fangs, works to create the false impression that urdefhan are some sort of vampiric undead, not creatures of living flesh and blood. When an urdefhan's life comes to an end, their flesh quickly curdles and then bursts in a wave of awful corruption that spreads to the flesh of other creatures in the area. The typical urdefhan views their eventual demise as a disappointment, for once they're dead, their chances to kill will finally come to an end.

An urdefhan's translucent body allows onlookers to see the various organs and fluids within, while their blue blood often signals their mood and telegraphs possible dangers. The blood of an excited urdefhan ready to attack grows more vibrant and even glows with a faint light. When an urdefhan is prepared to meet their death and imminent soul detonation, their blood grows dark, almost black as pitch.

Urdefhans' primary concern is death and how to inflict it in the goriest, most painful, and widespread ways. Beyond this ethos of violence, urdefhans concern themselves only tangentially with matters such as formal modes of warfare or aspects of their damnable religion. When an urdefhan isn't actively engaged in violence, their giddy cruelty is tempered by only a sense of self-preservation that ensures they survive long enough to spread the "blessings" of their daemonic patrons. They pass the time between wars inventing new weapons, developing new diseases, and researching awful new magic, all in preparation for the next inevitable conflict.

Air Wisp.name: Air Wisp

Accord Essence.name: Accord Essence
Accord Essence.description:
Trigger An ally within 30 feet that benefited from the wisp's resonance in the last hour is targeted by an attack

Effect The wisp detonates themself in an elemental explosion. This grants temporary Hit Points equal to half the wisp's current Hit Points to allies within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} who have benefited from the wisp's resonance in the last hour. These temporary Hit Points last 1 hour.

A wisp that uses this reaction is permanently destroyed, and they can be restored by only a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} ritual or similarly powerful effect. If an ability would prevent the wisp's destruction (for instance, if the wisp is summoned and would merely be dismissed), Accord Essence has no effect.

Resonance.name: Resonance
Resonance.description:
30 feet. All wisps vibrate at a frequency attuned to their element, resonating with and empowering all creatures and effects sharing that trait.

A creature in the area gains a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls for effects with the air trait; a creature with the elemental and air traits gains this bonus to all attack and damage rolls.

In Concert.name: In Concert
In Concert.description: When an air wisp rolls a critical failure on a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aid}, they get a failure instead, and when they roll a success, they get a critical success instead.

Air Wisp.publicNotes:
Air wisps are floating spheres of cloud and storm, perpetually humming a light, whispery tone. They're playful and capricious, with great curiosity toward strangers.

Wisps are tiny elemental beings that emerged during the creation of the Elemental Planes. The first wisps roamed the Inner Sphere in shifting symphonies that traded members with their every meeting. These symphonies of free wisps created music out of their combined resonances, but when the wicked Elemental Lords realized the value of the wisps' resonance, they captured whole symphonies for use as servants.

Wisps attune to each other and to those they surround themselves with. This attunement makes them naturally supportive allies. Free wisps still roam the Inner Sphere and the Universe, but they're usually shy and hide themselves from strangers. However, they happily offer their service to those who show them kindness. They especially find themselves drawn to spellcasters who practice elemental magic; these wisps usually watch from afar but sometimes approach those who seem safe to become familiars or comrades.

Free wisps who find one another become close almost immediately. They get especially excited when they find wisps of elements other than their own, showing none of the animosity sometimes exhibited between elementals of different planes. Instead, they join in an excited dance, emitting resonances that faintly echo the symphonies of ancient days.

Burning Rush.name: Burning Rush
Burning Rush.description: The striding fire stretches out its legs to an impossible length, propelling it forward. The striding fire Strides up to double its Speed in a straight line. Its movement during this Stride doesn't trigger reactions. Any creature the striding fire was adjacent to at any point during this Stride must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:24|basic] save. If it critically fails, it's knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} by a wave of heated air. The striding fire can't use Burning Rush for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: The striding fire ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

Striding Fire.name: Striding Fire
Striding Fire.publicNotes:
An embodiment of the speed and chaos of a spreading blaze, a striding fire appears as a lithe and long-limbed humanoid composed of shifting-hued flames churning around a skeleton-like framework.

Destructive manifestations of the Plane of Fire, fire elementals sometimes incorporate burning materials into their being or superheated matter, such as molten rock or searing smoke. In combat, they tend to be aggressive and somewhat reckless. Their attacks can sometimes cause major destruction to the surrounding environment, and many fire elementals seem to enjoy seeing their flames spread far and wide.

Distracting Whisper.name: 干扰低语 Distracting Whisper
Distracting Whisper.description:
触发 低语龙成为攻击的目标

效果 一个神秘的声音在触发生物耳边低语，使触发攻击受到-2环境减值。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.qsvSWxRqVQofjDdH]

Cogitation Breath.name: 凝思吐息 Cogitation Breath
Cogitation Breath.description: 低语龙释放出一股迷惑性毒雾，在@Template[type:cone|distance:40]范围内造成@Damage[10d6[mental]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[will|dc:30|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:stupefied]豁免）。豁免失败的生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}（大失败则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}），持续1分钟。低语龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Cogitation Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用凝思吐息。

Steal Knowledge.name: 窃取知识 Steal Knowledge
Steal Knowledge.description:
低语龙从60尺内一个生物的意识中摘取知识片段，选择一个技能作为影响目标。该生物必须进行@Check[will|dc:28]豁免。

成功 该生物不受影响。

失败 在接下来的1分钟内，该生物使用该技能的检定时承受-1状态减值，而低语龙在使用该技能的检定中获得+1状态加值。

大失败 同失败，但减值为-2，加值为+2。

Unveil Secret.name: 揭开秘密 Unveil Secret
Unveil Secret.description: 低语龙探知60尺内一个生物的思维，搜寻其秘密，除非目标通过@Check[will|dc:30]豁免，否则低语龙会知晓一个该生物会觉得尴尬或羞耻的事情。目标陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}，且在1分钟内或在低语龙揭露秘密前无法降低惊惧状态。当受影响生物尝试检定时，低语龙可用一个反应动作揭露其秘密使其难堪，迫使该生物投掷两次并取较差结果；这是一个厄运效果。

+2 to Sense Motive.name: 察言观色时+2 +2 to Sense Motive

Information Network.name: 信息网络 Information Network
Information Network.description: 低语龙可以尝试一个社群检定来@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]以代替搜集信息检定，从先前的线人处回忆情报。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult.name: 对抗异能的全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

Diplomatic Solution.name: 外交解决 Diplomatic Solution
Diplomatic Solution.description:
触发 低语龙进行先攻检定

效果 低语龙将其视线内60尺范围内的所有敌人作为目标，施放环级等于低语龙等级一半（向上取整）的安定心神（@Check[will|dc:28]豁免）。低语龙无需维持此效果，但如果低语龙对受到影响的生物采取任何敌对行动，则对所有生物终止该效果。

Whisper Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).name: 成年低语龙施法者 Whisper Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster)
Whisper Dragon (Adult, Spellcaster).publicNotes: 低语龙是敏锐的谣言和秘密收藏家，花费几个世纪来磨练他们的信息网络和人际关系。它们这样做通常并非出于想要控制他人或利用这些信息来进行阴谋，而仅仅是因为学习和收集信息的过程本身就是一种满足。与其他龙的财宝相比，它们的巢穴较为简陋，因为它们真正的财富——秘密——都藏在它们的脑海中。

Compel Condemned.name: 致命诱惑 Compel Condemned
Compel Condemned.description:
卡崔娜迎魂使通过心灵感应强迫30尺内的生物靠近并让卡崔娜迎魂使亲吻他们，以准备使用死亡之吻。 目标必须尝试@Check[will|dc:22]豁免。

成功 该生物不受影响，并且在 24 小时内暂时免疫致命诱惑。

失败 该生物必须用它的每一个动作尽可能快地靠近卡崔娜迎魂使，同时避免明显的危险。 如果被强迫的生物与卡崔娜迎魂使相邻，它会保持停止并且不行动。 如果该生物受到任何伤害，则该效果结束并且该生物在24小时内暂时免疫致命诱惑。 此效果持续1轮，但如果卡崔娜迎魂使在随后的几轮中再次使用此能力，它会将所有受影响的生物的持续时间延长1轮。

大失败 如同失败，但伤害不会结束效果。

Kiss of Death.name: 死亡之吻 Kiss of Death
Kiss of Death.description: 卡崔娜迎魂使给一个@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]或自愿的生物一个长而热情的吻，造成@Damage[3d6[void]]伤害。 任何被同一位卡崔娜迎魂使的死亡之吻连续3轮伤害的生物都会失去意识并陷入濒死1。

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Calming Presence.name: 镇静灵气 Calming Presence
Calming Presence.description:
30尺。在该区域内开始其回合的生物必须尝试进行@Check[will|dc:18]豁免。

大成功 该生物不受影响，并且在24小时内暂时免疫镇静灵气。

成功 该生物的攻击骰承受-1状态减值，持续1轮。

失败 任何会影响该生物的情绪效果都会被抑制，该生物不能使用敌对行动。 如果该生物受到任何其他生物的敌意，它将不再受到镇静灵气的影响，并在24小时内暂时免疫镇静灵气。

大失败 如同失败，但敌对动作并不会结束效果。

Shepherd's Touch.name: 牧者之触 Shepherd's Touch
Shepherd's Touch.description: 卡崔娜迎魂使的打击能如同具有@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]性能符文的效果一般影响虚体生物，对活物造成@Damage[1d6[void]]伤害，对不死生物造成@Damage[1d6[vitality]]伤害。

Catrina.name: 卡崔娜迎魂使 Catrina
Catrina.publicNotes:
并非所有进入骨园的灵魂都意识到他们已经死亡。卡崔娜迎魂使会见这些灵魂，并帮助说服他们相信自己命运的终结，以减轻灵魂的逝去。当凡人不能接受自己的死亡时，卡崔娜迎魂使更有可能进行干预。他们执行任务是为了保持来世的平静，而不是出于对凡人悲痛的真正同情。卡崔娜迎魂使很少访问物质宇宙，除非是为了帮助一个极其重要的凡人离世。

卡崔娜迎魂使像骷髅，穿着鲜豔的花朵和五颜六色的衣服，给他们一个既喜庆又可怕的外表。虽然大多数卡崔娜迎魂使以女性形像出现，但男性卡崔娜迎魂使也会穿着鲜豔的颜色，带着花环。

许多招魂者都与骨园的庞大官僚机构有着密切的联系。 很少人追求仁慈、正义或个人利益；他们对法莱斯玛和骨园的职责是至高无上的。然而，个别招魂者以不同的方式解释他们的职责，这可能使他们与凡人之间发生冲突。
Catrina.allSaves: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Venator.name: Venator
Venator.publicNotes:
Unlike most aeons, venators spend much of their time in the mortal Universe. Axiomites build these fgures of brass and gears to hunt their enemies. Although capable combatants on their own, venators frequently act as trackers for other aeons, leading a group of vigilias to secure a criminal or guiding a bythos to its targets.

Each venator is forged with its targets already assigned, a scrap of axiomite formula integrated in the gears that whir beneath their armor. The targets are narrowly defned by the formula and are usually a single named target, a family, or a small group that directly participated in an event.

A venator's targets rarely threaten the balance of reality overtly; instead, they're often privy to certain secrets or new magical theories.

As a result, even the venator rarely knows why it has been assigned a given target. Recently forged venators are incredibly thorough in their work, methodically destroying the body of their target and any nearby objects (like notes, books, or even graffti) that might contain secrets.

Successful venators are left without targets and are abandoned to their own devices. They're generally eager to fnd a new purpose, even if it's a temporary one from a mortal summoning. Many eventually extend their original missions, choosing new targets similar to their previous ones or, in some cases, continuing to chase the souls of their original targets.

Bolts.name: Bolts
Bolts.description: 比传统箭短，但结构相似，矢是弩使用的弹药。

Locate Target.name: Locate Target
Locate Target.description: A venator is assigned an individual target or small group of targets when they are created. The venator can sense the direction of their nearest target while on the same plane as it. If there are none, they can sense the plane where most of their targets can be found.

Discharging Bolt.name: Discharging Bolt
Discharging Bolt.description: When the venator damages a creature with their crossbow, the bolt embeds in the target, dealing @Damage[2d6[persistent,electricity]] damage. The creature can remove the bolt and end the persistent damage with an Interact action but takes @Damage[1d6[electricity]] damage as part of removing the bolt.

Mark Target.name: Mark Target
Mark Target.description:
The venator releases a ball of light at a target within 60 feet, lighting it up with a magical aura that's constantly visible to the venator. The target can avoid becoming marked with a successful @Check[Refex|dc:30] save. While marked, the target fnds it difcult to deal with the venator and their allies. The target takes a –1 status penalty to all attacks against the venator and other aeons, as well as to saving throws against efects from the venator and other aeons. The venator can Sustain this efect to designate up to 5 other creatures as trusted allies, causing the target to take the same penalties against these allies. The venator can Dismiss the mark. Otherwise, it fades away naturally after 1 day.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.2TlbtDHEGcFG8NPF]{Effect: Venator's Mark}

Overloaded Arc.name: Overloaded Arc
Overloaded Arc.description: The venator releases lightning from their body in a @Template[type:line|distance:120], dealing @Damage[4d10[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[Refex|dc:33|basic] save). The lightning also arcs, damaging any creature embedded with a venator's bolt within 120 feet even if it isn't in the line. The venator is then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Furious Claws.name: Furious Claws
Furious Claws.description: The gug makes up to four claw Strikes, each against a different target. These attacks all count toward the gug's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after the gug makes all its attacks.

Eerie Flexibility.name: Eerie Flexibility
Eerie Flexibility.description: Despite its size, the gug's multiple joints allow it to fit through tight spaces as if it were a Medium creature. While @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeezing}, it can move at its full Speed.

Gug.name: Gug
Gug.publicNotes:
A gug's most horrid feature is its barrel-shaped head, which splits vertically to reveal numerous rows of sharp, yellow teeth and an open throat. Its eyes on either side of its head-jaw are small but keen. Bony ridges protect its eyes from the frantic flailing of its prey, as it prefers meals of raw and writhing meat over fungi and molds. It grips said prey with powerful arms that split at the elbow into a pair of forearms, giving it four clawed paws. These monstrous brutes are covered with shaggy black fur, often crusted with blood and gore.

Although gugs may seem bestial, they have keen and wicked intellects. Gugs lair far underground, but they sometimes come to the surface to hunt during dark nights, either alone or in small groups. As they possess voracious appetites, most gugs consume the creatures they catch, but some instead kidnap their victims and retreat below the surface, leaving only a lingering stench and odd, clawed paw-prints. Victims are taken to rancid lairs marked with strange runes and sacrificed to the gugs' wicked gods of blood, darkness, and nightmares. Dire rumors tell of lightless gug cities made of titanic blocks of stone far underground, where powerful gug leaders preach their vile doctrines to mobs of howling gugs.

Gugs have a strange relationship with ghouls, which seems to date from their shared origin in a distant subterranean world. Gugs live in fear of ghouls, despite towering over them; however, this strange fear doesn't apply to ghasts, whom gugs consume as voraciously as they do other creatures.

Gugs stand 16 feet tall and weigh 2,000 pounds, although they have an eerie, graceful gait that belies their immense size. Their light step and ability to squeeze through very small crannies makes gugs common bogeymen in tales of strange disappearances or bloody massacres.

Some particularly bloodthirsty gugs gain awful powers as gifts from their eldritch patrons. These monsters are known as savants, are never less than 12th level in power, and gain several occult innate spells. Though each savant's precise mix of spells varies, normally, these spells grant invisibility, offer power to manipulate and change rock, or invoke awful and destructive energies upon living flesh.

Weapon Master.name: 武器大师 Weapon Master
Weapon Master.description: 死墓骑士神卫无论持用何种武器，均可以使用该武器的重击专精效果。

Arrows.name: 箭矢 Arrows
Arrows.description: 这些箭头是弓的弹药。箭杆是木制的。一端是羽毛保持飞行中的平稳，另一端是金属头。

Clutching Armor.name: 缠结护甲 Clutching Armor
Clutching Armor.description:
触发 一个生物尝试远离死墓骑士

效果 死墓骑士的护甲活化并尝试擒获触发的生物。它进行一次用于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]的运动检定，使用死墓骑士的运动加值-2作为调整值。

护甲可以如常继续擒拿该生物。因为是护甲在抓着该生物，所以死墓骑士不需要空出一只手来使用此能力。

Channel Magic.name: 引导魔法 Channel Magic
Channel Magic.description: 死墓骑士将魔法能量重定向至它的护甲（盔甲），让它能够通过攻击传递魔法。死墓骑士施放一个花费1-2个动作、并需要一个法术攻击调整值的法术。这个法术的效果不会立即显现，而是被灌注到了一次攻击中。接着，死墓骑士进行一次武器或无武装的近战打击。那个法术与攻击相结合，使用攻击骰的结果来同时决定打击和法术的效果。在计算死墓骑士的多重攻击减值时，本能力算作两次攻击，但在此能力结算前减值不会应用。死墓骑士在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Channel Magic]]{1d4轮}内无法使用本能力。

Devastating Blast.name: 毁灭爆震 Devastating Blast
Devastating Blast.description:
死墓骑士神卫释放出@Template[cone|distance:30]能量。区域内的生物受到@Damage[9d12[fire]|options:area-damage]伤害，@Check[reflex|dc:36|basic|options:area-effect]豁免。

死墓骑士神卫在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Devastating Blast]]{1d4轮}内无法使用此能力。

Graveknight's Curse.name: 死墓骑士诅咒 Graveknight's Curse
Graveknight's Curse.description:
诅咒会影响任何穿戴死墓骑士护甲超过1小时以上的生物。

豁免骰 @Check[will|dc:40]

潜伏期 1小时

阶段1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 1}且无法脱下盔甲（1天）

阶段2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 2}，速度承受-10尺状态减值，且无法脱下盔甲（1天）

阶段3 死亡并转化为盔甲的死墓骑士

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.6rnB7nK6J6zF4vea]

Ruinous Weapons.name: 破灭武器 Ruinous Weapons
Ruinous Weapons.description: 死墓骑士神卫所持用的任意武器或无武装攻击均获得+1高等强击和高等炽焰武器符文的效果。

Graveknight Champion.name: 死墓骑士神卫 Graveknight Champion
Graveknight Champion.publicNotes:
曾经是一位神祇的仆人，在他那为神明服务的生命被斩断后，死墓骑士神卫以不死之躯归来。

当一位可畏的斗士战死沙场，其一心复仇的魂魄有时会和他的护甲融合，创造出一名死墓骑士。

Stench.name: Stench
Stench.description:
30 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for as long as itʼs sickened on a critical failure).

While within the aura, affected creatures take a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.wX9L6fbqVMLP05hn]{Effect: Stench}

Poison Breath.name: Poison Breath
Poison Breath.description:
The catoblepas breathes a @Template[cone|distance:60] of horrid fumes, dealing @Damage[13d6[poison]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:32|basic|options:area-effect] save). The area of this cone is reduced to @Template[cone|distance:30]{30 feet} underwater. Targets that fail their saving throw also become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

The catoblepas can't use its Poison Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

Catoblepas.name: Catoblepas
Catoblepas.publicNotes:
The catoblepas is an aggressive beast at the best of times. Though it prefers swamps, the catoblepas has been know to forage in plains and forests for short periods, leaving behind hunting grounds tainted by its foul breath and noxious waste that other predators and prey alike avoid for days or even weeks thereafter. The catoblepas bullies those creatures it believes are a match for it, and eats everything weaker.

A catoblepas is 15 feet long and weighs 2,200 pounds.

Nosferatu Vulnerabilities.name: Nosferatu Vulnerabilities
Nosferatu Vulnerabilities.description:
• Revulsion A nosferatu can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of brandished garlic or a brandished religious symbol of a deity with a holy sanctification option. To brandish garlic or a religious symbol, a creature must Interact to do so for 1 round (similar to Raising a Shield). If the nosferatu involuntarily comes within 10 feet of an object of their revulsion, they gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition, running from the object of their revulsion until they end an action beyond 10 feet. After 1 round of being exposed to the subject of their revulsion, a nosferatu can attempt a @Check[will|dc:25|traits:concentrate] save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, they overcome their revulsions for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Stake A magical wooden stake (such as one affected by a weapon potency rune, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.TFitdEOpQC4SzKQQ]{Runic Weapon}, or similar magic) driven through the nosferatu's heart drops the nosferatu to 0 HP and prevents them from healing above 0 HP, even in their coffin. Staking a nosferatu requires 3 actions and works only if the nosferatu is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If the stake is removed, the nosferatu can heal above 0 HP again, and if they're in their coffin, the 1-hour rest period begins once the stake is removed. If the nosferatu's head is severed and anointed with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.z9T4c1hXwOotsMCp]{Holy Water} while the stake is in place, the nosferatu is destroyed.

  • Sunlight If exposed to direct sunlight, a nosferatu immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the nosferatu ends their turn in sunlight, and the condition ends when they're no longer in sunlight. If the nosferatu loses all their actions in this way, they're destroyed.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The nosferatu transforms into a swarm of pale-gray rats. They gain a land Speed of 30 feet and a climb Speed of 10 feet, and they become Large. In this swarm form, the nosferatu can take an action to deal each enemy in the swarm's space @Damage[2d10[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|basic|dc:29|options:area-effect] save. A creature that fails its save is also exposed to plague of ancients.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Command Thrall.name: Command Thrall
Command Thrall.description:
Requirements One of the nosferatu's thralls is present and can hear the nosferatu

Effect The nosferatu gives a single command to one of their thralls, which the thrall follows to the best of its ability during its next turn.

Dominate.name: Dominate
Dominate.description: The nosferatu can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} at will as a divine innate spell. Casting it requires staring into the target's eyes, giving the spell the visual trait. The save DC uses a high DC for the nosferatu's level, and a creature that succeeds is temporarily immune to that nosferatu's Dominate for 24 hours. Fully destroying the nosferatu ends the domination, but merely reducing the nosferatu to 0 HP is insufficient to break the spell.

Drink Blood.name: Drink Blood
Drink Blood.description:
Requirements The nosferatu's last action was a successful fangs Strike

Effect The nosferatu sinks their fangs into the targeted creature to drink its blood. This requires an @Check[athletics|against:fortitude] check against the creature's Fortitude DC. On a success, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}, and the nosferatu regains @Damage[13[healing]]{13 HP}, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the nosferatu but increases the creature's drained condition value by 1, killing the victim when it reaches @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 5}. A nosferatu can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but they gain no HP from doing so.

The target creature's drained condition value decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a successful @Check[medicine|dc:20] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drained value by 1 after 10 minutes.

Plague of Ancients.name: Plague of Ancients
Plague of Ancients.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:29]

Onset 1 day

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} (1 day)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2}, drained 3, and enfeebled 3 (1 day)

Stage 5 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} (1 day)

Stage 6 death

Plagued Coffin Restoration.name: Plagued Coffin Restoration
Plagued Coffin Restoration.description: Unlike other undead, a nosferatu isn't destroyed at 0 HP. Instead, they disperse into an immense number of rats heading in every direction in an attempt to return to their coffin. If even a single rat reaches the coffin, the nosferatu can recover. A nosferatu regains their strength through resting in earth taken from the grave of a creature that died of plague. If their body rests in their earth-filled coffin for 1 hour, the nosferatu gains 1 HP, after which their fast healing begins to function normally. If the coffin doesn't contain this plagued grave dirt, they instead need to rest in their coffin for 1 day before they gain 1 HP and regain their fast healing.

Nosferatu Malefactor.name: Nosferatu Malefactor
Nosferatu Malefactor.publicNotes:
Nosferatu malefactors spread plague in their wake and yearn for mortal blood.

Nosferatus are ancient vampires born of mortals who died in great plagues of old. Perhaps because of their old age, nosferatus can't create more of their kind.

Viper Vine.name: 蝰蛇藤 Viper Vine
Viper Vine.publicNotes:
蝰蛇藤是一种贪婪的食肉植物，在它从浓密的、多叶的蛇形藤蔓中有一朵巨大的花从中间伸出来。当这种植物通过它敏感的、浅埋的根系察觉到合适的猎物靠近时，它会像一条激动的蛇一样弓起身子，展开色彩鲜艳的花朵，释放出一团使头脑麻木的花粉。

由于蝰蛇藤并非依靠光合作用与土壤吸收养分，而是通过吞噬生物来获取营养，它们逐渐演化出了初级的行动能力，能够用触须状的根系在地面拖行前进。它们甚至具备一种初级智能，既能辨别猎物的差异，也能作出有限的战术决策，同时还会避开那些体型特别庞大或看起来格外危险的生物。

蝰蛇藤的猎场周围经常散落着被部分吞噬的受害者的遗体。野生动物腐烂的尸体、命运多舛的冒险者、甚至在附近的巨人都很常见，尸体上还零星存有一些偶然留下的宝藏。蝰蛇很少会把注意力放在它之前杀死的动物的尸体上，而更喜欢猎取新鲜的肉。

Tremorsense 60 feet.name: 震颤感知（模糊） 60尺 Tremorsense 60 feet

Cold Vulnerability.name: 寒冷弱点 Cold Vulnerability
Cold Vulnerability.description: 当暴露于寒冷效果时，蝰蛇藤会变得行动迟缓，陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}，持续[[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮}。

Captivating Pollen.name: 迷人花粉 Captivating Pollen
Captivating Pollen.description:
蝰蛇藤向@Template[type:emanation|distance:60]范围播撒@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]的花粉，漂浮在四周的空气中，持续5轮，只有中等或更强的风力才能吹散。进入范围或在范围内开始回合的每个生物都必须通过@Check[will|dc:33]豁免，否则被迷住。蝰蛇藤在[[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用迷人花粉。

大成功 生物不受影响，并且在24小时内对迷人花粉临时免疫。

成功 生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}。

失败 生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]，并且它必须花费每一个动作去靠近蝰蛇藤，并且在这个过程中避开显而易见的危险。如果被迷住的生物和蝰蛇藤相邻，它会站在原地，并且不会做出任何动作。如果它在回合结束时不再位于花粉范围内，它的迷魂状态会终止。

大失败 类似失败，但生物还会陷入24小时的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}。

Bonded Vessel.name: Bonded Vessel
Bonded Vessel.description: The condition of a stone cub's vessel dictates the cub's maximum Hit Point value. Undamaged, the vessel is an object with 28 Hit Points (BT 14). When the cub is in spirit form, damaging it doesn't hurt the vessel, but damaging the vessel deals an equal amount of damage to the cub. When the cub Inhabits its Vessel, they're a single target, and damage reduces the Hit Points of both the cub and the vessel. If the vessel is broken, the cub can still fight normally while inhabiting it and suffers no ill effect, but if the vessel is ever destroyed, the cub is instantly slain and can't reconstitute.

Anchored Soul.name: Anchored Soul
Anchored Soul.description: The cub is mystically bonded to its bonded vessel and must remain within 1 mile of it. Some might be further restricted to the location it guards.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Unholy.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Unholy

Reconstitution.name: Reconstitution
Reconstitution.description: When the cub reaches 0 Hit Points, its spirit dissipates. If its bonded vessel is intact, the cub re-forms in this vessel after [[/gmr 2d4 #Reconstitution]]{2d4 days}, fully healed. If the vessel is broken, it must first be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.bT3skovyLUtP22ME]{Repaired}, after which the cub reforms in [[/gmr 3d4 #Reconstitution]]{3d4 days}.

Inhabit Vessel.name: Inhabit Vessel
Inhabit Vessel.description:
The cub touches and melds with its bonded vessel, bringing the statue to life. It can cease Inhabiting its Vessel by spending a single action, which has the concentrate trait. While Inhabiting the Vessel, it loses its fly Speed and gains:

Immunities healing, nonlethal

Resistances physical 3 (except bludgeoning)

Speed 20 feet; and the following Strike.

  • Melee A Jaws +10 (agile), Damage 1d6+5 bludgeoning plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]{Grab}.

Spirit Body.name: Spirit Body
Spirit Body.description: When not Inhabiting its Vessel, the cub is incorporeal and gains resistance 3 to all damage (except force damage and damage from Strikes with the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Ghost Touch} property rune; double resistance against non-magical).

Stone Lion Cub.name: Stone Lion Cub
Stone Lion Cub.publicNotes:
Stone lion cubs are curious, playful, and occasionally accidental mischief makers. Despite their still developing abilities, they eagerly hone their skills with make-believe missions. Many hope that they'll one day become responsible guardians like their parents.

Smaller in stature and ferocity, stone lion cubs sometimes try to guard places of smaller importance, often including facsimiles of the same kinds of structures their parents attend. They're less than dependable as guardians, as they have the attention span and rambunctious nature of children. Their parents often need to call them to heel, ordering them to stay at the parent's side as parent and child both stay motionless for the rising day.

Stone statues of beasts can often be found paired and standing guard to either side of an entryway. While some seem like merely lifeless statues, others are far more than they appear to be. Guardian beasts ward against evil and misfortune. Some of these celestial spirits were assigned this task, while others assumed their roles out of a sense of duty. To allow them to maintain a constant presence in the material world, pious artisans carve stone vessels of the beasts in their likeness; these statues then serve as anchors for the guardian beasts' souls. Should the need arise, guardian beasts can merge with their stony form, becoming a dangerous foe with noble courage, an indomitable will, and few weaknesses.

By day, guardian beasts stay in their vessels and pretend to be inanimate. Past nightfall, they might patrol the grounds in their stone form or leave the heavy vessel behind to go where a solid body can't reach. Some take this chance to visit the dreams of individuals they favor and send them messages, notifying them of strange occurrences or warning them of incoming danger. Despite their good intentions, the dream messages from guardian beasts can be obscure, often overshadowed by the spirit's personality or strange assumptions they make due to their nature as resolute guardians.

While guardian beasts can work alone, they usually appear in bonded pairs who complement each other in nature. One could be a jokester, the other gloomy; another could be nurturing, the other strict. To make two otherwise identical-looking beasts distinct, sculptors often depict one stone animal with their young. In the case of stone lions, a common type of guardian beasts, this approach means carving stone lion cubs to accompany one of the guardians.
Stone Lion Cub.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. evil

Indomitable Oration.description: Any creature capable of comprehending speech understands the deimavigga, as if they constantly spoke in all languages at once.
Indomitable Oration.name: Indomitable Oration

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The deimavigga can take on the appearance of any humanoid. This doesn't change their Speed or attack and damage bonuses with Strikes but might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

+4 Bonus on Perception to Sense motive.name: +4 Bonus on Perception to Sense motive

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Whispers of Discord.name: Whispers of Discord
Whispers of Discord.description:
Trigger A creature within 60 feet is targeted by a spell that would restore Hit Points or provide a status bonus (the deimavigga automatically recognizes such effects)

Effect The deimavigga whispers disturbing lies, audible only to the target, to shake the target's faith in the spell's caster. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:38] save.

Critical Success The target disbelieves the lies and receives the intended benefit of the spell; the target becomes temporarily immune to Whispers of Discord for 24 hours.

Success As critical success, but the target isn't temporarily immune.

Failure The spell fails to affect the target. The target refuses all aid from that caster for 1 round and doesn't count as the caster's ally.

Critical Failure As failure, but the duration is 1 minute.

Boundless Reach.name: Boundless Reach
Boundless Reach.description: A deimavigga's razor-sharp claws can slice through reality, allowing them to make claw Strikes and use spells with a range of touch against any creature they can see directly or via magic. A creature targeted in this way can retaliate until the start of the deimavigga's next turn; it can target the devil's claws as if the devil were physically present and adjacent to the target, though the claws are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}.

Whisper Earworm.name: Whisper Earworm
Whisper Earworm.description:
The deimavigga whispers a terrifying multiversal truth to one adjacent creature, shaking its faith in reality and divinity. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:38] save. Celestials and fiends gain a +2 status bonus to this save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and temporarily immune to Whisper Earworm for 24 hours.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The next time the target rests, it ruminates on the deimavigga's words instead of sleeping or otherwise resting and awakens @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}. The target also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} until it's no longer fatigued.

Critical Failure As failure, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}. After this rest, the target must attempt another @Check[will|dc:38] save. On a failure, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} and takes a –4 status penalty to Will saves against effects from unholy creatures. These effects last until the target unlearns the truth spoken by the deimavigga, requiring a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.FhOaQDTSnsY7tiam]{Rewrite Memory} spell, other means of modifying their memory, or powerful magic such as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} ritual.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.bzwFaDNBYsGpC4ed]{Effect: Whisper Earworm (Critical Failure)}

Deimavigga.name: Deimavigga
Deimavigga.publicNotes:
As masters of cold, calculated logic and perfectly timed proselytization, the loathsome deimaviggas seek to set friend against friend and turn the faithful from their beliefs at every opportunity. Their most common tools are mortal ego and despair. Those who are high-ranking or ambitious among their faith are lured toward self-aggrandizement until they see themselves first and their deity and clergy second. Those prone to doubt or heartache are isolated, as the deimavigga disrupts their divine spells and weakens their faith.

There are countless legions of lawful fiends in the nine layers of Hell, warring against the celestial planes and scouring the Material Plane for souls to corrupt.
Deimavigga.allSaves: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值

Leprechaun Magic.name: Leprechaun Magic
Leprechaun Magic.description: Leprechauns love to use their magic to beguile others, and after generations of doing so, they've developed a strong connection to such tricks. When a leprechaun uses their innate spells to deceive, trick, or humiliate a creature, the spell DC increases to 20 and the attack modifier to +12.

Create Object.name: Create Object
Create Object.description:
Frequency three times per day

Effect The leprechaun produces an item out of their hat, from behind their jacket, from within a hole in a tree stump, or from any other unexpected location. This conjured item must be no more than 1 Bulk and must be made of relatively commonplace material (such as cloth, wood, stone, or even low-value metal like iron or lead). It can't rely on intricate artistry or complex moving parts, never fulfills a Cost or the like, and can't be made of precious materials or materials with a rarity of uncommon or higher. The created object is temporary and lasts for 1 hour or until the leprechaun creates a new item, whichever comes first.

Leprechaun.name: Leprechaun
Leprechaun.publicNotes:
Leprechauns are mostly jovial tricksters who prefer mischief over conflict. They fill their days with as much fun, wine, and food as possible. Mostly found in forested regions, leprechauns respect nature and those who protect it.

Leprechauns do not attack on sight. Rather, they engage in conversation and try to charm, cajole, or trick those they meet into doing favors for them or freely giving over a treasured item, usually in return for illusory wealth or false promises of wealth and success. These small tricksters are masters at discerning the desires of those they meet-a knack that puts them in a powerful position when bargaining for goods or favors. They aren't above turning people against each other for their own benefit but generally not to an extent that causes harm.

In most cases, a leprechaun doesn't keep a purloined possession for long. The leprechaun most often returns such stolen prizes just in time to defuse tensions, often as they point out the humor of the situation, hoping to share their amusement and mirth with the victim. In cases where a leprechaun's trick goes too far and results in an incensed victim, the leprechaun quickly flees the conflict rather than engage in combat. This willingness to return stolen goods or to flee from battles fades as leprechauns grow older. Ancient leprechauns who have lived for thousands of years often spiral into dark bitterness and increasingly use their powers and illusions to lure those who offend them or fail to appreciate a joke into danger... or even death.

Brood Leech Swarm.name: Brood Leech Swarm
Brood Leech Swarm.publicNotes: Most smaller species of leeches do not tend to swarm, but brood leeches are prone to gathering in seething, undulant mats of squirming gluttony. When they gather in sufficient numbers to swarm, they eschew the stealth of a lone leech's feeding methods in favor of swift and merciless feeding. In these situations, their mild venom can affect much larger creatures than their usual prey.

Blood Draining Bites.name: Blood Draining Bites
Blood Draining Bites.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[2d6[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save). A creature who fails the Reflex save also takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,bleed]] damage and is exposed to brood leech swarm venom.

Brood Leech Swarm Venom.name: Brood Leech Swarm Venom
Brood Leech Swarm Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:21]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}, and -5-foot status penalty to Speed (1 round)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}, and -10-foot status penalty to Speed (1 round).

Goblin Snake.name: 地精蛇 Goblin Snake
Goblin Snake.publicNotes:
地精蛇有时候会驯养蛇作为宠物或伙伴。

地精蛇是一种散发恶臭的蛇形生物，全身覆盖油腻的黑色鳞片，口中布满獠牙，长着酷似地精的无唇头颅。

Coiled Strike.name: 盘绕打击 Coiled Strike
Coiled Strike.description: 如同@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.W7SbTykXrNwxDzJc]，但地精蛇只能在盘绕后使用此反应。

Coil.name: 盘绕 Coil
Coil.description: 地精蛇使用一个动作将自身盘绕起来，使其尖牙的船机范围从5尺提升至10尺。在地精蛇使用其尖牙打击后，它变为未盘绕。

Goblin Breath.name: 地精吐息 Goblin Breath
Goblin Breath.description: 地精蛇喷出一团@Template[type:cone|distance:15]范围的恶臭蒸汽。蒸汽范围内的非地精生物必须成功通过一次@Check[fortitude|dc:16]豁免，否则将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}。大失败时，生物在处于恶心状态期间还将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}。成功豁免的生物免疫24小时。地精蛇在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Goblin Breath]]{1d4轮}内不能再次使用地精吐息。

Requiem Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: 青年安魂龙施法者 Requiem Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)
Requiem Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes: 安魂龙是灵魂之河（River of Souls）的守护者，负责引导灵魂抵达其在来世的最终归宿。灵魂的安全旅程对安魂龙至关重要，一些安魂龙会从灵魂首次进入灵魂之河开始，直到它们在骨园的审判，最终引导灵魂到达它们最终的安息之地。大多数安魂龙将自己与特定的位面绑定，负责守护所有进入该位面的灵魂，导致这些龙与天堂或地狱等地方相关联，尽管这些龙从不对这些位面宣誓效忠。安魂龙将它们的巢穴建在灵魂之河沿岸——这些巢穴是从其他位面拯救出来的沉重建筑拼接而成——并充满了无价的记录和伟大成就的纪念物。

Soul Journey.name: 灵魂之旅 Soul Journey
Soul Journey.description: 安魂龙花费1小时穿越位面通道进入灵魂之河，然后可以到达灵魂之河的任意位置。这具备@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5bTt2CvYHPvaR7QQ]效果，但安魂龙能够精确到达任何主要位面上的地点。

Status Sight.name: 状态视觉 Status Sight
Status Sight.description: 安魂龙会自动知晓它能看到的所有生物的生命值。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine.name: 对抗神术全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine

Soul Anchor.name: 灵魂锚定 Soul Anchor
Soul Anchor.description:
触发 一个60尺内的生物的生命值将降至0

效果 安魂龙将触发生物的灵魂锚定于其躯体，该生物的生命值保持在1点，陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 2}，并获得与安魂龙等级相等的快速治疗，持续1分钟。该生物在24小时内暂时免疫灵魂锚定效果。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.k8bmDh3nWi2FUyz5]

Withhold Death.name: 阻止死亡 Withhold Death
Withhold Death.description:
触发 安魂龙被一次攻击重击

效果 安魂龙抵抗灵魂的松动，减少部分伤害。安魂针对触发攻击获得10点所有伤害类型的抗力。

Dooming Breath.name: 毁灭吐息 Dooming Breath
Dooming Breath.description: 安魂龙从口中喷出来自创生熔炉的能量，在@Template[type:line|distance:60]范围内造成@Damage[9d8[spirit]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。豁免失败的不死生物还必须成功通过@Check[will|dc:30|options:area-effect,inflicts:doomed]豁免，否则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 1}。如果目标已陷入毁灭，则毁灭值增加1（最多为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 4}）。安魂龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Dooming Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用毁灭吐息。

Requiem Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. divine

Soulrider (Fiend).name: Soulrider (Fiend)
Soulrider (Fiend).publicNotes:
Although soulriders can grow quite large, most of them are narrow creatures only a few feet long. Even once they've attached to a soul and passed between planes, they must complete their adaptation to the new environment before beginning their growth.

These smallest soulriders might be found anywhere in the mortal Universe with a portal to the Outer Sphere or a history of summoning magic. Large batches of spawn in the wilderness are often culled by natural predators, but individual spawn can survive for years and travel many miles as they search for a host.

Resembling a lamprey or hagfish with a long whiplike tail, a soulrider uses its harmless sucker to hitch rides on a creature's soul. This seemingly simple connection transcends the physical, attaching directly to the host's soul and even riding along with the soul to its final destination. Once there, a soulrider leaves its host to absorb the surrounding planar energies, adapting to the new environment and growing large enough to produce spawn.
