Tongue Grab.description: A creature hit by the giant frog's tongue becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the giant frog. The creature isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, but it can't move beyond the reach of the frog's tongue. A creature can sever the tongue with a Strike against AC 13 that deals at least 2 slashing damage. This deals no damage to the frog but prevents it from using its tongue Strike until it regrows its tongue, which takes a week.

Wemmuth.name: 血棘藤 Wemmuth
Wemmuth.publicNotes:
在血流成河的战场或被围困的城市周围饱受战争摧残的地区里，大量的鲜血浇灌了血棘藤，这是一种肮脏的蔓藤，从人类的苦难中汲取养分，像吸水一样吸收血液。血棘藤拥有基本的智能和无法抑制的嗜血欲望，它们一生大部分时间都在伺机而动，在它们恐怖家园的血腥土壤中成长到令人难以置信的规模。血棘藤的藤蔓几乎只有普通麻绳粗细，但是成年的血棘藤拥有重达6吨重的藤蔓，把这些藤蔓拉直以后能达到6000尺长。然而血棘藤并不会把自己拉这么长，相反的是它们更喜欢将自己缩成一个15尺见方的巨大土丘。它会把自己压缩成一个一个由锋利的刺和捆绑着的藤蔓组成的球体，就像一团可怕的、有大象那么大的风滚草。它们通常会从地上挖出巨大的石块或整棵树，然后将它们整合进滚动的躯体，用这些东西来增强防御能力，抵御不同形式的攻击，或者以令人恐惧的精准度将它们扔向远方的敌人。

一些人猜测，血棘藤本质是一种恶魔腐化，是由切利亚斯的斯戎家族（House Thrune of Cheliax）释放到格拉利昂的，也许是一种对抗对手的焦土战术。涅玛萨斯（Nirmathas）和摩尔苏恩（Molthune）的具有影响力的贵族们都指责对方创造出了这种怪物，涅玛萨斯认为摩尔苏恩和炼狱帝国切利亚斯（Cheliax）关系密切，而摩尔苏恩则把怪物诞生的原因归咎于涅玛萨斯众多德鲁伊和游侠所使用的的原能魔法。有几个瓦瑞希亚（Varisian）传说中的怪物和血棘藤的描述非常相似，这些故事直指一个著名的江湖骗子，而来自蒙蒂维（Mendev）的十字军坚持认为，血棘藤是前飞蝗寄主德斯卡利（Deskari）在被凡人英雄击败之前对格拉利昂释放的祸害。

Tremorsense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name: 震颤感知（模糊） 60尺 Tremorsense (Imprecise) 60 feet

Blood Leech.name: 吸血 Blood Leech
Blood Leech.description:
触发 血棘藤对一个生物使用紧勒并造成伤害

效果 血棘藤恢复等同于紧勒伤害的一半的生命值。

Thorny Mass.name: 荆棘缠身 Thorny Mass
Thorny Mass.description: 任何时候，当血棘藤10尺范围内的一个生物尝试对它进行一次近战攻击或尝试使用特技以@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.21WIfSu7Xd7uKqV8]穿过它占据的空间时，该生物受到@Damage[(1d12+10)[piercing]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:36|basic]豁免）。

Myceloid.name: Myceloid
Myceloid.publicNotes:
The ambulatory fungus creatures called myceloids are notorious for spreading deadly purple pox, controlling creatures' minds, and devouring humanoid flesh. For a myceloid colony, any battle with humanoids is cause for excitement, as this new fodder presents so many delicious possibilities.

Myceloids consider humanoids to have an ideal life cycle of four simple steps. During childhood, they wander naive and afraid, unaware of myceloid colonies. In adulthood, humanoids discover their true purpose as they taste purple pox and become enslaved by the myceloids' spores. Next, they die, giving rise to a new myceloid. They're then sent on to the afterlife upon becoming a myceloid meal. Eating humanoid flesh is not a necessity-a myceloid can survive on any decaying matter-but it's certainly a pleasure.

Myceloids rarely make alliances, but when they do, they invite their new allies to share a meal to seal the pact. Few outsiders appreciate this hospitality.

Most myceloids have deep purple caps studded with off-white lumps. Their necks and bodies bear resemblance to the stipes of tough, leathery fungi. Smaller mushrooms often grow on a myceloid's body, which the creatures view as either adornments or particularly convenient snacks. They stand roughly as tall as a dwarf, with comparably stout builds.

Telepathy 100 feet (Myceloids and Those.name: Telepathy 100 feet (Myceloids and Those Afflicted by Purple Pox Only)

Spore Pop.name: Spore Pop
Spore Pop.description: If a myceloid is reduced to 0 HP by a critical hit, it pops, forcing it to immediately Emit Spores, even if it has already used the ability that day.

Emit Spores.name: Emit Spores
Emit Spores.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The myceloid expels spores in a @Template[burst|distance:10] centered on a corner of its own space. This cloud lasts until the start of the myceloid's next turn. Each creature that is in the cloud or enters it is exposed to purple pox.

Purple Pox.name: Purple Pox
Purple Pox.description:
Myceloids are immune

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:20]

Onset 1 minute

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[6d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3}, and the creature is compelled to seek out the nearest myceloid colony-this compulsion is a mental emotion effect (1 day)

Stage 3 The creature dies. Over 24 hours, its corpse becomes bloated and bursts, releasing a new, fully grown myceloid.

Spore Domination.name: Spore Domination
Spore Domination.description:
The myceloid targets one creature affected by purple pox within 60 feet. That creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:22] save.

It is then temporarily immune to spore domination for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success Until the end of its next turn, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.v44P3WUcU1j0115l]{Helpful} to myceloids and can't take hostile actions against them.

Failure As success, but for 1 minute.

Critical Failure As success, but until the purple pox is cured.

Fen Mosquito Swarm.name: Fen Mosquito Swarm
Fen Mosquito Swarm.publicNotes: When deadly fen mosquitoes gather in large numbers, they form into lethal swarms capable of draining blood at a truly alarming rate. Fen mosquito swarms are typically encountered only in tropical swamps or bogs, but during humid months in spring or summer they can drift into riverine areas or even through the waterfront reaches of settlements.

Pyrexic Malaria.name: Pyrexic Malaria
Pyrexic Malaria.description:
The victim can't reduce its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened} condition while it's affected by pyrexic malaria

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:20]

Onset 4 days

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} (1 day)

Stage 5 dead

Swarming Bites.name: Swarming Bites
Swarming Bites.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[1d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic|options:area-effect] save) and is exposed to pyrexic malaria. Creatures that fail the saving throw also take @Damage[1d4[bleed]].

Urdefhan Tormentor.name: Urdefhan Tormentor
Urdefhan Tormentor.publicNotes:
Urdefhan spellcasters with a knack for the divine are invariably unholy worshippers of daemonkind, typically taking on one of Abaddon's Four Apocalypse Riders as their patron deity. With their unholy gifts, these urdefhan tormentors summon daemons into battle and bolster their allies with profane magic, preferring to stick to the sidelines rather than enter the fray directly.

The violent warmongers, occultists, and poisoners known as urdefhans dwell within the Darklands. They were created in eons past by the mysterious First Apocalypse Riders to serve as agents of the end times of the Universe. Urdefhans continue to honor their creators by worshipping the wretched beings who rule over the plane of Abaddon, and like their fiendish lieges, urdefhans exist for one reason and one reason alone: to kill.

While urdefhans are humanoid and dwell together in large groups, this is where their similarities to other ancestries end. Their visages are horrific, with transparent skin and musculature displaying their glistening entrails, gleaming bones, and perhaps worst of all, their baleful red eyes. This appearance, combined with their gaping maws full of sharp fangs, works to create the false impression that urdefhan are some sort of vampiric undead, not creatures of living flesh and blood. When an urdefhan's life comes to an end, their flesh quickly curdles and then bursts in a wave of awful corruption that spreads to the flesh of other creatures in the area. The typical urdefhan views their eventual demise as a disappointment, for once they're dead, their chances to kill will finally come to an end.

An urdefhan's translucent body allows onlookers to see the various organs and fluids within, while their blue blood often signals their mood and telegraphs possible dangers. The blood of an excited urdefhan ready to attack grows more vibrant and even glows with a faint light. When an urdefhan is prepared to meet their death and imminent soul detonation, their blood grows dark, almost black as pitch.

Urdefhans' primary concern is death and how to inflict it in the goriest, most painful, and widespread ways. Beyond this ethos of violence, urdefhans concern themselves only tangentially with matters such as formal modes of warfare or aspects of their damnable religion. When an urdefhan isn't actively engaged in violence, their giddy cruelty is tempered by only a sense of self-preservation that ensures they survive long enough to spread the "blessings" of their daemonic patrons. They pass the time between wars inventing new weapons, developing new diseases, and researching awful new magic, all in preparation for the next inevitable conflict.

Necrotic Decay.name: Necrotic Decay
Necrotic Decay.description: When an urdefhan dies, their translucent flesh quickly rots away and sublimates into a foul-smelling gas that fills a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] around the body. This gas deals @Damage[5d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage to creatures in this area as their flesh curdles and rots (@Check[fortitude|dc:21|basic] save).

Stoke the Fervent.name: Stoke the Fervent
Stoke the Fervent.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The urdefhan lets out a battle cry, sending themself and their allies into a fanatical frenzy. The tormentor and each ally that hears the call gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, and saving throws, and takes a –1 status penalty to AC. Affected creatures must use at least one of their actions to Strike each round, if they're able (even if it means attacking an ally, object, or thin air). This lasts for [[/gmr 2d4 #rounds]]{2d4 rounds}.

Wicked Bite.name: Wicked Bite
Wicked Bite.description:
Requirements The urdefhan damaged a creature with a jaws Strike on their last action

Effect The urdefhan maintains contact, turning the creature's flesh translucent around the site of the injury. The target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save or be affected by drain blood or drain vitality (the urdefhan's choice). If the jaws Strike was a critical hit, the creature is affected by both effects, using the same save result for both.

  • Drain Blood The urdefhan drinks some of the creature's blood. On a failed save, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and the urdefhan regains 5 HP (or, on a critical failure, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and the urdefhan regains 10 HP).

  • Drain Vitality The urdefhan draws out some of the creature's vital essence. The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 hour on a failed save (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 hour on a critical failure).

Strix Kinmate.name: 枭鬼盟亲 Strix Kinmate
Strix Kinmate.publicNotes:
盟亲之间有着深厚的羁绊，并且极擅长团队协作。

枭鬼在自己的语言中被称为"伊塔瑞"（itarii），他们是一种有着鸟类特征的类人生物，生有宽长的黑色羽翼与尖锐的利爪。枭鬼们长有棱角分明的五官，其锐利的双目始终固定向前。

Arrows.name: 箭 Arrows
Arrows.description: 这些箭头是弓的弹药。箭杆是木制的。一端是羽毛保持飞行中的平稳，另一端是金属头。

Strix Camaraderie.name: 枭鬼情谊 Strix Camaraderie
Strix Camaraderie.description: 枭鬼盟亲之间有着很深的联系，因而善于团队合作，以支援彼此的进攻。若敌人同时位于该枭鬼盟亲以及其它枭鬼的触及范围之内，那么该敌人对所有这些枭鬼@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]。

Strix Vengeance.name: 枭鬼回头 Strix Vengeance
Strix Vengeance.description:
频率 每10分钟一次

触发 枭鬼盟亲或一位他们所能看见的枭鬼盟友因一名敌人的重击而承受伤害

效果 在枭鬼盟亲的下一个回合结束前，枭鬼盟亲对触发敌人所进行的打击的伤害骰，获得额外1d6状态加值。

Shokasura.name: Shokasura
Shokasura.publicNotes: Shokasuras are tragic, wretched beings, broken by their despair at the cruel truths of reality. Many were not originally asuras but instead began as other spiritual beings who realized all of their efforts only served to propagate an unjust and unsalvageable existence. Not yet willing to admit how deep the rot lies and not yet willing to commit themselves to unmaking all they once held dear, shokasuras instead constantly test mortals and force them to prove themselves, desperately trying to assuage themselves that there are people and things still worth saving within their present circumstances. These attempts inevitably lead to disaster, as mortals either fail the shokasura's impossible expectations, or the shokasura tests their chosen mortal to ruin.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The shokasura takes on the appearance of a Small humanoid. This doesn't change the shokasura's Speed or their attack and damage modifers with their Strikes, but it might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning). The asura typically loses their thorn Strike unless the humanoid form has a similar unarmed attack. This alternate form has a specifc, persistent appearance, which the shokasura can change by performing a 1-hour ritual.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Grieving Venom.name: Grieving Venom
Grieving Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:17]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d4[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d4[poison]] damage, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[1d4[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}, and the creature cannot use reactions (1 round)

Raven Swarm.name: Raven Swarm
Raven Swarm.publicNotes:
A flock of ravens is known as an unkindness. Certainly, the name lives up to its meaning when a swarm of ravens decides to work together. In most cases, a raven swarm like the one presented here won't attack larger foes, but when manipulated by supernatural forces or simple desperation born from hunger, an unkindness of ravens can be a surprisingly dangerous threat.

Few birds are as cunning and social as the raven.

Enraged Cunning.name: Enraged Cunning
Enraged Cunning.description: There are few things as dangerously persistent in the natural world as an angry unkindness of ravens. A raven swarm can hound its prey through most barriers. Simple latches, unsecured chimney flues, loosely shuttered windows, and similar obstacles rarely keep an unkindness away. A raven swarm attempts a Thievery check to bypass many of these simple obstructions, typically against DC 20.

Swarming Beaks.name: Swarming Beaks
Swarming Beaks.description: The ravens' angry pecking deals @Damage[2d8[piercing]] damage to each enemy in the swarm's space (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save). A creature that critically fails its save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} as the ravens focus their attacks on the target's vulnerable face.

Hippopotamus.name: Hippopotamus
Hippopotamus.publicNotes:
Typical adult hippos move quickly on land and attack stealthily in the water.

Hippopotamuses, or hippos for short, are semiaquatic animals that spend most of their time in rivers and lakes, but can thrive on land.

Deep Breath.name: 深呼吸 Deep Breath
Deep Breath.description: The hippopotamus can hold its breath for 5 minutes.

Capsize.name: Capsize
Capsize.description: The hippopotamus tries to capsize an adjacent aquatic vessel of its size or smaller. The hippopotamus must succeed at an Athletics check with a DC of 25 (reduced by 5 for each size smaller the vessel is than the hippo) or the pilot's Sailing Lore DC, whichever is higher.

Grisantian Lion.name: Grisantian Lion
Grisantian Lion.publicNotes:
The appearance of the mighty grogrisant is a once-in-a-generation event, but the descendants of those legendary beasts are well known along the World's Edge Mountains and throughout Taldor. These primal predators don't travel in a pride as mundane lions do. Instead, they avoid others of their kind, even to mate, and seek out ordinary lions once a year for this purpose. A grisantian lioness who bears cubs only tends her offspring long enough for them to become self-sufficient—which takes but a few months, thanks to their kind's incredibly rapid growth and development.

A full-grown grisantian lion is as large as an elephant and exceedingly aggressive, hunting anything it comes across. While ordinary lions rely on stealth and pack tactics to secure a meal, the grisantian lion is too big to hide amid tall grass. Instead, it has adapted to the mountains, where it chooses a large, hard-to-reach cave as its home, often killing any creature unfortunate enough to already inhabit the place. A grisantian lion can track for miles and is a canny hunter, hiding along rocky cliffs and outcroppings as it stalks prey.

Although they're wild creatures that can never be tamed, grisantian lions understand Taldane and occasionally agree to help those who defend nature. However, such alliances are temporary and unreliable at best.

Blinding Mane.name: Blinding Mane
Blinding Mane.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Drawing upon the power of their grogrisant ancestor, the grisantian lion focuses and causes their mane to glow with bright light. All creatures within 20 feet must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:29] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} until its next turn begins.

Failure The target is blinded for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The target is blinded permanently.

Dual Pounce.name: Dual Pounce
Dual Pounce.description: The grisantian lion Strides and makes two claw Strikes against the same creature at the end of that movement. Each attack counts against the grisantian lion's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after the grisantian lion makes both attacks. If both attacks hit, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.

Rend.name: 撕裂 Rend
Rend.description:
claw.

If the grisantian lion Rends after a successful Dual Pounce, combine the Rend's damage with that from the Dual Pounce for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Rend]

Vicious Rend.name: Vicious Rend
Vicious Rend.description:
Trigger The grisantian lion uses Rend

Effect The target's armor takes damage equal to the damage from Rend. The target can attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:29|basic] save to reduce this damage.

Girtablilu Seer.name: Girtablilu Seer
Girtablilu Seer.publicNotes:
The highest position of authority in a girtablilu community is the group's religious leader. This sacred duty requires years of study, meditation, and dedication to awaken a mystical font of divine magic within the girtablilu. These seers ensure that every action taken by the community falls in line with even the most obscure dogma of their tradition, and they don't hesitate to turn their fury on members of their own community who violate their mandates.

Girtablilus are desert-dwelling guardians with the upper bodies of muscular humanoids and the lower bodies of massive scorpions. They are most often found defending ancient temples and religious artifacts with zealous fervor. Some believe they were created by a long-dead god millennia ago to act as guardians, but girtablilus consider the subject of their origin taboo and refuse to address the theory.

Because girtablilus accept a wide range of religions and belief systems, some outsiders believe they also worship their own ancient pantheon. In truth, girtablilus exclusively revere and protect sites dedicated to deities considered lost to civilization. In this way, they act as preservers of holy practices that have otherwise been forgotten beneath the desert's shifting sands.

Though girtablilus are used to explorers seeking entrance to the sites they defend, they might welcome those who earnestly wish to learn or offer reverence. Some even proudly share their beliefs with others, eager for the opportunity to preach to someone new. They show no mercy, however, to those who attempt to desecrate the sites and objects of their worship, or to those who would violate the tenets of their faith.

Girtablilus are skilled fighters who keep trained giant scorpions as pets, and they remain unmatched when it comes to fighting in the desert. They require relatively little food or water, and they rely on their stamina to outlast their enemies. When necessary, they can stalk their quarry for days or even weeks, coordinating with their pets to drive their prey in circles. Once exhausted, few foes can stand up to a girtablilu's physical prowess—or to their deadly venom.

Divine Aegis.name: Divine Aegis
Divine Aegis.description:
Trigger The girtablilu seer attempts a saving throw against a magical effect but hasn't rolled yet

Effect The seer summons divine energy to protect themself at the cost of their other magical defenses. Until the start of their next turn, they gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against non-divine magical effects and a –1 circumstance penalty to saves against divine effects.

Desert Passage.name: Desert Passage
Desert Passage.description: A girtablilu ignores natural difficult terrain in the desert.

Girtablilu Venom.name: Girtablilu Venom
Girtablilu Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:30]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and enfeebled 1 (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Spear Frog.name: Spear Frog
Spear Frog.publicNotes:
The spear frog is named for its toxin, which is traditionally used to envenom thrown projectiles like spears and daggers.

Frogs that are poisonous or grow to monstrous size can be a menace to adventurers.

Toxic Skin.name: Toxic Skin
Toxic Skin.description: Anytime a creature touches the spear frog or an adjacent creature Strikes the spear frog with a melee attack, that creature is exposed to spear frog venom.

Spear Frog Venom.name: Spear Frog Venom
Spear Frog Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:15]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d4[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Sticky Feet.name: Sticky Feet
Sticky Feet.description: Spear frogs are not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} when Balancing on a narrow surface, and they gain a +4 circumstance bonus to Reflex saves to avoid falling.

Giant Jellyfish.name: Giant Jellyfish
Giant Jellyfish.publicNotes:
Unlike its smaller cousins, the giant jellyfish is an active predator that chases down its prey through reefs or open water. It can even squeeze its enormous bell-shaped body into the tight confines of shipwrecks to drape its mane of tentacles across the exposed flesh of its prey.

Many varieties of jellyfish drift through the world's oceans, feeding on fish and other tiny marine creatures. However, deadly species of monstrous jellyfish pose a threat to unwary swimmers and sailors alike. Note that while jellyfish are animals, they also have the mindless trait because they lack a centralized nervous system.

Jellyfish Venom.name: Jellyfish Venom
Jellyfish Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:25]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d10[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} (1 round)

Squeeze.name: Squeeze
Squeeze.description: A giant jellyfish can fit into tight spaces as if it were a Medium creature. It can move at its full Speed while @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeezing}.

Hungry Ghost.name: 饥饿幽灵 Hungry Ghost
Hungry Ghost.publicNotes:
饥饿幽灵诞生自那些没有得到妥善安葬或坟墓被忽视的人。它们并不被束缚于一个特定的地点或物品，但却被强迫着抓住每个机会去做好事，希冀能获得青睐来帮助它们获得最终的安息。然而，它们以生命能量为食的需求往往与这一目标相冲突。

死后通过悬而未决的强大情感系于世间，如生前自我的悲伤回响一般，幽灵困扰着活人。

Living Visage.name: 生者假面 Living Visage
Living Visage.description: 当它们拥有超过30点生命值时，饥饿幽灵看上去就像一个活着的生物。它们在隐藏自己是不死生物时的欺骗检定结果和DC自动取34，并可以暗中使用以生为食（Feed on the Living）能力。

Feed on the Living.name: 以生为食 Feed on the Living
Feed on the Living.description:
饥饿幽灵触碰一个触及内的生物以偷走他的生命能量。如果幽魂正以生者假面示人，它们可以将此能力伪装成无害的接触并将效果延后1分钟，同时令目标不察觉此效果。一个生物一次只能受到一个延迟的以生为食能力影响，如果那个幽灵在延迟的一分钟内失去了生者假面，那么正在延迟的以生为食能力也会丢失。当以生为食生效时，目标受到@Damage[(2d8+4)[void]]伤害，取决于他们的@Check[fortitude|dc:24]豁免结果。

大成功 目标的生命能量压倒了幽灵。饥饿幽灵受到@Damage[5[vitality]]伤害，目标不受影响

成功 目标受到一半伤害，饥饿幽灵恢复等同于此能力造成伤害的HP

失败 目标受到全部伤害并获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 1}，持续1分钟。饥饿幽灵恢复等同于此能力造成伤害的HP

大失败 目标受到两倍伤害并获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 2}，持续1分钟。饥饿幽灵恢复等同于此能力造成伤害的HP

Ravenous Undoing.name: 贪饿毁灭 Ravenous Undoing
Ravenous Undoing.description: 每24小时内，饥饿幽灵必须使用以生为食（Feed on the Living）能力来吞食30HP（任何幽灵将会得到的HP都会计入这个数额，哪怕幽灵因为已经有了够多的生命值而未恢复生命）。如果幽灵没有吞食足够的HP，他们就会盲目而不计后果地吞噬任何它们遇到的生物，直到吃饱为止。

Rejuvenation.name: 复生 Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: 一旦被摧毁，饥饿幽灵在[[/gmr 2d4 #days]]{2d4天}后完全恢复，出现于它们最后一次被摧毁的地方。它们只有被妥善安葬，坟墓得到清理并维护至少一年，或者被法莱斯玛判定得到救赎时，它们才会被永久摧毁。

Ganzi Martial Artist.name: Ganzi Martial Artist
Ganzi Martial Artist.publicNotes:
Children of primeval chaos, ganzis intertwine the churning pandemonium of the Maelstrom with the more mundane tumult of mortal life. Some arise in bloodlines touched by creatures of the Maelstrom in generations previous, while others are changed by planar friction seething upon the shores of creation, but all share the essence of anarchy in their blood and bone.

Due to their connection to the Maelstrom, ganzis vary wildly in appearance; the most common proteankin have patches of scales and feathers and mischievous, slithering tails. Others might have stranger features, such as horns, glowing orange eyes, or limbs flickering with harmless auras of entropic energy. Ganzis might be dramatically shorter, taller, thinner, or stouter than is typical for their ancestry, and it's not uncommon for them to be mistaken for more common nephilim.

Independent-minded to a fault, often creative and capricious, ganzis prefer professions that allow them to serve as their own masters. If such a profession gives a ganzi opportunity to baffle or befuddle Golarion's more staid citizens, then all the better. Ganzis frequently develop reputations as outgoing, deviant, or thrill-seeking, and many heartily embrace these reputations and lean into them. Of all the planar scions, ganzis are among the most likely to take up life as wanderers.

Ganzis with a taste for close combat are sometimes drawn to martial arts, turning their curious forms into potent and unexpected weapons. It's common to find such ganzi in the temporary employ of others, whether out of a legitimately shared ideology or simply the need for money. Just as often, though, one can simply find a ganzi martial artist demonstrating their craft on a street corner or dealing out justice to enforcers of cruel laws.

Nephilim are individuals infused with the essence of an immortal being from the Outer Planes, such as a celestial, fiend, or monitor. While the examples presented here are humans with nephilim heritages that trace back to Axis and the Maelstrom, members of nearly any ancestry can be born with an influx of similar energies and become a planar scion. More about nephilim can be found starting on page 78 of Player Core, and other nephilim NPCs are presented beginning on page 266 of Monster Core.
Ganzi Martial Artist.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. controlled condition

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Controlled Co.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Controlled Condition

Ganzi Resistance.name: Ganzi Resistance
Ganzi Resistance.description:
The ganzi gains resistance 1 to acid, electricity, or sonic (chosen randomly each day).

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.PFeGCDFOo2AjI6ib]{Effect: Ganzi Resistance}

Ganzi Spells.name: Ganzi Spells
Ganzi Spells.description:
Two of the following chosen at random each day using [[/gmr 1d12 #Spell Selection]]{1d12}

  1. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9h9YCncqah6VNsKf]{Acid Grip}
  2. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.3JG1t3T4mWn6vTke]{Blur}
  3. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2qGqa33E4GPUCbMV]{Humanoid Form}
  4. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2oH5IufzdESuYxat]{Illusory Object}
  5. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.XXqE1eY3w3z6xJCB]{Invisibility}
  6. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.tlSE7Ly8vi1Dgddv]{Laughing Fit}
  7. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wzLkNU3AAqOSKFPR]{Noise Blast}
  8. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Mkbq9xlAUxHUHyR2]{Paranoia}
  9. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Fr58LDSrbndgld9n]{Resist Energy}
  10. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.jwK43yKsHTkJQvQ9]{See the Unseen}
  11. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.1xbFBQDRs0hT5xZ9]{Shatter}
  12. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.mrDi3v933gsmnw25]{Telekinetic Maneuver}

Flurry of Kicks.name: Flurry of Kicks
Flurry of Kicks.description:
Frequency once per turn

Effect The martial artist makes two melee Strikes. The martial artist applies their multiple attack penalty to these Strikes normally.

Handspring Kick.name: Handspring Kick
Handspring Kick.description:
Requirements The martial artist has both hands free

Effect The martial artist Steps, then makes a melee Strike at a –1 penalty.

Procyal.name: Procyal
Procyal.publicNotes:
As the most whimsical and playful of the agathions, procyals are the most likely to be encountered in the Universe, teaching deep philosophical lessons and delivering wisdom through pranks and impersonations. Mischievous and playful, these raccoon-headed humanoids love to socialize with mortals and learn about their societies. Unlike their mortal counterparts, procyals' fur starts off dark russet in color, giving way to gray and white fecks on their muzzles as they grow older. Only procyal leaders boast the stark gray and black coloration of a true raccoon. Those who recognize procyals' age and wisdom treat these creatures with great respect.

Whatever their natural appearance, procyals make excellent shapeshifters and can assume the form of any humanoid that they've encountered. They use this ability for only the greater good of that humanoid or their community, often appearing as someone's trusted mentor to deliver an important message in a more laid-back fashion than talking to a magical celestial raccoon. They're not above playing the occasional harmless prank on the person whose form they've assumed, especially when they can use it to teach a valuable lesson. Raccoon agathions prefer to use a blade if forced into combat, but they're prepared to use their claws and fght dirty if necessary.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The procyal can transform only into a specifc individual Small or Medium humanoid that they've met at least once. They can't transform into a generic member of a given ancestry.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Raccoon's Whimsy.name: Raccoon's Whimsy
Raccoon's Whimsy.description: Procyals' core value is whimsy, though unlike for chaotic tricksters, procyals' playful actions have a pattern and their pranks always come with a valuable lesson, even if it takes a long time to decipher the meaning. Receiving and growing from such a lesson requires at least 10 minutes of interaction with the Procyal but can take much longer. A character who learns from the procyal's lesson gains the benefits of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aid} reaction from the procyal once during the next month. Afterwards, they become immune to this effect from all procyals.

Phasmadaemon.name: Phasmadaemon
Phasmadaemon.publicNotes: The horrifying phasmadaemons make use of illusions and their own frightening appearances (that of serpents with bony tails, horned crocodilian skulls for heads, and several insectile pincers) to strike fear into the hearts of others. They represent deaths brought about by fright. Ultimately, any kind of fear can lead to the creation of a phasmadaemon, but a soul who transforms into such a fiend must quickly find other fears to feed on to build up their own strength. Without the nourishment of human fear, the newborn phasmadaemon begins to waste away, eventually "dying" and becoming planar quintessence. Only the most clever and capable phasmadaemons survive their initial hunger, learning how to prey on even the bravest souls as a result.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Unending Terror.name: Unending Terror
Unending Terror.description: Escaping fear near a phasmadaemon is no simple task. Creatures don't automatically reduce their @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition while they are within the phasmadaemon's Frightful Presence aura. Instead, they must attempt a Will save at the end of their turn against the DC of the effect that caused the condition. On a success, the creature's frightened condition is reduced by 1.

Consume Fear.name: Consume Fear
Consume Fear.description:
Requirements The phasmadaemon has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

Effect The phasmadaemon feeds on the creature's mortality and innate terror, dealing @Damage[6d8[mental]] damage. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:38] save.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage and manages to break free from the phasmadaemon's Grab.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and increases their frightened conditioned by 1, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and increases their frightened condition by 2, to a maximum of frightened 4. If the creature is already frightened 4, it must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:38] saving throw. If it fails, it's reduced to 0 Hit Points and dies. This effect has the death and incapacitation traits.

Inescapable Form.name: Inescapable Form
Inescapable Form.description: The phasmadaemon can Squeeze through tight spaces as if it were a Small creature. While Squeezing, it can move at its full Speed. The phasmadaemon can even Squeeze through spaces that typically fit only a Tiny creature, but does so at the standard speed for Squeezing.

Worm Prophet.name: Worm Prophet
Worm Prophet.publicNotes:
Even though they believe they'll dwell with their deity in the afterlife, when nearing death, some priests desperately call out to any gods willing to listen. The worms that consume such an ex-priest's flesh absorb these prayers, transforming into a worm prophet, a pious swarm strider that might worship hundreds of gods without calling any one its patron, perhaps collecting dozens of religious symbols or haphazardly tearing pages out of various religious texts and binding them into a contradictory new scripture. These creatures often lose whatever edicts and anathema bound them in life and instead hungrily seek to convert others to their hodgepodge faith—or "indoctrinate" victims by consuming those who won't join willingly. Worm prophets don't typically have reservations with entering their swarm form whenever they see fit.

All living creatures eventually become worm food. Yet if a creature perishes while gripped by overwhelming emotion or unfinished business, its flesh can become infused with those obsessions or a simple refusal to perish, infecting whatever detritivores feast on the body. As they feast, the invertebrates awaken to a type of collective intelligence, including some of the dead creature's memories and motivations. Once the body is stripped bare, the vermin swarm together and intertwine to recreate the dead creature's form out of thousands of wriggling bodies. These reborn are known as swarm striders.

Though many swarm striders are accidental creations, a few rare mortals purposefully transform themselves into swarm striders through powerful rituals. Most often, this process involves specially preparing a grave with ample scavengers and enchanting the site with occult magic to anchor their soul until it can live within the swarm. Through transformation, these intentional swarm striders seek out the power to slip past any defense or claim the virtual immortality of an ever-regenerating horde, as a swarm strider can reconstitute their form from even a single worm. However, the transformation inevitably scars the creature—often causing emotional detachment, the disintegration of old taboos, and a dissociated sense of self now that one mind has become a thousand. In their transformed state, even the best-intentioned swarm strider might embrace villainy and lose any semblance of their former selves over the span of many years.

Discorporate.name: Discorporate
Discorporate.description: When the swarm strider is reduced to 0 HP, their constituent creatures collapse, scattering on the ground under their space and each adjacent square. If even one of the creatures gets away, the swarm strider can eventually re-form over 1d10 days (potentially longer in areas where there are few invertebrates). The scattered invertebrates must be destroyed within 1 round to destroy the swarm strider permanently. The invertebrates have a collective pool of 40 HP, and the same AC, saves, immunities, resistances, and weaknesses as the swarm strider. The invertebrates can't take actions but they escape automatically once the round elapses. At the GM's discretion, clever means of trapping or eliminating the creatures might be sufficient to destroy the swarm strider.

A Thousand Mouths In Prayer.name: A Thousand Mouths In Prayer
A Thousand Mouths In Prayer.description: The worm prophet's constituent creatures whisper countless paeans to their gods. The worm prophet attempts to counteract (counteract modifier [[/gmr 1d20+24 #Counteract]]{+24}, counteract rank 6) an effect on a creature within 30 feet that's imposing one of the following conditions: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}, persistent damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied}. Once the worm prophet successfully counteracts an effect in this way, it can't do so again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge A Thousand Mouths In Prayer]]{1d4 rounds}.

Clinging Remnants.name: Clinging Remnants
Clinging Remnants.description: A swarm strider's melee Strikes and ranged Strikes made against targets within their weapon's first range increment deposit biting vermin on the target, dealing @Damage[3d4[persistent,piercing]] damage.

Draw Bugs.name: Draw Bugs
Draw Bugs.description: The swarm strider draws more arthropods from the environment around them to reconstitute some of their damaged body. They regain @Damage[15] HP. At the GM's discretion, the swarm strider doesn't recover HP in areas where there aren't enough arthropods to call to themselves.

Squirming Embrace.name: Squirming Embrace
Squirming Embrace.description: The swarm strider Strides. If they end their movement sharing a space with a creature, they deal @Damage[4d6[piercing]] damage to the creature, with a @Check[reflex|dc:32|basic]. The swarm strider can Burrow, Climb, Fly, or Swim instead of Striding if they have the corresponding movement type.

Swarm Shape.name: Swarm Shape
Swarm Shape.description: The swarm strider collapses into a shapeless swarm of their constituent creatures. They drops all items in their possession. In this form, the swarm strider can't use attack actions and can't cast spells, but they can move through areas small enough for their constituent creatures to fit without having to Squeeze. They can use the same action to coalesce from their swarm shape back into their normal form.

Atrixyl.name: Atrixyl
Atrixyl.publicNotes:
Very rarely, when sinspawn (Monster Core 310) sacrifce sentient beings to runewells, instead of sinspawn, an altogether different sort of aberration is created. Atrixyls are insectile humanoid warriors, whose powers are similar to yet stronger than ordinary sinspawn, and who are dedicated to destroying runewells and similar feshwarping artifacts. Some atrixyls seek to destroy runewells due to an imprinting of pain and suffering that occurs during their creation, seeking to prevent future suffering from runewells. Others seek to break a runewell and tap into its magical energies to gain personal power. This relentless mission has earned them the epithet "runebreakers," and brings them into confict with the sinspawn whose existences depend upon these runewells.

Atrixyls traverse Golarion's ruined wastelands in search of both ancient runewells and more contemporary feshwarping facilities.

True Sin Scent.name: True Sin Scent
True Sin Scent.description: An atrixyl can smell creatures that refect or generally revel in any of the seven sins as defned by the ancient empire of Thassilon (envy, gluttony, greed, lust, pride, sloth, and wrath) within 60 feet as a precise sense and can also distinguish between diferent sins and creatures. These typically include sinspawn and certain demons, though the GM ultimately determines which creatures are appropriately sinful.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的全豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Spell Break.name: Spell Break
Spell Break.description:
Trigger The atrixyl critically succeeds on a saving throw

Effect The atrixyl shatters the portion of magic that would afect them and uses it to empower themself. The atrixyl gains temporary Hit Points equal to twice the triggering spell's rank and a +4 status bonus to damage rolls for 1 round.

Absorb Sin.name: Absorb Sin
Absorb Sin.description:
Trigger The atrixyl reduces a creature it can smell with its true sin scent to 0 Hit Points

Effect The atrixyl regains @Damage[6d6[healing]] Hit Points.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The atrixyl takes on the appearance of any Medium humanoid. This doesn't change the atrixyl's Speed or their attack and damage modifers with their Strikes but might change the damage type their Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Insectile Agility.name: Insectile Agility
Insectile Agility.description: When the atrixyl Leaps, High Jumps, or Long Jumps, they can increase horizontal and vertical distances traveled by up to 10 feet. They also treat falls as 50 feet shorter.

Resonating Kick.name: Resonating Kick
Resonating Kick.description: The atrixyl makes a fist Strike. If the target is an aberration or is capable of casting spells from the arcane tradition, this attack deals an additional 2d12 force damage.

Roundhouse Smash.name: Roundhouse Smash
Roundhouse Smash.description: The atrixyl makes a fist Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within the atrixyl's melee reach and adjacent to each other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature hit. This counts as two attacks for the atrixyl's multiple attack penalty.

Coral Dragon (Ancient).name: Coral Dragon (Ancient)
Coral Dragon (Ancient).publicNotes: 珊瑚龙是守护广袤海洋珊瑚礁的原始守护者，珊瑚礁遍布于格拉利昂的各大海洋中。即便在龙族中，珊瑚龙也因其傲慢与虚荣而尤为突出，它们为自己覆满珊瑚的鳞片和所保护的五彩斑斓的珊瑚礁而骄傲。珊瑚龙喜欢装饰它们的珊瑚礁，它们视这些珊瑚礁为巢穴，常常用美丽的物品装饰，偶尔也会加入一些贵重物品，如金币。那些寻求珊瑚龙宠爱的人常会发现，这些龙容易被奉承所打动，尤其是当奉承与闪亮或色彩鲜艳的礼物相结合时，这些礼物能与龙及其水下领域的璀璨美丽相得益彰。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal.name: 对抗原能的全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

Biomineralize.name: 生物矿化 Biomineralize
Biomineralize.description:
触发 珊瑚龙被一个没有长触及特征的近战武器或无武装攻击重击，且该攻击造成挥砍或穿刺伤害

效果 珊瑚龙的伤口喷出一股血液，瞬间钙化为一根尖锐的珊瑚枝。珊瑚枝刺穿触发的生物，造成@Damage[8d6[piercing]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:38|basic]豁免）。豁免大失败的生物还会额外受到@Damage[1d4[persistent,bleed]]伤害。无论结果如何，珊瑚都会随后崩溃为尘土。

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 珊瑚龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击和一次尾扫打击。

Kaleidoscopic Display.name: 万花华彩 Kaleidoscopic Display
Kaleidoscopic Display.description:
90尺。覆盖龙体的珊瑚构造闪烁着鲜艳的色彩，令感官超负荷，迫使任何进入或在灵光内开始回合的生物必须进行一次@Check[fortitude|dc:36]豁免。无论结果如何，该生物暂时免疫该珊瑚龙的万花华彩1分钟。

大成功 该生物不受影响

成功 该生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]1轮

失败 该生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]1轮

大失败 该生物目盲1轮并目眩1分钟。

Reef Bond.name: 礁石契约 Reef Bond
Reef Bond.description:
每条珊瑚龙都与一个活珊瑚礁有神秘联系。如果珊瑚龙距离它们的珊瑚礁超过3英里，它们会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}且无法恢复，每6小时恶心值增加1，除非它们成功进行一次@Check[fortitude|dc:40]豁免。24小时后，珊瑚龙获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}；每24小时流失值增加1。

如果珊瑚礁遭受重大伤害，珊瑚龙会立即察觉到珊瑚礁受损的地点，但无法知道伤害的来源或性质。如果珊瑚礁被完全摧毁，珊瑚龙会立即死亡。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 珊瑚龙的打击重击时，恢复液压吐息的使用次数。

Hydraulic Breath.name: 液压吐息 Hydraulic Breath
Hydraulic Breath.description: 珊瑚龙喷出一股高压水流，在@Template[type:line|distance:120]范围内造成@Damage[18d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:38|basic|options:area-effect,forced-movement,inflicts:prone]豁免）。豁免大失败的生物被推离10尺并被击至@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]。珊瑚龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Hydraulic Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用液压吐息。

Reef Armor.name: 珊瑚护甲 Reef Armor
Reef Armor.description:
频率 每天一次

效果 珊瑚龙将自己包裹在一道保护性珊瑚壳中，获得50临时生命值，并在临时生命值被耗尽前对穿刺伤害和挥砍伤害具有10点抗力。效果持续1分钟，直到被摧毁，或龙解消效果。

Reef Meld.name: 珊瑚融合 Reef Meld
Reef Meld.description:
频率 每日一次

需求 珊瑚龙与它们的绑定珊瑚礁有物理接触

效果 珊瑚龙与珊瑚礁融合并消失，同时最多可带着八名自愿的生物进入一个异次元空间，在这个空间中既无法影响外界，也不会被外界影响。该效果无限期持续直到珊瑚龙解消为止。一旦融合，珊瑚龙可以花费1分钟移动并从其珊瑚礁上任意10英里内的点出现。

Swordkeeper.name: 剑守 Swordkeeper
Swordkeeper.publicNotes: 想要守护自己的魔法武器库的收藏家会购置或制造剑守。这些多臂的构装体既是展示柜也是安防系统，每个剑守内部仅能容纳一件武器，同时会向外投射所存武器的复制品武装自己，以此阻遏潜在的窃贼。

Central Weapon.name: 核心武器 Central Weapon
Central Weapon.description:
剑守的躯干内藏有一件武器，其等级不得高于剑守的生物等级。只要剑守还在运作，想要打开其中心的武器舱就需要通过四次[[/act disable-device dc=32]]{DC32贼活}检定来@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]；若检定大失败，魔法能量反冲将对尝试检定者造成@Damage[6d6[force]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic]豁免）。

若剑守@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]、@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]、@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]，上述两项DC均降低2。

若武器被取出，剑守的回响之刃将消失。

Colossal Echo.name: 回响巨刃 Colossal Echo
Colossal Echo.description:
需求 剑守拥有核心武器

效果 剑守投射出一把巨大的回响之刃，以四只手同时握住它，对@Template[type:line|distance:30]范围内的敌人造成@Damage[9d8[force]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic]豁免）。剑守在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Colossal Echo]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用本能力。

Echoblade Flurry.name: 回响刃舞 Echoblade Flurry
Echoblade Flurry.description:
频率 每轮一次

效果 剑守进行两次近战回响之刃打击。若两次打击命中同一个生物，在计算抗力与弱点时先将这两次打击造成的伤害合并再计算。剑守的多重攻击减值如常累计。

Project Echoblade.name: 投射回响之刃 Project Echoblade
Project Echoblade.description:
需求 剑守拥有核心武器

效果 剑守投射出一把回响之刃——其核心武器的力场复制品，造成额外@Damage[1d8[force]]伤害并获得投掷30尺特征。回响之刃继承核心武器的伤害骰，武器特征和符文，但不包含其他能力和需要启动的效果。剑守还能应用对应武器组的重击专精效果。剑守同时最多持有4把回响之刃；无人看管的回响之刃将在剑守的回合结束时消失。

Raise Guard.name: 举刃护身 Raise Guard
Raise Guard.description:
效果 剑守举起一把回响之刃来保护自己，其AC获得+2环境加值，直到它的下回合开始。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.LohrnRXCQ0yVt8MK]

Danava Titan.name: Danava Titan
Danava Titan.publicNotes:
Danava titans once regulated the foundational forces that shaped reality. Rebuked by the gods for being harsh and inflexible overseers, these spurned titans joined their siblings in the failed war against their creators. Defeated, the danavas were cast into the paralyzing depths of the cosmos's seas. The few danava titans who have escaped now wield the cold, darkness, and crushing pressure of their prisons in pursuit of their ancient visions of reality. Danavas split mountains, wake primordial beasts, or level whole civilizations in accordance with grand designs they forged at the dawn of time. Others hunt and harvest the balance-enforcing aeons, whom they see as usurpers of their divine responsibility.

Created by ancient deities long before the rise of mortal ancestries, titans united and attempted to overthrow their deific progenitors. The resulting war still figures prominently throughout mortal myths, in which most titans were cast down and imprisoned for eons.
Danava Titan.allSaves: +4 status to all saves vs. mental or divine

+4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental or Div.name: +4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental or Divine

Hadalic Presence.name: Hadalic Presence
Hadalic Presence.description: Creatures that fail their Will save against the titan's impossible stature aura also experience the crushing depths and darkness of the ocean floor. Such creatures see as if in an area of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4GE2ZdODgIQtg51c]{Darkness} (10th rank), and the titan can use their wavesense to detect such creatures as a precise sense, even if neither are in water. On a critical failure, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}.

Impossible Stature.name: Impossible Stature
Impossible Stature.description: 100 feet. Titans warp perception and distance around them to seem even larger and more imposing. A creature that enters or begins its turn within the emanation must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:46] save or its movement toward the titan is movement over difficult terrain (greater difficult terrain on a critical failure) for 1 round.

Relentless.name: Relentless
Relentless.description: The titan is as ever-moving as ocean waves. They're permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened}, and the extra action can be used only to Stride, Strike, or Sustain a Spell, or as one of the actions necessary to cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic}.

Roiling Rebuke.name: Roiling Rebuke
Roiling Rebuke.description:
Trigger A creature within 200 feet targets the titan with or includes the titan in the area of an attack, spell, or other effect

Effect The titan makes a benthic wave Strike against the triggering creature. If the Strike hits, the titan disrupts the triggering action.

Wide Cleave.name: Wide Cleave
Wide Cleave.description: The titan makes a melee weapon Strike against each foe within their reach. This counts as three attacks for the titan's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until all attacks have been made.

Draugr.name: Draugr
Draugr.publicNotes:
The risen corpses of sailors who died at sea, known as draugrs, reek of rot and decay from the briny deep. Their eyes glow with ghastly green light, and rotting seaweed, barnacles, and dead sea creatures cling to their bodies. Draugrs can't speak, but they express their malicious emotions with gurgles, as though they were eternally drowning with lungs full of water. They desire little more than to attack living creatures, especially those who sail the sea. Even when they go upon land, draugrs often drag the corpses of those they strike down back to the water, populating the depths with even more dead.

Draugrs rise in the haunted places of the sea, where restless spirits, swells of void energy, or supernatural storms deliver death. A corpse might rest at the bottom of the sea for some time before awakening as a draugr. Collecting detritus and organisms, the body becomes increasingly disgusting before it finally rises. Proximity to intelligent life can expedite this process, and an underwater explorer who happens upon a shipwreck might cause a body to suddenly return to unlife as a draugr. These undead don't take intrusions lightly, especially upon their place of death.

Though hateful of the living, draugrs are susceptible to reminders of their lives as mariners. In particular, a well-performed sea shanty or call-and-response work song might cause a draugr to become lost in reverie for a moment. The creatures have even been witnessed moaning along, unable to sing the words but providing haunting accompaniment. The lull rarely lasts long, though, as the beauty of the song quickly becomes a reminder of the tragedy that befell the draugr, reaffirming their desire for blood and death.

More powerful draugrs with burning red eyes are called draugr captains. They're 3rd-level creatures with the elite adjustment that can cast mist as an innate divine spell 3 times per day.

The Sea's Revenge.name: The Sea's Revenge
The Sea's Revenge.description: A creature that slays a draugr is subjected to a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.z2mfh3oPnfYqXflY]{Mariner's Curse} spell with a @Check[will|dc:17|traits:spell] save. The curse ends if the draugr is buried in a calm sea or after 1 week passes.

Grotesque Gift.name: Grotesque Gift
Grotesque Gift.description: A draugr's attacks spatter their targets with rancid flesh and rotting seaweed. A creature damaged by a draugr's Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:15] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

Swipe.name: Swipe
Swipe.description: The draugr powers their hate into attacking as many foes as possible. The draugr makes a melee Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within its melee reach and adjacent to each other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature hit. A Swipe counts as two attacks for the draugr's multiple attack penalty.

Shade (Plane of Fire).name: 残影（火元素位面） Shade (Plane of Fire)
Shade (Plane of Fire).publicNotes:
火魂灵的外观看起来像是由火焰组成的生前版本

当凡人死亡时，他们的灵魂将前往外环位面中的骨园（Boneyard），在那里接受死亡女神法莱斯玛的审判。一旦他们受到审判，他们的灵魂就会前往来世接受最终奖赏或惩罚，在这个过程中，他们会变成一种叫做"残影"的生物。这个过程会赋予这些灵魂一个新的身体，其身体的外形由它前往的位面的主要意识形态所塑造。残影的生前记忆几乎被抹去，只留下一些如同梦境般模糊的记忆碎片。无论残影生前的体型、力量或天性如何，他们在来世都是中型生物。

阴魂的存在可能会持续无数纪元，但这种状态并非一成不变的。神祇、浩瀚众界（Great Beyond）的居民、甚至位面本身都可能进一步转变残影的本质，通过将其转变为原始的精粹（quintessence），心魂要素（spiritual essence）被用于扩张位面的物理表征，或被转变为天族、魔族、观察者之类的新形态。如果残影死亡，他们的身体会在类似腐烂的过程中分解，他们的本质会回归至组成位面本身的精粹或元素中。这代表着灵魂之旅的真正终结——它们的生命精华与浩瀚众界的核心融为一体，被回收到创生熔炉中，为新灵魂的诞生提供能量。

Planar Incarnation - Plane of Fire (Fire.name: 火元素位面位面塑形（火魂灵） Planar Incarnation - Plane of Fire (Fire Pneuma)
Planar Incarnation - Plane of Fire (Fire.description:
所有残影都会被所在的位面塑造形体，并表现出位面的本质。他们的数据有如下调整。他们也可能获得和位面相关的生物特征。

火元素位面 Plane of Fire（"火魂灵"the Fire Pneuma） 火魂灵的外观看起来像是由火焰组成的生前版本

  • 语言 火元素语
  • 额外能力 免疫火焰
  • 近战 灰烬+7（火），伤害 1d8+2火焰

Tennin.name: 天人 Tennin
Tennin.publicNotes:
天人是天界工匠与优雅的舞者，它们在涅槃境（Nirvana）担任侍从，用云与霜为诸神织造奇妙的无缝衣袍，并在宫廷中以轻盈如露的空中舞步进行表演。在灾难性的战争与浩劫期间，天人会从涅槃境降临，修补伤痕，抚慰苦难。涅槃境的领域常常将尽职的工匠与忘我的音乐家这类品德高尚的灵魂晋升至织锦天使的行列，以便他们能用自己的才华为这个被战争席卷的宇宙带来美丽与仁慈。

天人的数量从未满足过抚慰整个世界的需求。而更为可悲的是，在古拉姆（Gorum）死后，它们的数量正日益减少，因为他的死引发并重燃了无数冲突。许多天使在这场纷争中陨落或迷失了方向。

equipment-Flawless Celestial Shawl.name: 无缝天衣 Flawless Celestial Shawl
equipment-Flawless Celestial Shawl.description:
每件无缝天衣只对特定的天人有效，是其不朽修行的结晶。饰带由比精金更坚固、比蛛丝更轻盈的天界丝线织成。天人可以从无缝天衣上抽取丝线，作为一套高级工匠工具和工坊来进行制作。该饰带可用于处理任何等级的珍贵材料。天人使用天衣进行任何手艺检定时，其结果视为比掷骰结果高一阶成功度。

启动—重织（Reweave） 3 天人使用饰带修复一件物品。此修复活动失去探索特征。

Spell Effect: Unfettered Movement.name: 法术效果：行动无碍 Unfettered Movement
Spell Effect: Unfettered Movement.description:
效果来自@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aqRYNoSvxsVfqglH]

你无视对你速度的环境减值。

Fingers Upon the Loom.name: 织机之指 Fingers Upon the Loom
Fingers Upon the Loom.description: 天人能侦测到穿着或持有任何衣物的生物，这视为60尺范围的精确感官。

Flawless Celestial Shawl.name: 无缝天衣 Flawless Celestial Shawl
Flawless Celestial Shawl.description: 每个天人都有其独特的无缝天衣。没有无缝天衣的天人无法使用其飞行速度或施放神术内在法术。

Secrets of Immortality.name: 不朽之秘 Secrets of Immortality
Secrets of Immortality.description: 天人可以用神秘技能替代医疗技能来[[/act administer-first-aid skill=occultism]]、[[/act treat-disease skill=occultism]]、[[/act treat-poison skill=occultism]]和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1kGNdIIhuglAjIp9]。

Five Color Dance.name: 五色之舞 Five Color Dance
Five Color Dance.description: 30尺。灵光内盟友穿着或持有的任何衣物或装备的硬度增加3，生命值增加20，破损阈值增加10。

Dancer Across the Heavens.name: 天际舞者 Dancer Across the Heavens
Dancer Across the Heavens.description: 天人可以快步进入困难地形，并可以使用其陆地或飞行速度进行快步。此外，当天人尝试进行[[/act perform variant=dance]]{舞蹈}的表演检定时，可以以一个自由动作来行走或快步。

Shade (Plane of Wood).name: 残影（木元素位面） Shade (Plane of Wood)
Shade (Plane of Wood).publicNotes:
木魂灵的外形如同由其凡人本体雕刻而成的木质雕像

当凡人死亡时，他们的灵魂将前往外环位面中的骨园（Boneyard），在那里接受死亡女神法莱斯玛的审判。一旦他们受到审判，他们的灵魂就会前往来世接受最终奖赏或惩罚，在这个过程中，他们会变成一种叫做"残影"的生物。这个过程会赋予这些灵魂一个新的身体，其身体的外形由它前往的位面的主要意识形态所塑造。残影的生前记忆几乎被抹去，只留下一些如同梦境般模糊的记忆碎片。无论残影生前的体型、力量或天性如何，他们在来世都是中型生物。

阴魂的存在可能会持续无数纪元，但这种状态并非一成不变的。神祇、浩瀚众界（Great Beyond）的居民、甚至位面本身都可能进一步转变残影的本质，通过将其转变为原始的精粹（quintessence），心魂要素（spiritual essence）被用于扩张位面的物理表征，或被转变为天族、魔族、观察者之类的新形态。如果残影死亡，他们的身体会在类似腐烂的过程中分解，他们的本质会回归至组成位面本身的精粹或元素中。这代表着灵魂之旅的真正终结——它们的生命精华与浩瀚众界的核心融为一体，被回收到创生熔炉中，为新灵魂的诞生提供能量。

Planar Incarnation - Plane of Wood (Wood.name: 木元素位面位面塑形（木魂灵） Planar Incarnation - Plane of Wood (Wood Pneuma)
Planar Incarnation - Plane of Wood (Wood.description:
所有残影都会被所在的位面塑造形体，并表现出位面的本质。他们的数据有如下调整。他们也可能获得和位面相关的生物特征。

木元素位面 Plane of Wood（"木魂灵"Wood Pneuma） 木魂灵的外形如同由其凡人本体雕刻而成的木质雕像

  • 语言 木元素语
  • 额外能力 8额外生命值，并且具有2点火焰和斧弱点
  • 近战 拳击+7（木），伤害 1d8+2钝击

Urveth.name: Urveth
Urveth.publicNotes:
An urveth is a massive, four-armed burrowing terror with a wormlike body and gaping maw that devours everything it can. Urveths burrow deep underground to hide from the sun, emerging under the cover of darkness to kill and consume.

Darvakkas, also called nightshades, are a ravenous evil made up of equal parts darkness and malice. Originally creatures of the Outer Planes who travel to the convergence of the Shadow Plane and the Void—where the power of nothingness obliterates them—these undead abominations are the physical embodiment of entropy. They burn with an intense hatred for all life, working to bring a final, dark night to the Material Plane where nothing but ash and ice remain.

As creatures twisted by darkness and shadow, darvakkas have a great aversion to sunlight and all sources of vitality energy. On the Material Plane, they spend the hours of daylight hidden below ground, amid ruins, or submerged deep in the ocean's darkest chasms beyond the reach of the sun's rays, emerging when darkness shelters them overhead.

Darvakkas have an aura of entropy that attracts undead thralls to serve as warriors and heralds. They rarely seek alliances with each other or other creatures, existing in solitude as the heads of individual armies of the dead.

Entropy's Shadow.name: Entropy's Shadow
Entropy's Shadow.description: 60 feet. Urveths leak entropy and corruption from their very being. A living creature entering or starting its turn in the aura takes @Damage[5d6[void]] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:38|basic]. If it fails, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute and pulled 10 feet toward the urveth.

Reactive Strike.name: Reactive Strike
Reactive Strike.description:
Claw only. An urveth gains 3 extra reactions each round that they can use only to make Reactive Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ReactiveStrike]

Sunlight Powerlessness.name: Sunlight Powerlessness
Sunlight Powerlessness.description: A urveth caught in sunlight is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}.

Frenzy.name: Frenzy
Frenzy.description: The urveth makes two claw Strikes and one stinger Strike in any order.

Swallow Whole.name: Swallow Whole
Swallow Whole.description:
Huge, @Damage[(2d10+5)[bludgeoning]], Rupture 35

A living creature that ends its turn swallowed whole by an urveth becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} or increases its drained condition by 1, and the urveth gains 10 temporary Hit Points. A creature whose drained condition increases to 5 in this way dies.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SwallowWhole]

Urveth Venom.name: Urveth Venom
Urveth Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:37]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d6[void],2d6[poison]]{3d6 void damage and 2d6 poison damage} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d6[void],2d6[poison]]{3d6 void damage and 2d6 poison damage}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[3d6[void],2d6[poison]]{3d6 void damage and 2d6 poison damage}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 4} (1 round)

Naari Pyrochemist.name: Naari Pyrochemist
Naari Pyrochemist.publicNotes:
Naaris' blood blazes with elemental fire. On the Plane of Fire, most naaris are second-class citizens who serve under the iron heel of the ifrits and their Dominion of Flame, but those born outside the ifrit hierarchy or who choose to flee it live lives of passion in search of fame, glory, and power.

Naaris are fond of fire, but this doesn't mean they all embrace fire's destructive nature. Those who seek more productive roles in a society might cherish fire's protective warmth and the role it plays in creation or cooking. Others find inspiration in the way flames flit and dance, and they pride themselves in their skills as acrobats or dancers. The church of Sarenrae particularly welcomes naari fire dancers, both in appreciation of their skill and to help ensure these naaris have a safe place apart from their more violent kin.

But by and large, naaris are drawn to professions and callings that allow them to indulge in the glories of fire. Naari pyrochemists apply this calling to alchemical teachings, seeing purity in every single bomb thrown or conflagration lit.

Infused Items.name: Infused Items
Infused Items.description:
A naari pyrochemist carries the following infused items, which last for 24 hours or until the next time the pyrochemist makes their daily preparations:

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.yd3kEK21YknZLlcT]{Lesser Alchemist's Fire} (5)

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.TZUskLT7yvP7N2co]{Lesser Elixir of Life} (2)

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.MoBlVd36uD9xVvZC]{Lesser Smoke Ball}

Quick Bomber.name: Quick Bomber
Quick Bomber.description: The naari pyrochemist draws an alchemist's fire with an Interact action and throws it as a ranged Strike.

Fuath.name: Fuath
Fuath.publicNotes:
Despite their small size, fuaths are shipwreckers incarnate. In the dark of night, these gremlins sever ratlines, slash sails, smash sextants, and soil provisions. Once the ship founders, the fuaths return to indulge their craving for land-raised flesh. While fuaths prefer to take their prey asleep, they save a terrible doom for sailors who attack them, surrounding the mariners' faces in magically congealed water to drown them where they stand.

Constantly dripping with water, fuaths have seahorse-like faces, seaweed-green fur over yellow skin, and wicked lobster claws for hands. Lacking the Sakvroth tongue, they have trouble relating to other gremlins aside from hanivers, but they revere sea hags and wicked aquatic fey.

Gremlins arose long ago in the First World, living embodiments of nature's ability to wear away, erode, and decompose. In the Universe, their encounters with mortal civilizations twisted them into creatures devoted to chaos, sabotage, and traps, each variety specializing in a particular brand of mayhem.

Vulnerable to Sunlight.name: Vulnerable to Sunlight
Vulnerable to Sunlight.description: A fuath becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (or increases its drained condition by 1) after every consecutive hour they're exposed to sunlight. Being submerged in more than a foot of water prevents the sunlight from harming the fuath.

Viscous Choke.name: Viscous Choke
Viscous Choke.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The fuath surrounds the head of one air-breathing creature within 30 feet in a magical film of viscous water for 1 minute. The target must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:17] save or it begins to choke and must hold its breath to avoid drowning. The film can be temporarily wiped away with a total of 3 Interact actions by the choking creature or creatures adjacent to it, allowing a new Reflex save with a +2 circumstance bonus to end the effect. (These actions don't need to be consecutive or made by the same creature.)

Drainberry Bush.name: Drainberry Bush
Drainberry Bush.publicNotes:
Drainberry bushes are floating bushes that originate from the First World, with long, thorny vines and dense clusters of bright-red berries. Their hollow thorns quickly siphon blood, which is how the carnivorous plants feed, and they rapidly turn consumed blood into fresh batches of delicious berries. They exude a faint white glow that's a result of stored vitality energy.

Drainberry bushes exhibit unusually high intelligence and have an astute sense of value. When creatures attempt to harvest their berries, they typically become insulted by the lack of bartering. Creatures that attempt to converse with drainberry bushes find the plants telepathically convey only short and simple phrases: most commonly, "Money please," "Deal good," "Deal no good," "Want that," (with a gesture toward an item it covets), "Thank you, customer," and if necessary, "No refunds." Though a drainberry bush considers the market value of its berries to be 25 gp, it greatly prefers interesting art objects as payment—even ones of significantly lower value.

Nature Empathy.name: Nature Empathy
Nature Empathy.description: The drainberry bush can use Diplomacy to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} on and make very simple Requests of animals and plant creatures.

Blood Berries.name: Blood Berries
Blood Berries.description:
The drainberry bush must drain blood from living creatures for sustenance. This causes clusters of bright red berries to grow among its branches.

Each cluster of berries lasts for 1 day, and a drainberry bush typically has [[/r 1d6+3 #clusters]]{1d6+3 clusters} when encountered. When consumed, a cluster restores @Damage[(2d8+10)[healing]] Hit Points. This effect has the healing, necromancy, and primal traits.

A creature can pluck a cluster of berries with a successful unarmed Strike or Thievery check against the bush's AC.

Consume Berries.name: Consume Berries
Consume Berries.description: The bush draws nourishment from one cluster of blood berries, regaining @Damage[(2d8+10)[healing]] Hit Points. That berry cluster wrinkles and dies.

Drain Blood.name: Drain Blood
Drain Blood.description:
Requirements The drainberry bush has at least one living creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} with one of its vines

Effect The bush squeezes all creatures it has grabbed, its hollow thorns piercing flesh and siphoning blood. Each creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:25] save or take @Damage[(2d8+10)[piercing]] damage and become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (double damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} on a critical failure). For every creature damaged this way, a cluster of blood berries immediately grows along the bush's branches.

Storm of Vines.name: Storm of Vines
Storm of Vines.description: The drainberry bush makes up to four vine Strikes, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the bush's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after the bush makes all these attacks.

Requiem Dragon (Adult).name: 成年安魂龙 Requiem Dragon (Adult)
Requiem Dragon (Adult).publicNotes: 安魂龙是灵魂之河（River of Souls）的守护者，负责引导灵魂抵达其在来世的最终归宿。灵魂的安全旅程对安魂龙至关重要，一些安魂龙会从灵魂首次进入灵魂之河开始，直到它们在骨园的审判，最终引导灵魂到达它们最终的安息之地。大多数安魂龙将自己与特定的位面绑定，负责守护所有进入该位面的灵魂，导致这些龙与天堂或地狱等地方相关联，尽管这些龙从不对这些位面宣誓效忠。安魂龙将它们的巢穴建在灵魂之河沿岸——这些巢穴是从其他位面拯救出来的沉重建筑拼接而成——并充满了无价的记录和伟大成就的纪念物。

Soul Journey.name: 灵魂之旅 Soul Journey
Soul Journey.description: 安魂龙花费1小时穿越位面通道进入灵魂之河，然后可以到达灵魂之河的任意位置。这具备@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5bTt2CvYHPvaR7QQ]效果，但安魂龙能够精确到达任何主要位面上的地点。

Status Sight.name: 状态视觉 Status Sight
Status Sight.description: 安魂龙会自动知晓它能看到的所有生物的生命值。

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine.name: 对抗神术全豁免获得+2状态加值 +2 Status to All Saves vs. Divine

Soul Anchor.name: 灵魂锚定 Soul Anchor
Soul Anchor.description:
触发 一个60尺内的生物的生命值将降至0

效果 安魂龙将触发生物的灵魂锚定于其躯体，该生物的生命值保持在1点，陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 2}，并获得与安魂龙等级相等的快速治疗，持续1分钟。该生物在24小时内暂时免疫灵魂锚定效果。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.k8bmDh3nWi2FUyz5]

Withhold Death.name: 阻止死亡 Withhold Death
Withhold Death.description:
触发 安魂龙被一次攻击重击

效果 安魂龙抵抗灵魂的松动，减少部分伤害。安魂针对触发攻击获得15点所有伤害类型的抗力。

Dooming Breath.name: 毁灭吐息 Dooming Breath
Dooming Breath.description: 安魂龙从口中喷出来自创生熔炉的能量，在@Template[type:line|distance:90]范围内造成@Damage[12d8[spirit]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:36|basic|options:area-effect]豁免）。豁免失败的不死生物还必须成功通过@Check[will|dc:36|options:area-effect,inflicts:doomed]豁免，否则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 1}。如果目标已陷入毁灭，则毁灭值增加1（最多为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 4}）。安魂龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Dooming Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用毁灭吐息。

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 安魂龙以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击和一次尾扫打击。

Draconic Momentum.name: 龙之威势 Draconic Momentum
Draconic Momentum.description: 安魂龙的打击重击时会恢复毁灭吐息的充能。

Soul Shield.name: 灵魂护盾 Soul Shield
Soul Shield.description:
频率 每日一次

效果 安魂龙利用其生命精华在60尺内的一个生物周围创造出一个精魂能量护盾。此护盾与生物建立了一个连接，效果与@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.d7Lwx6KAs47MtF0q]相似，区别在于该效果不会因距离而中断，并持续1小时。此外，该生物获得对物理和精魂伤害的5点抗力，适用于其所承受伤害的一半。安魂龙可以解消该效果。

Resurrection Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).name: 青年复生龙施法者 Resurrection Dragon (Young, Spellcaster)
Resurrection Dragon (Young, Spellcaster).publicNotes: 复生龙徘徊于生与死之间。它们精通命能，使得它们能够将死者复生，同时也精通虚能，能够赋予他人死亡。它们利用这些能力戏弄凡人的生命，召唤灵魂来帮助自己，或复生它们认为重要或有趣的生物。复生龙的巢穴通常是一个荒凉之地。虽然它们像其他龙一样囤积财富，但它们几乎不装饰自己的巢穴，财宝通常被存放在黑暗的角落里，仿佛它们对自己的财物毫不在乎。然而，复生龙倾向于保留从复生的生物或计划复生的生物那里得到的纪念物，而这些物品会特别安全地保管。

Reawaken!.name: 醒来！ Reawaken!
Reawaken!.description:
触发 复生龙能看到的一个活物死亡

效果 复生龙利用神术与生命能量将灵魂重新连接到已死躯壳。该自愿生物将在其下回合开始时复活，同时陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{濒死 Dying 1}状态。每个生物只能被此能力复生一次。

Risen Commander.name: 复生指挥官 Risen Commander
Risen Commander.description: 复生龙与它的仆从有着强烈的联系，复生龙每回合可以用一个自由动作维持@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9WGeBwIIbbUuWKq0]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.hghGRzOSzEl4UXdS]。

Siphon Life.name: 生命吸取 Siphon Life
Siphon Life.description:
触发 一个60尺内的生物使用了一个恢复生命值的治疗效果

效果 复生龙将命能从该效果中引导开，从而将其影响降到最低。触发恢复生命值效果的所有掷骰取最小值，并且任何恢复生命值的固定值（如两动作@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]的附加生命值）都会被减半。然后，复生龙获得1d8临时生命值，持续1轮。

Soul Siphoning Breath.name: 汲魂吐息 Soul Siphoning Breath
Soul Siphoning Breath.description: 复生龙释放一股神圣能量，在@Template[type:cone|distance:30]范围内造成@Damage[7d6[void]|options:area-damage]伤害（@Check[fortitude|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect]豁免），并从范围内的生物身上汲取生命之力。复生龙获得快速治疗5，直到其汲魂吐息重新充能。复生龙在[[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Soul Siphoning Breath]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用汲魂吐息。

Fire Wisp.name: Fire Wisp
Fire Wisp.publicNotes:
Fire wisps are sizzling spheres of flame and ash, perpetually crackling and shimmering with heat. They're carefree, boisterous, and quick to action—sometimes recklessly so.

Wisps are tiny elemental beings that emerged during the creation of the Elemental Planes. The first wisps roamed the Inner Sphere in shifting symphonies that traded members with their every meeting. These symphonies of free wisps created music out of their combined resonances, but when the wicked Elemental Lords realized the value of the wisps' resonance, they captured whole symphonies for use as servants.

Wisps attune to each other and to those they surround themselves with. This attunement makes them naturally supportive allies. Free wisps still roam the Inner Sphere and the Universe, but they're usually shy and hide themselves from strangers. However, they happily offer their service to those who show them kindness. They especially find themselves drawn to spellcasters who practice elemental magic; these wisps usually watch from afar but sometimes approach those who seem safe to become familiars or comrades.

Free wisps who find one another become close almost immediately. They get especially excited when they find wisps of elements other than their own, showing none of the animosity sometimes exhibited between elementals of different planes. Instead, they join in an excited dance, emitting resonances that faintly echo the symphonies of ancient days.

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: The fire wisp ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

Accord Essence.name: Accord Essence
Accord Essence.description:
Trigger An ally within 30 feet that benefited from the wisp's resonance in the last hour is targeted by an attack

Effect The wisp detonates themself in an elemental explosion. This grants temporary Hit Points equal to half the wisp's current Hit Points to allies within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} who have benefited from the wisp's resonance in the last hour. These temporary Hit Points last 1 hour.

A wisp that uses this reaction is permanently destroyed, and they can be restored by only a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} ritual or similarly powerful effect. If an ability would prevent the wisp's destruction (for instance, if the wisp is summoned and would merely be dismissed), Accord Essence has no effect.

Resonance.name: Resonance
Resonance.description:
30 feet. All wisps vibrate at a frequency attuned to their element, resonating with and empowering all creatures and effects sharing that trait.

A creature in the area gains a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls for effects with the air trait; a creature with the elemental and air traits gains this bonus to all attack and damage rolls.

In Concert.name: In Concert
In Concert.description: When a fire wisp rolls a critical failure on a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aid}, they get a failure instead, and when they roll a success, they get a critical success instead.

Shade (Abaddon).name: 残影（末日荒原） Shade (Abaddon)
Shade (Abaddon).publicNotes:
受食者的外观为它们生前形态的中型版本，并且需要时刻逃离邪魔的吞食

当凡人死亡时，他们的灵魂将前往外环位面中的骨园（Boneyard），在那里接受死亡女神法莱斯玛的审判。一旦他们受到审判，他们的灵魂就会前往来世接受最终奖赏或惩罚，在这个过程中，他们会变成一种叫做"残影"的生物。这个过程会赋予这些灵魂一个新的身体，其身体的外形由它前往的位面的主要意识形态所塑造。残影的生前记忆几乎被抹去，只留下一些如同梦境般模糊的记忆碎片。无论残影生前的体型、力量或天性如何，他们在来世都是中型生物。

阴魂的存在可能会持续无数纪元，但这种状态并非一成不变的。神祇、浩瀚众界（Great Beyond）的居民、甚至位面本身都可能进一步转变残影的本质，通过将其转变为原始的精粹（quintessence），心魂要素（spiritual essence）被用于扩张位面的物理表征，或被转变为天族、魔族、观察者之类的新形态。如果残影死亡，他们的身体会在类似腐烂的过程中分解，他们的本质会回归至组成位面本身的精粹或元素中。这代表着灵魂之旅的真正终结——它们的生命精华与浩瀚众界的核心融为一体，被回收到创生熔炉中，为新灵魂的诞生提供能量。

Planar Incarnation - Abaddon (The Hunted.name: 末日荒原位面塑形（受食者） Planar Incarnation - Abaddon (The Hunted)
Planar Incarnation - Abaddon (The Hunted.description:
所有残影都会被所在的位面塑造形体，并表现出位面的本质。他们的数据有如下调整。他们也可能获得和位面相关的生物特征。

末日荒原 Abaddon（"受食者" the Hunted） 受食者的外观为它们生前形态的中型版本，并且需要时刻逃离邪魔的吞食

  • 祝佑 邪秽
  • 语言 邪魔语
  • 额外能力 快速治疗5
  • 近战 1 拳击+7，伤害1d8+2钝击

Terror Bird.name: Terror Bird
Terror Bird.publicNotes:
Common terror birds are notable hunters. On their own, they use their great speed to catch prey unaware. In a flock, they can swarm and take down larger beasts like aurochs with their overwhelming numbers.

Terror birds aren't one species, but rather a family of deadly, flightless avian predators. All terror birds are capable of bursts of great speed and have powerful beaks that can tear apart the flesh of their prey. Most stalk large, open prairies and steppes, competing directly with other sizable predators such as big cats and wolves.

Sprint.name: Sprint
Sprint.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The terror bird Strides three times in a straight line

Tearing Clutch.name: Tearing Clutch
Tearing Clutch.description: The terror bird's powerful beak can tear through flesh. On a successful beak Strike, the target takes 1 persistent bleed damage. This bleed damage increases to 1d4 on a critical hit.

Giant Mosquito.name: Giant Mosquito
Giant Mosquito.publicNotes: These horrifically enlarged versions of the common mosquito often prey upon megafauna like dinosaurs and other large creatures, but they won't turn down a chance to drink the blood of a smaller target-such as a humanoid.

Blood Drain.name: Blood Drain
Blood Drain.description:
Requirements The giant mosquito has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

Effect The giant mosquito uses its proboscis to drain blood from the grabbed or restrained creature. This deals @Damage[3d6[piercing]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:24|basic] save), and the giant mosquito gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt that last 1 minute. A creature that takes any damage from having its blood drained by a giant mosquito is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} until it receives any kind or amount of healing.

Septic Malaria.name: Septic Malaria
Septic Malaria.description:
The victim can't reduce its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened} condition while it's affected by septic malaria

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:24|traits:disease]

Onset 1 day

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} (1 day)

Stage 5 dead

Shikigami.name: Shikigami
Shikigami.publicNotes:
Shikigami are made of paper and can easily transform between a flat cutout form and a three-dimensional doll of molded paper. Unlike most other kami, who are bound to their wards by a more powerful spirit or deity, shikigami are minor spirits that even mortal practitioners can sometimes bind into a tiny paper form and task with guarding small works, such as garden statues and vases. Landowners delight in having shikigami protect their gardens, whether they paid a wandering spellcaster to entreat the shikigami or simply had the fortune of another spirit assigning a shikigami to their land. Travelers who come across a shikigami-graced milestone or waypost believe that such encounters are good omens for the journey.

For their part, shikigami have mixed opinions on civilization and the humanoids who dwell therein. While shikigami will fight to protect their ward against invaders and desecrators, these kami are just as likely to leave—their ward in tow—if locals begin to despoil the area or show a disregard for nature. Most practitioners capable of binding a shikigami wouldn't engage in this type of disrespect, but should the kami catch wind of such practices, shikigami across the land might abandon their contracts en masse, leaving behind an uncomfortable vacuum with their exodus.
